subject: Full Calendar - Upcoming Events
body:
You don't often get email from calendar@fromdayone.co. 
Learn why this is important
 From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI.
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
April 3: Benefits That Fit Individual Needs Without Busting the Budget
Having made a commitment to recognize the unique needs of individuals, the secret is in the execution. What are the emerging benefits and rewards that workers are seeking, from fertility care to financial wellness? How can companies use technology to stay in close touch with what individuals are experiencing–and where they need help as a result? How can companies choose among myriad point solutions and innovative new platforms? What are the most cost-effective rewards in terms of investments and outcomes? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 4: Parents of Teens Need Support. How Employers Can Ensure Continuity of Care for All Families
While family-support services like fertility, childcare, and flexible scheduling have evolved over recent years into popular additions to benefit offerings, equitable support for parents and caretakers of teens has lagged behind. Since parents of teens make up one in five employees, why do so many “family friendly” companies fail to address their critical needs? Fully 95% of working parents report heightened levels of stress when thinking about their teens’ future and 88% admitted to using time at work to help their teens with college and career planning, with a quarter of them spending six to 15 hours a week. In this webinar, led by leaders at Empowerly, we’ll discuss how organizations can recognize and support the unique challenges faced by families with teens. We'll cover strategies for integrating support into existing benefits packages, training programs, and company initiatives, with a goal of fostering a culture that actively enhances the well-being of parents and their teenage children. 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
April 9: Chicago, IL - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 11: Elevate Employee Engagement: Smart Strategies for Thriving Teams on a Budget
Discover practical strategies to enhance employee engagement without overspending. Join our webinar to learn how to leverage technology, creative recognition programs, and open feedback to keep your team motivated and connected. Whether you're a startup or a large enterprise, we'll show you how to maximize engagement and productivity without breaking the bank. Register now to unlock the secrets to a more engaged workforce. 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 16: Developing Crucial Competencies Among Managers to Enhance Workplace DEI
To foster an inclusive environment, leaders must focus on refining specific skills, from addressing unconscious bias to developing cultural competency and utilizing inclusive language. What are the most innovative and immersive ways to build these skills, and how can leaders gauge their success? How can leaders move beyond conventional learning exercises to catalyze behavioral change and foster genuine inclusion within the workplace? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 18: How to Get Hybrid Right: The Cornerstones of Success
As hybrid work becomes a mainstay in the post-pandemic world, organizations grapple with new challenges like managing distributed teams effectively. Achieving the right balance between remote and in-office work is crucial for maintaining productivity, engagement and organizational culture. Enter ActivTrak — a powerful platform designed to empower businesses to navigate the complexities of hybrid work with ease. Join us for a transformative webinar where ActivTrak’s Productivity Lab will explore actionable strategies and insights to get hybrid work right. 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
April 23: Dallas, TX - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 25: How to Provide Fertility Benefits Without Breaking the Bank
Infertility is a common issue. According to the WHO, infertility affects one in every six couples who are trying to conceive at some point in their lives. Despite the magnitude of the issue, solutions for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment can be inaccessible due to high costs, stigma, and limited availability. What’s more, a new report suggests only 15% of employees have access to infertility coverage. Many employers want to provide coverage, but aren’t sure how to do so without overinflating benefits costs. In this webinar, leaders will share sustainable strategies for funding fertility benefits that can actually save employers on medical costs. 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 30: Talent Acquisition Strategies in 2024: Using AI and More for Hiring Efficiently With a Lean Team
Talent shortages haven’t gone away, so the new corporate emphasis on efficiency means that employers need more innovative approaches to attract, engage, and hire talent faster. This means the whole talent-acquisition team–leaders, recruiters, marketers and hiring managers– will need the tools, data, and tracking system to work together. What are the keys to building faster pipelines? How can employers nurture warm relationships with their prospects–at scale? What is the current best use of AI–and what's next? Join this webinar with Steve Bartel, CEO at Gem, the all-in-one recruiting platform powered by AI, to see how TA teams can improve their outcomes starting today.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 1: Building an Effective Talent Strategy for the Skills of the Future: a Case Study
The world of work keeps changing. This creates a challenging environment for organizations to hire and develop people with the right skills, at scale. In fact, 77% of talent leaders said in a survey that their strategy is more focused on agility this year, an 11% increase from last year. So, is your business hiring and mobilizing for the future of work? Join us for a fireside chat with Andy Nelesen, Global Head of Talent Acquisition Solutions at SHL, and Richard Chambers, Ph.D., Talent Director at General Mills, as they explore how enterprising organizations are embracing skills to maximize their hiring, talent management, and careers strategies. 
In this session, Andy will share SHL’s latest research on the relationship between skills and job performance. SHL has recently completed a meta-analytic study across global organizations to explore what key skills lead to outsized job performance and business impact. As it turns out, 12 critical skills have emerged. Richard will then tell how General Mills is leveraging skills to drive career development and maximize career growth–and how skills-based assessments are providing objective and tangible insights for employees and leaders to use together when building development plans.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 7: Redefining Recruitment: The Advantages and Challenges of Skills-Based Hiring
Skills-based hiring can be an effective way to expand the talent pool, reduce turnover, and improve overall performance when hiring an hourly workforce. What strategies can leaders employ to effectively identify and prioritize the specific skills required for their workforce, particularly when considering hourly positions? What are the key benefits of adopting a skills-based hiring approach over traditional methods, and what are the challenges to getting there? How can leaders ensure hiring managers have the education and tools to properly conduct a skills-based interview and approach? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 8: The Secrets to Boosting Remote-Team Productivity and Performance
To attract talent, employers need to offer remote and hybrid work, yet also need to create innovative arrangements that work for both the individual employees and the organization. Employees tend to think they're more productive working from home, yet research indicates that's not always the case. How to bridge the gap and ensure optimal performance? During this webcast, experts from ActivTrak will explore findings from more than 9,500 customers. As well as dashboards for measuring and improving productivity in the workplace. You’ll learn how to use these sources and tools to:
- Measure and improve productivity across teams and individuals using industry benchmarks
- Drive effective coaching conversations to maximize efficiency
- Quickly spot signs of disengagement and burnout
- Ensure optimal work balance among teams and individuals
- Identify opportunities for performance improvement 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
May 14: Minneapolis, MN - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 21: Excellence in Hiring: Designing the Optimal Employee-Selection Process
Designing an effective selection process is crucial for attracting and retaining top talent. This webinar will explore the key components of a successful selection process, from defining job requirements to evaluating candidates and making the final decision. Experts from Fountain, a high-volume hiring platform, will discuss how to leverage technology and data to streamline the process, as well as how to ensure that your selection criteria align with your organization’s values and goals. Whether you’re a seasoned HR professional or new to the field, this conversation will provide valuable insights and best practices for setting up a selection process that drives success for your organization. Join us to learn how to build a talent-acquisition strategy that helps you identify, hire, and retain the best candidates for your team. 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
May 22: The Art and Science of Employee Retention, Coaching and Advancement
While the pace of job-hopping has eased, employers have a powerful motivation to retain skilled workers, both for financial and cultural reasons. How can employers use new tools, including AI, to gain insights about what’s inspiring their workers to stay committed–or walk out the door? Since attrition is often caused by poor relationships with managers, what are innovative ways for employers to train their workers to be better leaders at a time when workers have higher expectations for job satisfaction? How can technology help make coaching more effective? 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
May 23: Manhattan, NY - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 30: Hiring Developers: How to Build a Nearly Perfect Tech-Recruitment Process
Realistic, fair, fast, engaging, effective, precise, structured, memorable, collaborative, skills-based, inclusive–can your tech-recruitment process have it all? When hiring developers, is there really such a thing as the perfect process? Probably not. But, this webinar can help you get close. Join our panel of expert speakers as they explore what an optimal tech-hiring process looks like and share real-life examples of the good and the bad. Ask your own questions during a live Q&A and leverage our experts’ experience and lessons learned to improve the way you hire developers.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 4: Paving the Way for All Paths to Parenthood
Studies indicate that 29% of LGBTQ+ couples are raising children, and 63% of millennial LGBTQ+ couples are hoping to expand their family in the near future. But, surrogacy typically costs $60-100k per child. If your current family building benefits aren’t built to support these expenses and every path to parenthood, they may not be inclusive enough to meet your DEIB, retention or talent acquisition goals. Join this webinar to learn how to evolve your benefits to be more inclusive, and ways to support surrogacy, egg/sperm donorship, adoption/fostering. 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
June 12: 
Bringing Talent Acquisition into the Digital Age
Despite layoffs making headlines now, all the demographic and digital trends point toward tough competition for workers in the future–maybe sooner than most expect. What are the new techniques and tools that talent-acquisition can use to envision the workforce their company will need in the future? What data and insights can HR and TA leaders provide to the company to be ahead of trends? How can companies do a better job of internal recruiting and promoting internal mobility? What are the best practices for hiring based on skills and potential, rather than credentials? 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
June 13: San Francisco, CA - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 27: Treating Substance Use With a Dedicated Program: A Case Study on the ROI of Compassionate Care ?
Substance-use disorder (SUD) is a top cost driver for employers, according to the largest study of substance-use treatment by the Centers for Disease Control. As a result, employers increasingly are seeking to incorporate SUD treatment into their benefit offerings through their EAP or mental health provider. However, a behavioral health strategy that doesn’t include dedicated substance-use management has significant shortcomings when it comes to efficacy and cost control. In this employer-focused webinar, we’ll explore why a leading health care system invested in dedicated substance-use management for their employees and the results they’ve achieved, focusing on cost savings, outcomes, and member engagement. This session aims to foster understanding of the complexities of SUD care and highlight the clinical and financial impact that dedicated substance-use treatment provides. 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 10: Learning and Development: How New Tools Are Changing Upskilling and Career Mobility
As employers put more emphasis on skills as the currency for worker development, they’re seeking new ways to measure them, fill in gaps, and predict the skills needed in the future. How can these new tools, including AI, create better matches between employees and projects? How can employers gain insights from the data they gather? Why do real-world simulations help measure certain skills better than traditional assessments? 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 17: Innovative Benefits That Support Healthy Families and Caregivers
As the pandemic’s caregiving crisis showed, employers found significant gaps in their support for the parents and other caregivers in their workforces. The resulting scramble to help has produced a wealth of new HR policies, benefit offerings, and management practices. Where is the greatest demand for support, as well as the most innovative new methods? What have been the most cost-effective ways to help caregivers of all kinds, including parents as well as “sandwich generation” workers caring for elderly and disabled relatives? 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 7: Employee Engagement: Using Technology to Gain Insight Into Work Needs and Ambitions
Traditional methods like town-hall meetings and surveys can be effective, but data and well-drawn insights can give top leaders a heads up about evolving patterns and trends in their workforces. How can AI and other technology be deployed in a way that brings new insights yet still respects privacy and the individual human factors at play? What approaches will bring employers new empathy for worker needs, ambitions, and well-being? 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 28: Pursuing Higher Productivity With Human Factors in Mind
In a competitive and uncertain climate, most companies need to do more with less. Yet if workers are their greatest asset, employers need to make sure the push for greater output is sustainable. What is the latest thinking about how to measure productivity, the means for stimulating it, and ensuring that workers have the energy to meet their goals–as well as thrive over the long run? 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
September 12: Boston, MA 
- Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
September 17: Support the Change: Why Menopause Should Be Part of Your Women’s Health Strategy
Offering solutions to improve and support needs specific to women can also be an important factor to retention. But a new survey reports that only 1% of US women have menopause support as part of their employee sponsored benefits. What’s more, according to a new survey, 85% of women said they don’t know enough about menopause, and 83% experiencing menopause report that their symptoms impact their ability to work. Join us for this webinar to learn how employers can better support women experiencing The Change, and the impact it can have on productivity, medical spend and retention. 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 18: Building a Corporate Culture That Workers Can Understand, Influence and Embrace
Company culture is amorphous yet vital–the shared beliefs, values, traditions and behaviors that drive the actions of individuals and the organization as a whole. Who should be the architects of a company’s culture and how should it be designed and constructed? How should the culture be communicated, broadly and in everyday actions? How should a company start out on a project to evolve its culture in a credible way? 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
September 24: Philadelphia, PA 
- Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 March 31, 2024
body:
Learning measurement e-book, engagement Leader Talk and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
This week, we're featuring content that will help learning and development (L&D) professionals amplify their business impact. From reengaging the workforce with learning to embracing modern training evaluation methods, these resources address learning leaders’ challenges and opportunities.
Our 
April 3 Leader Talk
 focuses on innovative training to boost engagement, while the 
April 25 Internal Consulting Workshop
 aims to enhance your strategic influence within your organization. Plus, our latest e-book and articles offer fresh perspectives on training evaluation, tips for making the most of AI, strategies for leading virtual teams effectively and more.
Dive in to discover strategies that not only drive business impact but also create a culture of continuous learning and engagement.
We’d love to hear your feedback — share your thoughts at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
. Have a great week!
Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor 
[Leader Talk] Engaging the Disengaged
This Thursday, April 3, we’ll be talking about reinvigorating workforce engagement through innovative training. 
Join industry experts
 as they discuss strategies for customizing learning to meet diverse employee needs, ensuring content accessibility and effectively measuring engagement outcomes. Learn how immersive tech, cross-generational approaches, motivational tactics and personalized learning can transform your L&D efforts. Don’t miss the chance to enhance engagement and retention with actionable insights from industry leaders.
Register Now
 
Training Industry Courses' Internal Consulting Workshop
L&D professionals like you play an important consulting role in your organization, offering strong, well-informed opinions around training to solve business problems. The Internal Consulting Workshop was created to help you partner with business stakeholders to facilitate a deep understanding of organizational challenges and goals. 
Learn more
 about this workshop and register for the upcoming session on April 25, from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. ET.
Learn More 
 
[E-Book] Learning Measurement for Modern Business 
Relying on outdated metrics to demonstrate training’s impact and gain stakeholder buy-in is so 2023. Our latest 
research-backed e-book
 provides a new framework for evaluating training that is more aligned with the needs of modern businesses. This e-book examines the International Organization for Standardization’s (ISO) 30437 recommendations for measurement in L&D and how learning leaders can best utilize their guidelines. Get the e-book for tips on measuring and demonstrating the true value of their training initiatives.

subject: USPTO fee increases; Google litigation data; Amazon brand protection results; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
31 March 2024
 
 
USPTO fee increases; Google litigation data; Amazon brand protection results; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
Ericsson senior IP rights and open-source researcher Eleftheria Stefanaki examines the terms and conditions of three of the most common AI tools on the market – 
ChatGPT, DALL-E 2 and DeepL
.
 
Monday 25 March
 
WTR explores the 
social media landscape
 for brands in Nigeria.
 
Plus:
Enforceable content of design registrations following new PTO guidelines: what you need to know
 (Brazil)
General Court: Veuve Clicquot's iconic orange shade has not acquired distinctive character through use
 (European Union)
 
Tuesday 26 March
 
Amazon seizes a record number of counterfeits and takes action against 21,000 bad actors in its 
latest Brand Protection Report
.
 
The USPTO outlines plans to “iteratively develop” a new trademark search system following 
complaints from users
.
 
McDonald’s and Krispy Kreme join up
, Meghan Markle faces a new brand challenge, Ford collaborates with Forever 21, and more.
 
Plus:
False alarm: the risks of groundless online takedown complaints
 (Canada)
Article 19(4) and the actions of trademark agencies: insights from the ZHAI DIAN SHE case
 (China)
 
Wednesday 27 March
 
WTR outlines five major 
IP developments in China
 that you may have missed lately.
 
The Korean Intellectual Property Office launches an IP trading council, IP India extends trademark deadlines and Turkpatent issues a fraud warning, in this week’s 
IP office watch
.
 
Plus:
Bone to be wild: the key to trademark distinctiveness
 (Australia)
SANODIN v SANOID, or the difficulties of protecting descriptive marks
 (European Union)
 
Thursday 28 March
Bosch looks to expand its 
Origify anti-counterfeiting technology
 to benefit luxury and fast-moving consumer goods brands.
 
The USPTO’s 
proposed trademark fee increases
 for 2025 risk stifling tech innovation, practitioners say.
 
Plus:
Benelux Court of Justice invalidates Dr Martens position mark 
(International)
Evolving trends in safeguarding GIs in Nigeria: an insight into recent developments 
(Nigeria)
Oppositions in the Western Balkans: what rights holders need to know
 (Market Insight: Western Balkans)
 
Friday 29 March
 
NBCUniversal settles 
its DeLorean spat
, Delta’s brand value rises, authorities report a surge in counterfeit stamp fines, and more.
 
A new WTR mini-series analyses the US trademark litigation activity of the Big Five tech firms, 
starting with Google
.
 
Saturday 30 March
 
This week’s Saturday opinion column argues that practitioners need to be considering 
use cases for generative AI
 or risk falling behind.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.

subject: Record-breaking Amazon seizures; USPTO search complaints; brand value warning
body:
28 March 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week, Amazon’s fourth annual Brand Protection Report revealed a 
record-breaking 7 million counterfeit seizures
 and increased criminal enforcement action as part of the company’s efforts to drive counterfeiting online “to zero”. Elsewhere, the USPTO announced that it will be introducing further changes to its new search system, while working to reduce loading errors and tailor search functions, following 
various user complaints
.
 
Other trending content:
 
Two out of three companies’ brand value may be inaccurately reflected in share pricing, study warns
 
SEP regulation plans under renewed fire as UPC appeals judge questions EUIPO’s role
 
What Indonesia’s new president could mean for IP policy
 
Five China IP developments you may have missed
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
ChatGPT, DALL-E 2, DeepL: what do the T&Cs say about IP ownership, data retention and infringement?
 
Ericsson senior IP rights and open-source researcher Eleftheria Stefanaki examines the terms and conditions of three of the most common AI tools on the market to determine the IP legal implications for users.

subject: Invitation to SIETAR Multilingualism Launch Event!
body:
You don't often get email from no-reply@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
View this email in your browser
 
Dear SIETAR Friends,
 
We are thrilled to announce the launch of 
SIETAR Multilingualism
, an exciting new platform dedicated to promoting linguistic diversity, intercultural understanding, and inclusive education, brought to you by SIETAR Europa.
Join us for a groundbreaking series of webinars, film screenings, and discussions in a multitude of languages, all aimed at fostering a more inclusive, equitable, and culturally responsive educational landscape.
We invite you to be a part of our kickoff event in collaboration with 
SIETAR Deutschland
, happening on 
Saturday, March 30th, from 17:00 to 18:15 CET.
 We will be screening "DIE SALZPRINZESSIN"
 with German dialogue and English subtitles.
At SIETAR, we celebrate linguistic diversity in languages including English, Français, Deutsch, Español, Nederlands, Polski, Italiano, and Gaeilge.
Secure your free ticket by registering via the Link Below:
Register here
 
___________________________________________________________________________________
SIETAR Europa präsentiert stolz 
SIETAR Multilingualismus
, eine innovative Plattform, die der Förderung der sprachlichen Vielfalt, des interkulturellen Verständnisses und einer inklusiven Bildung gewidmet ist.
Durch die Zusammenarbeit mit nationalen SIETARs bieten wir Webinare, Filmvorführungen und Diskussionen in verschiedenen Sprachen an. Begleiten Sie uns, während wir das transformative Potenzial von Mehrsprachigkeit und interkultureller Bildung erkunden und dabei inklusivere, gerechtere und kulturell sensiblere Lernumgebungen schaffen.
In SIETAR begrüßen wir die sprachliche Vielfalt: Englisch, Français, Deutsch, Español, Nederlands, Polski, Italiano und Gaeilge. Unser Auftaktevent in Zusammenarbeit mit 
SIETAR Deutschland 
findet am Samstag, den 
30. März, von 17:00 bis 18:15 Uhr
 MEZ statt und umfasst die Vorführung von "DIE SALZPRINZESSIN" mit 
deutscher Dialogführung und englischen Untertiteln.
___________________________________________________________________________________ 
Let's embark on this journey together towards a more connected and understanding world!
Best regards,
SIETAR Europa Community Development Committee

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Spring is the perfect time for growth and renewal, both in nature and in the realm of learning and development (L&D). Just as flowers blossom with the changing season, let's nurture our teams' potential through fresh learning initiatives and opportunities for professional development.
Jump into spring with:

subject: Brand impact on IP finance and share price research; Lidl win implications; European SEP proposals under fire; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
24 March 2024
 
 
Brand impact on IP finance and share price research; Lidl win implications; European SEP proposals under fire; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
Experts at Winterfeldt IP Group reflect on the key talking points of ICANN79 – including news on the 
next round of new gTLDs, DNS abuse and WHOIS data
.
 
Monday 18 March
 
The latest developments in 
European IP policy
 see continued fallout from the European Commission’s SEP vote, a GI shake-up and adoption of the landmark EU AI Act.
 
Plus:
Full Court upholds trademark infringement claim against Redbubble, but overrules damages award
 (Australia)
General Court provides guidance on what constitutes proof of reputation of earlier mark
 (European Union)
 
Tuesday 19 March
 
A new report from WIPO and the UK Intellectual Property Office offers three important takeaways on the relationship between 
trademarks and IP financing
.
 
Lidl’s win
 in a long-running dispute over Tesco Clubcard branding is “great news in the battle against lookalikes”, local experts say.
 
SXSW accuses a protest group of infringement, the British Phonographic Industry takes on deepfake music, the Philippines reports record counterfeit seizures, 
and more
.
 
Plus:
Puma’s registered Community design invalidated due to prior social media disclosure by Rihanna
 (European Union)
Unauthorised domain name registration does not necessarily equal bad-faith registration
 (International)
 
Wednesday 20 March
 
The European Commission urges rights holders to use better 
information-sharing systems
 and anti-counterfeiting technologies in the fight against fakes.
 
Filings increase in the Philippines, the USPTO launches its Diversity Information Platform, the Japan Patent Office meets with Hitachi, and more, in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
 
Plus:
Calvin Klein unsuccessful in CAILIN KAILUN opposition
 (Japan)
KIPO's authority against unfair competitive acts expanded
 (South Korea)
 
Thursday 21 March
 
Local experts examine the opportunities and challenges surrounding 
social media use in Poland
, as part of a new series.
 
Indonesia 
elects a new president
, who some suggest will continue IP policy changes.
 
Plus:
CJEU issues important decision on design priority claims
 (European Union)
Huge seizure of fake footwear carried out in clandestine warehouse
 (Peru)
Delhi High Court rules that trademark registrar has no power to extend evidence-filing period
 (Market Insight: India)
 
Friday 22 March
 
Louis Vuitton challenges an art pop-up, Starbucks ditches its metaverse programme, Google is 
fined €250 million
, and more.
 
An Interbrand study warns that two out of three companies' brand value is likely to be 
inaccurately reflected
 in share pricing.
 
Plus:
Blow for Johnson & Johnson in trade dress dispute
 (Argentina)
The importance of getting Chinese characters filed in China
 (China)
 
Saturday 23 March
 
The European Commission’s proposed SEP regulation comes under renewed fire as a Unified Patent Court appeals judge 
questions the EUIPO’s role
 at IPBC Europe 2024.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.
 
Subscribe

subject: RE: NIEHS Introductions & Training Discussion
body:
Some people who received this message don't often get email from jada.jeter@nih.gov. 
Learn why this is important
Hi Melissa,
 
I’m following up on my last email about training from LCW. Please, let me know what your schedule looks like for a call for us to talk further. I look forward to hearing from you.
 
Have a wonderful day!
 
Jada 
 
From:
 Jeter, Jada (NIH/NIEHS) [C] 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 13, 2024 1:30 PM
To:
 Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 NIEHS Introductions & Training Discussion 
 
Hi Melissa,
 
I hope you’re doing well today!
 
I’m Jada Jeter, the DEIA coordinator for the NIEHS DERT team. I work with Nicole Popovich, who you spoke with back in 2022 about utilizing your firm for training sessions for our division. I read through the past email and proposal familiarizing myself with training options you and Nicole came up with . After looking over what was offered, I was wondering if we could hop on a call to become acquainted and to go over what your organization currently offers in terms of DEIA workshops. 
 
With that said, since I was not a part of this dpt when you spoke with my team last, please let me know if you’re not the appropriate person I should be reaching out to. Thank you for your help and I look forward to hearing back from you. 
 
Have a wonderful day! 
 
Jada Jeter

subject: Strategic takeaways from Brand Strategy Summit Europe; “great news” Lidl win; Pandabuy shopping agent warning
body:
21 March 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
Last week, around 200 senior trademark, brand protection and IP experts gathered in London for WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024. Over two packed days, speakers from some of the world’s biggest brands, their outside counsel, law enforcement, government authorities, online platforms and IP service providers shared their insights on the biggest trends and challenges shaping brand protection strategies around the world. Our reporters were on the ground to present some of their 
strategic takeaways
. The UK Intellectual Property Office, the Police Intellectual Property Crime Unit and major brand owners such as Canon, Dyson and Jaguar Land Rover also provided guidance on how to 
pool multi-stakeholder resources
 to fight IP crime.
 
Other trending content:
 
Lidl win against Tesco appeal is “great news in the battle against lookalikes”
 
Pandabuy, Superbuy: the anti-counterfeiting community must be aware of Chinese ‘shopping agents’
 
Bitcoin is not Craig Wright’s invention, UK High Court declares
 
“Difficult and expensive” – domain name infringement on the rise, exclusive survey shows
 
New EU recommendation urges use of information-sharing systems and anti-counterfeiting technology
 
IP financing and trademarks: three takeaways from new WIPO-UKIPO report
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
Next gTLDs round, DNS abuse developments, WHOIS data: takeaways from ICANN79 (Domain Watch March 2024)
 
The timeline for the next round of new gTLDs, an exploration of RDRS use and developments in the fight against DNS abuse were the focus of ICANN79. IP professionals from Winterfeldt IP Group provide an update on the discussions.
Read more

Delhi High Court rules that trademark registrar has no power to extend evidence-filing period
 
In a pharma trademark spat, the Delhi High Court has emphasised the fixed nature of opposition timeline rules in India, providing much-needed clarity on the legal provisions relating to opposition proceedings.

Featured in

Some avenues for protecting intellectual property are more effective than others. Key insights into the benefits and vulnerabilities of different strategies for securing rights to trademarks and designs shine a light on the various routes to registration. 
Read more »

South Africa: Targeted law is already scoring big wins against domestic fakes
 
Featured in

The Counterfeit Goods Act is a crucial new weapon in the battle against homegrown infringement, setting out the procedures and penalties needed to take on counterfeiters.

subject: Join the SIETAR DEIB Learning Series
body:
You don't often get email from no-reply@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
Unlocking Innovation and Creativity in Teams
 
View this email in your browser
 
Dear SIETAR Friends,
 
Join us on 
March 27th, from 18:00 to 19:15 CET,
 for an exploration of "
Unlocking Innovation and Creativity in Teams Using DEIB Strategies"
 as part of SIETAR Europa's ongoing Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) Learning Series.
This strategic DEIB training initiative is designed to foster active and actionable approaches to DEIB within the workplace, cultivating a more inclusive and innovative environment.
The DEIB Learning Series aims to
 deepen our understanding and integration of DEIB
 contributions within the intercultural workspace, aligning with our commitment to creating a safe, supportive, and respectful environment for all members of our community.
In our dedication to advancing knowledge and addressing DEIB challenges, we are pleased to present guest speakers who will share their expertise:
Patricia Malidor-Coleman
: Author, Speaker, Certified Life & Career Transition Coach, Founder of Globaliscious R retreats
David Rigby
: Executive Business Coach & Consultant, Managing Director of Smart Coaching Training
Edwin Hoffman
 PhD: Lecturer, Trainer, Consultant, Co-Author of "Cultures don't meet, people do"
Magdalena Szumna
: Founder of indigo, Diversity Competence & Intercultural Trainer
The session will be moderated by Papa Balla Ndong, DEIB Strategist.
These experts will provide actionable strategies to drive change and promote a more inclusive and equitable world.
During this session, we will delve into important questions such as:
What does DEIB look like in the workplace, especially concerning AI such as ChatGPT?
What are the common barriers to DEIB?
What does the TOPOI model entail?
And more...
This is a unique opportunity to reflect on psychological safety, wellness, Spiral Dynamics vertical development, soft skills, leadership, and DEIB.
  
Please register via the Link below 
Register here
 
We look forward to your participation and collaboration!
Best regards,
SIETAR Europa Member Benefits Committee

subject: Enhance Your Workforce Planning, Recruitment, and Retention Efforts
body:
Join our webinar and gain valuable insights into aligning your HR and TA efforts, leveraging technology, and measuring effectiveness.
View in browser
 
 
 
Designing and Integrating Your HR and Talent Acquisition Strategic Blueprint
 
WEBINAR  
|  May 1  |  1 – 2 p.m. CT 
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credit,  Personnel/Human Resources 
Register Now
 
This 
complimentary 
webinar aims to equip participants with knowledge and skills needed to develop and implement a cohesive strategic blueprint for human resources (HR) and talent acquisition (TA).  
 
By exploring the alignment of these functions with broader organizational objectives and delving into practical strategies for integrations, attendees can gain valuable insights into enhancing workforce planning and recruitment efforts for long-term success.  
 
In addition to the core learning objectives, participants will explore the role of technology and data analytics in modern HR and TA strategies. Participants can gain an understanding of key performance indicators and metrics used to assess various aspects of workforce planning, recruitment, and retention strategies. By learning how to analyze these metrics effectively, attendees will be equipped with tools to evaluate the success of their initiatives, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions to drive strategic outcomes within their organizations.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize the importance of aligning HR and TA strategies with overall organizational goals 
Recall leading practices for designing and integrating HR and TA strategies 
Identify common challenges and potential improvements in designing and integrating HR and TA strategies 
Recall what you learned about leveraging technology and data analytics to enhance your HR and TA processes 
Identify methods for measuring the effectiveness and impact of HR and TA initiatives through key performance indicators and metrics 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for business owners, executives, and HR and TA leaders.    
 
Speakers  
Jon Fagan
, Principal 
Vanessa Ethier
, Director of HRCO 
Please 
register 
by April 30, 2024.

subject: Long Time No See...
body:

View this email  in your browser
Dear Subscriber, 
Since we last saw you, our team has been busy collecting the latest learning and development insights to help learning leaders like you do their jobs more effectively.
Check out these resources we gathered just for you:
Article
 
5 Training Delivery Methods To Use in L&D Programs
L&D professionals often evaluate delivery methods based on the organization’s overall learning objectives. Most use multiple delivery methods, because a single modality can’t do everything well. So, how can you choose training delivery methods?
Read Now →
Article
 
Understanding Negotiating Styles
Ever wonder why some negotiators approach the situation from completely different viewpoints and with others it goes easily and smoothly?  It might be that they have similar or very different styles.
 
Read Now →
Infographic
 
4 Tips To Ensure Training Brings Value to the Business
When you’re in the business of learning, you have to show your stakeholders that training brings value to the bottom line. To do that, you must align your training programs with both the organization’s and employees’ needs.
Download the Infographic
 →
E-Book
 
Expert Perspectives on Closing Skills Gaps
Work is changing, but in many cases, we aren’t keeping up. New and changing jobs require new and changing skills, and it’s up to training professionals to lead the way.
Download the E-Book
 →
Job Aid
 
The Strategic Planning Toolkit
As a core responsibility of the training manager, strategic alignment is critical for any high-performing training function. Download the Strategic Planning Toolkit to start your journey towards achieving alignment.
Download the Job Aid
 →
E-Book
 
Creating a Strategic Plan
Organizations must quickly adapt and respond to change in today’s fast-paced business world. Developing a strategic plan can help training organizations stay ahead of change and be proactive, instead of reactive, when change occurs.
Download the E-Book
 →

Your outreach resources for March 
Today, we're announcing an upcoming launch that will complete your outbound workflow within Hunter – from identifying qualified leads to sending email outreach.
We also help you tackle accept-all email addresses, and showcase exciting Signals improvements.
 
New 
Coming soon: Company Lookup
Built with Hunter’s commitment to data quality, Company Lookup is a B2B database that will let you easily identify companies in your ICP.
This means you won't need to start with names or company names to find email addresses using Hunter. You'll be able to identify prospects using the Company Lookup and seamlessly proceed to drafting emails in Campaigns.
The next time you hear from us, it will be to let you know that you can log in and start using the Company Lookup right away.
 
Safely contact accept-all recipients
Around 15% of the addresses Hunter finds are verified as “Accept-all,” and we often get questions on how to treat them.
This article will tell you exactly how to use accept-all addresses in your outreach, with data-driven recommendations (including how to drastically reduce your bounce rate.)
The Ultimate Guide to Accept-all Email Addresses
 
 
Get 20x more granular with Signals
We’ve worked on improving Signals to help you narrow down your ICP and find more relevant prospects in no time.
You can now select from among 487 different industries when configuring your Signal. This lets you include or exclude very specific industries and focus on finding companies that you’re really looking for!
Furthermore, you can now exclude staffing & recruitment companies from your Signal with a single click.
Configure your Signal
 
 
Control your daily sending volume
As Q1 is coming to an end, you might be rushing to reach your pipeline goals. Which means sending more emails and following up with prospects you’ve already contacted. 
Just remember that a sudden spike in your daily sending volume can backfire and actually set you back.
These three resources will help you navigate the complex topic of scaling your campaigns.
Learn more about safely scaling your campaigns

The Hunter team.

body:

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Spring is in the air! With the first quarter quickly coming to a close, now is a great time to take stock of your professional development goals. There’s still time to take advantage of the March 
Training Industry Courses sale
 to save on all courses, including the new Training Development and Delivery Certificate and Learning Analytics Workshop.
At Training Industry, our editorial team remains committed to publishing articles offering actionable insights and best practices to help you achieve your career goals. This week’s roundup of articles covers topics like using gamified learning to boost learning transfer, how learning and development (L&D) can improve the employee experience to drive business growth and more.
What topics would you like to see us cover more of this year, and how else can we help you achieve your professional development goals? Let us know by emailing us at

.
Sarah Gallo, CPTM

WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
17 March 2024
 
 
Highlights from WTR Brand Strategy Summit Europe; Taylor Swift filing data analysis; China shopping agent warning; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
Rouse’s Laura Zhao explores the changes in practice that have prompted the recent rise in 
non-use cancellations in China
.
 
Monday 11 March
 
Tencent and L’Oréal lead the filing pack, while Amazon and Microsoft focus on AI registrations, in the latest 
WTR Brand Tracker
.
 
We outline everything brand owners need to know about 
popular social media platforms
 across the Middle East and North Africa.
 
Plus:
Volkswagen partly successful in VOLTWAGEN opposition
 (European Union)
Furniture company successful in invalidity proceedings based on bad faith
 (Lithuania)
 
Tuesday 12 March
 
Nissan heads to the metaverse
, Lebanon reduces its trademark protection period, and more.
 
Plus:
‘courir.io’ decision: running out of evidence of bad faith under ‘.io’ Policy
 (International)
Aldi’s infringement of M&S’ registered design for gin bottles upheld by Court of Appeal
 (United Kingdom)
 
Wednesday 13 March
 
We put 
Taylor Swift’s trademark portfolio
 in the spotlight to reveal her targeted approach to brand protection.
 
The USPTO publishes 
an NFT study
, Georgia makes trademark amendments, Brazil and Slovenia sign an MoU, and more, in this week’s IP office updates.
 
Plus:
CNIPA’s Regulations on Collective and Certification Trademarks: key points highlighted
 (China)
Yves Saint Laurent unsuccessful in opposition against ‘USL’ monogram
 (Japan)
 
Thursday 14 March
 
Litigation experts discuss how best to 
tailor strategies
 in different jurisdictions.
 
Smart enforcement, robust licensing and social media crackdowns are among the 
highlights from WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
.
 
The UKIPO, PIPCU, brand owners and law firm leaders explain how industry stakeholders can 
pool resources to stamp out IP crime
, at WTR Live.
 
Plus:
PUMA v BERTRAND PUMA: marks with a “very high reputation” and the mental link required under Article 8(5)
 (European Union)
Board of Appeal overturns ISIPO decision in cancellation action
 (Iceland)
KVIC loses out on interim relief in cultural symbol infringement dispute
 (Market Insight: India)
 
Friday 15 March
 
Bitcoin is not Craig Wright’s invention, the UK High Court declares, following a 
dramatic copyright trial
.
 
Domain name infringement 
is on the rise
, an exclusive survey shows.
 
Friday’s news digest sees rivals 
Honda and Nissan partnering up
, a Europol and Belgian police raid, a QANTM IP acquisition offer, and more.
 
Plus:
Huge seizure of fake detergent carried out in clandestine workshop
 (Peru)
Supreme Court confirms that Amazon’s US website targeted UK consumers
 (United Kingdom)
 
Saturday 16 March
 
This week’s opinion column urges brand owners to pay attention to 
China-based shopping agents
 allegedly making it easier for Western consumers to buy fake goods online.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.

subject: SIETAR Europa Recommends: SIETAR SEA CONFERENCE 2024
body:
You don't often get email from no-reply@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
How DEI and Belonging work in Asia
 
View this email in your browser
 
SIETAR Europa recommends you to visit
SIETAR Southeast Asia Conference 'How DEI and Belonging work in Asia'
 on the 22-24 March 2024
 
We are excited to invite you to visit the upcoming conference of our colleagues - SIETAR Southeast Asia. 3 days of lively discussions, learning activities and socialising
 
on the theme of
 ‘How DEI and Belonging work in Asia’. 
Here is what you will get:
 
1. Diverse and Enriching Perspectives
True to the theme of DEIB, the conference is about diversity - so are the speakers and themes. It will unite under one roof the subject matter experts, industry leaders and published authors who will offer insights on China, Thailand, Taiwan, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, India, Malaysia and Singapore. They will share their perspectives on topics such as psychological safety, building trust across cultures, women leadership and creating inclusive workplaces. Please
 refer to the program
 for more details.
2. Opportunity to Network
The conference is accessible to those in Singapore and virtually. Attending in-person is of course always more enriching, enabling conversations with a wide range of interesting people, conversations that often facilitate collaborations and ignite friendships.
 
3. Understanding the Pulse
If you want to do business with Asia, a fascinating region at the epicenter of global trends, emerging markets and interesting demographics, it is imperative to understand HOW it works! Through the various sessions, the subtle workings of culture and leadership will be ecoded which will enable more effective working with your teams, clients and customers.
 
FREE SIETAR Southeast Asia Membership
When you sign up to attend the conference, you get 
a FREE membership to the vibrant SIETAR Southeast Asia community!
 As a member, you'll join a passionate network dedicated to championing intercultural awareness in Southeast Asia.
You can participate for 
1, 2 or 3 days, in person in Singapore or online.
 Online participation offers both LIVE sessions and REPLAY options, ensuring that you can tailor your experience to your schedule and preferences.
Choose the Registration Option that suits you the best:
Register to attend IN PERSON
 
Register to attend VIRTUALLY

subject: Women leaders share top tips; Taylor Swift’s portfolio strategy; Amazon defeat reaction
body:
14 March 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
Twenty-six of the most influential women in intellectual property shared their experiences climbing the ladder of success in honour of International Women’s Day last week. Over the course of three days, they revealed what led them to a 
career in intellectual property
, their 
top tips for aspiring leaders
, the 
hardships that they have had to overcome
 in a traditionally male-dominated industry and the 
further changes
 needed in the IP workplace. Speaking of industry-leading women, WTR took a closer look at 
Taylor Swift’s trademark portfolio
 to discover how one of the best-selling musicians of all time has continued to protect her brand and public image through a targeted trademark protection strategy.
 
Other trending content:
 
Amazon defeat closes “backdoor” to unlicensed cross-border sales on e-commerce
 
Last chance to nominate for IP Hall of Fame
 
Tencent and L’Oréal lead filing pack; Amazon and Microsoft focus on AI
 
Unpicking the mass-filing strategy of the US’ most prolific trademark plaintiff
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
Use it or lose it: increasing risk of non-use cancellation in China
 
Rouse’s Laura Zhao explores the changes in practice that have prompted the recent rise in non-use cancellations, analyses the typical failures in defending against non-use cancellation actions and proposes an evidence-gathering process for registrants.
Read more
Market Insight 
India 
Remfry & Sagar 
KVIC loses out on interim relief in cultural symbol infringement dispute
 
In a case involving traditional Indian textiles, the Delhi High Court has shed light on the challenges in safeguarding cultural heritage marks against commercial misuse and the heavy burden of proof on the plaintiff to prove that a registration is invalid.
Authors:
Shrabani Rout
 
Insight 
Arctic Invent
 
Govind Kedia
 
Christian Bunke
 
Sarasija Padmanabhan
 
A Closer Look at Patent Registration Strategies
 
Featured in 
Inside India’s IP Market: a Guide 2024
 
While India is emerging as a global player in innovation, it falls behind other major economies in terms of the number of patent filings. To ensure that progress continues, applicants must consider India’s IP market conditions and utilise them for effective registration. 
Read more »
 
Pearl Cohen Zedek Latzer Baratz
 
Dor Cohen Zedek
 
Amit Nachbar Chung
 
Israel: Civil enforcement and criminal prosecution fuel counterfeiting crackdown
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
Trademark litigation, remedies and dispute resolution form the backbone of the country’s sturdy civil anti-infringement strategy. Simultaneously, state prosecution of criminal counterfeiting and, increasingly, private criminal complaints are targeting a wider swath of bad actors. 
Read more »

Network with and learn from elite decision-makers who will speak on key policy, business, and legal developments, as well as the most effective strategies for maximising IP value in an increasingly dynamic European market.

Corporate executives, deal makers, investors, policy experts and legal professionals will come together to share insights, discuss new trends, and build their networks.
Stay ahead of the game and discover new opportunities at IPBC Global 2024.

subject: NIEHS Introductions & Training Discussion
body:
You don't often get email from jada.jeter@nih.gov. 
Learn why this is important
Hi Melissa,
 
I hope you’re doing well today!
 
I’m Jada Jeter, the DEIA coordinator for the NIEHS DERT team. I work with Nicole Popovich, who you spoke with back in 2022 about utilizing your firm for training sessions for our division. I read through the past email and proposal familiarizing myself with training options you and Nicole came up with . After looking over what was offered, I was wondering if we could hop on a call to become acquainted and to go over what your organization currently offers in terms of DEIA workshops. 
 
With that said, since I was not a part of this dpt when you spoke with my team last, please let me know if you’re not the appropriate person I should be reaching out to. Thank you for your help and I look forward to hearing back from you. 
 
Have a wonderful day! 
 
Jada Jeter

subject: Have you already registered for the SEU Congress 2024?
body:
You don't often get email from office@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
Early Bird Prices until 31st of March!
 
View this email in your browser
 
Register for the SIETAR-Europa 2024 Congress with Early Bird Discount! 
Register here
 
Early Bird Discount for the Congress Registration is available only 
until March 31st!
 So don't miss your chance to attend the biggest gathering of interculturalists
 at a reduced rate. 
You can see the registration fees 
here
 
Kindly reminder that the SIETAR Europa Congress itself begins on the evening of 
June 5th, 2024 with an opening reception
. On June 6th, 7th and 8th we will learn, explore and challenge each other. 
The Congress will wrap up on 
June 8th
 with 
the biggest party of interculturalists
 that Europe has seen for a while! 
The topic of this year congress is "Systems: the ecosystem of interculturalism"
This congress wants to explore systemic dependencies and place interculturalism into a paradigm that looks ahead by acknowledging its past and that shapes its future with intention. We want to begin inventing solutions for problems that are emerging on the horizon, give space for difficult conversations that address the roots of divisions, animosities, and violence, and learn from each other the practical ways in which we can advance communication, co-creation, and constructive dialogue; together.
Click here to register
 
We are looking forward to seeing you there!
 
Best wishes.
The SIETAR Europa Congress Steering Committee

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 March 10, 2024
body:
Top 20 Sales Companies, Strategy Summit and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Success in learning and development (L&D) looks different for everyone, but there are a few factors that we’ve found are common across industries and roles. Among these, collaboration may be the most important. Yet many learning leaders we talk to lack confidence in their ability to make the right connections, both internally and externally. That’s why we’re excited to announce our upcoming 
Training Industry Strategy Summit
, an online event where you can meet and make connections with your peers in a wide variety of roles and industries.
This week, we’re proud to bring you articles on training your salespeople to close deals, incorporating large language models (LLMs) into your coaching, training leaders in radical humility and more. We’re also featuring our 
Top 20 Sales Training and Enablement Companies Lists
, and an opportunity to make your voice heard in our training 
solutions survey
.
As always, we love hearing from you! Reach out to 
editor@trainingindustry.com 
with any article ideas, questions or suggestions.
Mike Allen, CPTM 
Editor
[Whitepaper] AI: A Tool, a Friend or an Enemy?
As AI becomes more integrated into various aspects of society, the question arises: is 
AI a tool, a friend or an enemy
? Or is it a mix of them depending on the situation and application? Explore the multifaceted nature of AI, examining its potential as a tool for progress, a friend enhancing human capabilities and a potential adversary if not carefully managed. Learn more about Generative AI at IIL’s

subject: Inspiring women in IP; INTA’s recession warning; Amazon defeat over consumer targeting; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
10 March 2024
 
 
Inspiring women in IP; INTA’s recession warning; Amazon defeat over consumer targeting; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
In honour of this year’s International Women’s Day, 26 high-profile women in intellectual property share the hardships that they have had to overcome to 
rise to leadership positions
 in a traditionally male-dominated industry.
 
Monday 4 March
 
WTR reveals the 
Formula 1 drivers
 with the biggest trademark portfolios.
 
National copyright and trademark systems improve, as Europe dominates the US Chamber of Commerce’s 
annual IP index
.
 
Plus:
HEPSIBURADA v HEPSIBURADA: General Court decision provides guidance on demonstrating bad faith
 (European Union)
Château Mouton Rothschild owner successfully invalidates MOUTON in Classes 35 and 43
 (Japan)
 
Tuesday 5 March
 
Microsoft could boost its brand value 
by billions of dollars
 through improved ESG marketing, Brand Finance estimates.
 
Thirty-seven UK GIs
 gain protection in Japan, Mbappé overtakes Messi in EU trademark filings, AAA sues A24, and more.
 
Plus:
Good news for L’Oréal as General Court upholds opposition against LA CRÈME LIBRE
 (European Union)
OREO v MOREO’S: rare trademark judgment issued
 (Zambia)
 
Wednesday 6 March
 
Brand professionals must prepare for a “major decrease in legal spending”, INTA’s 
“IP in Times of Recession” report
 warns.
 
Indecopi issues a fraud warning, Hong Kong announces a fee reduction and the Sudan trademark office resumes operations, in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
 
Plus:
Registration in bad faith is essential for transfer under UDRP
 (International)
Federal Supreme Court issues landmark decision on customisation of branded goods
 (Switzerland)
 
Thursday 7 March
 
An 
Amazon defeat
 at the UK Supreme Court closes the “backdoor” to unlicensed cross-border sales on e-commerce platforms, local experts say.
 
Intellectual property’s most influential women offer their 
career tips for aspiring leaders
.
 
Plus:
General Court: ‘BI’ element retained independent distinctive role in conflicting marks
 (European Union)
Huge raid carried out against several targets in one of Lima’s biggest shopping centres
 (Peru)
Delhi High Court denies interim injunction to Lotus Herbal in product branding dispute
 (Market Insight: India)
TTAB insufficiently weighed likelihood-of-confusion factors in cancellation action, Federal Circuit rules
 (Market Insight: United States)
Filing and maintaining trademarks in the Western Balkans: what rights holders need to know
 (Market Insight: Western Balkans)
 
Friday 8 March
 
The 2024 INTA Annual Meeting 
surpasses 6,500 registrants
, the Frida Kahlo Corporation files a trademark lawsuit, Maison Margiela launches a series of NFTs, and more.
 
We interview women leaders in the IP field to find out what first brought them to intellectual property, in the hopes of 
inspiring others
.
 
WTR unpicks the 
mass-filing strategy
 of the most prolific trademark plaintiff before US district courts.
 
Plus:
Full Federal Court considers use of 3D mark in dishwasher capsule dispute
 (Australia)
Refining the ‘a.tr’ domain allocation: what you need to know
 (Türkiye)
 
Saturday 9 March
 
IP mavens call for specific changes to 
improve DEI in the industry
, in this week’s opinion column.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.

subject: 🤠Research Roundup: New Learning Measurement E-Book
body:
Plus: Other research-driven insights from Training Industry.
View this email  in your browser
Hello!
Training Industry Research 
is thrilled to bring you the latest insights from the learning and development (L&D) industry through our newly released 
e-books and comprehensive State of the Industry reports
. This month’s research uncovers current trends and explores future possibilities across the training landscape.
🔦 Spotlight: New E-Book Release 
 
We’re excited to announce the release of our latest e-book, “
Learning Measurement for Modern Businesses: Making Sense of ISO 30437
.” This e-book provides updated findings and insights on:
The International Organization for Standardization (ISO)’s new guidance for L&D metrics.
The training evaluation metrics that organizations regularly collect.
The common challenges faced when measuring training’s impact.
Suggested practices for tailoring training measurement to your unique business needs.
Aligning your training programs with business goals and proving value to stakeholders.
Many learning leaders are in the dark about stakeholders’ needs. 
Recent data suggests that many organizations struggle with measuring training impact and lack clarity on stakeholder needs. 
A staggering 47% of learning leaders are mostly unaware about what their stakeholders expect from L&D.
​​​
Learn More

subject: Opportunists target EUIPO; Microsoft’s untapped brand billions; F1’s most active filers
body:
07 March 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week, WTR discovered a rise in bad-faith registrations of typosquatting domains targeting the EUIPO. The news came as a WTR investigation uncovered a website 
purporting to be the ‘EU Intellectual Property Office’
, with a database of more than 600 trademarks mostly originating from the United States. Elsewhere, a new report by Brand Finance warns that Microsoft could be missing out on 
billions of dollars of untapped brand value
, if it would only improve its ESG marketing.
 
Other trending content:
 
Lando Norris takes pole position in F1 trademark race, as drivers expand brand portfolios
 
Brand professionals must prepare for “major decrease in legal spending”, INTA report warns
 
National copyright and trademark systems improve, as Europe dominates US IP index
 
How US district courts treat DMCA claims
 
China rises in soft power rankings; Gulf states cultivate influence
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
Brand owners and online marketplaces: how to combat infringement through effective collaboration
 
Rights holders and platforms meaningfully working together hold the key to success in fighting infringement. Winterfeldt IP Group attorneys offer some strategic tips.
Read more
Market Insight 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
TTAB insufficiently weighed likelihood-of-confusion factors in cancellation action, Federal Circuit rules
 
In an infringement dispute involving two baby product retailers, the US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit found that the TTAB erred in its application of several 
DuPont
 factors when it analysed the similarity between two marks.
Authors:
Eleanor B Atkins 
Western Balkans 
Patent & Trade Mark Agency MIHAILOVIC 
Filing and maintaining trademarks in the Western Balkans: what rights holders need to know
 
For rights holders that want to protect their trademarks in the Western Balkans, it is crucial to understand the laws that govern trademark filing and maintenance processes across the region.
Authors:
Mila Mihailovic
 
India 
Remfry & Sagar 
Delhi High Court denies interim injunction to Lotus Herbal in product branding dispute
 
Cosmetic company 82°E has prevailed in an infringement suit brought by Lotus Herbal alleging likelihood of confusion. The Delhi High Court’s decision sheds light on the complexities of product branding and clarifies the distinction between characteristic descriptions and brand identifiers.
Authors:
Bisman Kaur
 
Insight 
Seyfarth Shaw LLP
 
Lauren Gregory Leipold
 
Kenneth L Wilton
 
United States: Last 12 Months See New Court Precedents and Fresh Ways to Challenge Existing Registrations
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Litigation Review 2024
 
In the past year, US courts have set critical new legal precedents, including on the extraterritorial application of US trademark law and burden of proof for ‘crowded field’ defences. The first round of decisions interpreting the 2020 Trademark Modernization Act’s expungement and reexamination procedures have also made waves, offering new avenues for challenging existing US registrations. 
Read more »
 
De Penning & De Penning
 
Ruchi Singh
 
Rommel Pandit
 
Paramita Nandy Gupta
 
Sonu Shaji
 
India: Bolstered anti-counterfeiting regime champions stricter market regulation and enhanced consumer awareness
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
Stemming the flow of illicit traders into digital and physical markets and educating consumers on the perils of counterfeit goods are crucial to the country’s continued economic progress. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | BMA House, London 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge.

subject: Curiously Intercultural Monthly Update
body:
You don't often get email from ci@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
Read the latest from Curiously Intercultural
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Promoting an exchange of ideas among the interculturally curious
Dear Melissa,
Curious about news in the intercultural field and what is going on in the SIETAR community? We have compiled the latest posts from SIETAR Europa's rolling platform Curiously Intercultural for you. We invite you to check them out and join the intercultural conversation! 
Generative AI and Intercultural Communication: What’s in for the Trainers?
Published Feb 16, 2024 12:42 am
Just over a year ago, the world was introduced to ChatGPT, sparking excitement around terms like 'Generative AI' or 'Large Language Models'. This groundbreaking technology is not just a buzzword but a breakthrough that is reshaping industries in profound ways. 
In an inspiring conversation, I had a chance to interview Dr. Stephan Ruppert, who has successfully integrated this innovative technology into the fabric of his work as an Intercultural Communication trainer and lecturer. But his efforts extend beyond this, Dr. Ruppert is on a mission to empower his peers in the field, teaching them how to harness the potential of AI tools such as ChatGPT and Midjourney in their professional lives, under the brand of Linking Cultures.
The post 
Generative AI and Intercultural Communication: What’s in for the Trainers?
 appeared first on 
SIETAR Europa
.
The Greening of SIETAR
Published Feb 14, 2024 02:15 pm
Team behind the SIETAR Europa 2024 Congress Sustainability initiative shares their approach on making the upcoming June conference in Lille more green and climate-friendly.
The post 
The Greening of SIETAR
 appeared first on 
SIETAR Europa
.
Chinese New Year Special: Enter the Dragon and Other Zodiac Signs
Published Feb 14, 2024 01:36 pm
Does Western world understand Chinese New Year right? Gabor Holch expertly guides us through the maze of the centuries-long symbols, so everyone could fully appreciate the celebrations, taking place from February 10th to February 24th.
The post 
Chinese New Year Special: Enter the Dragon and Other Zodiac Signs
 appeared first on 
SIETAR Europa
.
Living within diversities. Cultures and new complexities. An international conference by Fondazione Intercultura. Florence, April 4-6, 2024
Published Feb 11, 2024 12:52 am
At a time of globalisation and of multiple cross-cultural influences how can we learn to communicate in an effective and culturally sensitive way in our complex societies? Which competencies are required? How can we face and cope with cultural uncertainty?
Are we moving towards a “liquid” concept of culture? How can young people be educated to cope with so many intertwined cultural differences within a complex society?
To answer these questions, join a conference organised by Fondazione Intercultura in the beautiful city of Florence from April 4 to 6, 2024. 
The post 
Living within diversities. Cultures and new complexities. An international conference by Fondazione Intercultura. Florence, April 4-6, 2024
 appeared first on 
SIETAR Europa
.
  
More Articles:
Three reasons why expat jobs will never be the same
Breaking out of the Expat Bubble by Marian van Bakel
Winter Holidays: From Darkness to Light, Year After Year
Mean Girl Feminism: How White Feminists Gaslight, Gatekeep, and Girlboss. By Kim Hong Nguyen. University of Illinois Press, 2024
MERICS podcast interview: A 25-minute intercultural negotiation masterclass
With our best wishes,
The Curiously Intercultural Editorial Team

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 March 3, 2024
body:
DEI podcast episode, upskilling Leader Talk and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Happy March! We are in the homestretch as we wind down the first quarter. How is everyone feeling?
As we know, change is constant, and our plans rarely unfold perfectly. Wherever you are on your professional journey, our team is ready to help. 
Let us know
 if there is any specific content that you need to meet your goals.
This week, we are sharing articles on a variety of topics, including how to conduct a needs analysis, the power of personalized learning and navigating the distinctions between sales and negotiation training. We also just released a 
podcast episode
 that examines the current state of diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) training that is worth a listen!
As always, we love hearing from you. Please send us your article ideas, pitches and comments to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 Have a great week!
Michelle Eggleston Schwartz, CPTM
Editor in Chief 
Shape the World of Online Learning With a Degree From CSUN!
CSUN’s Master of Arts in Instructional Design is delivered fully online and features flexible scheduling for working adults. You’ll learn to design, implement and assess educational solutions such as online programs, professional development seminars and walk-throughs for products and services. You’ll also learn how to optimize the learning strategies of people and organizations. 
Apply
 by March 19.
 
Get Started 
 
The World’s Biggest Business Event Arrives in Miami!
The Business Show 
helps you to start or grow your dream business and takes place at The Miami Beach Convention Center March 6-7. 300 world-class exhibitors are showcasing their products and services to elevate your business, and there are 150 seminars and master classes offering you expert guidance. Attend keynotes from the star of Netflix’s “Selling Sunset,” Realtor Maya Vander, and speakers from some of the largest global organizations including Google, Walmart and IBM.
 
Get Your Free Ticket 
 
🎙 The Business of Learning, Episode 73: The State of DEI Training in 2024
In 
this podcast episode
, we spoke with Deanna Singh, co-founder of training and education inclusion firm, Uplifting Impact, about the current state of diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) training. She shared insights on the parallels between DEI and leadership training, actionable tips for fostering an inclusive culture and strategies for securing stakeholder support for DEI initiatives. This episode is a must-listen for anyone looking to make a meaningful impact with their DEI training in 2024.
 
Listen Now 
 
🗣 [Leader Talk] Leveling Up: Skilling of the Workforce
Staying ahead in L&D means prioritizing skills development. Join us for our 
upcoming Leader Talk
 where industry leaders will share tips for strategic upskilling, creating role-specific competency models and skills maps, developing targeted training to bridge skills gaps and more. This is your chance to transform your approach to L&D and ensure your team is future ready. Don't miss out on strategic insights to help navigate the upskilling imperative!
 
Reserve Your Spot
 
IT AND TECHNICAL TRAINING 
Nurturing Excellence: Strategies for Software Development Teams' Professional Development
This article reviews training strategies to help software development team's professional development with effective learning modalities.
Read Now →
COMPLIANCE
