A Roadmap to Conducting a Needs Analysis
This article reviews a comprehensive guide to conducting a learning needs analysis to identify training needs and close skills gaps.
Read Now →
PERSONALIZATION AND LEARNING PATHWAYS 
One-Size-Fits-One: The Power of Personalized Learning
To be more inclusive of individual needs, a one-size-fits-one approach is at the forefront of training and development.
Read Now →
COMPLIANCE 
Beyond the Check-Box: How AI Elevates Ethics and Compliance Training
The most effective organizations embrace ethics and compliance (E&C) training so best practices become embedded in the organization, strengthening company culture and driving positive risk-management behaviors.
Read Now →
ONBOARDING
Leveraging Exit Interviews for Enhanced Employee Training Strategies
This article reviews tips to training HR professionals on how to conduct exit interviews that enhance employee training strategies.
Read Now →
SALES 
Navigating the Distinctions and Synergies of Sales Training and Negotiation Training
Understanding the distinction between sales and negotiation training is essential for internal training and hiring external partners.

WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT 
Closing the Technology Skills Gaps in Manufacturing With Training
This article covers insights on closing technology skills gaps in manufacturing with targeted training initiatives for in-demand skills.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
Enhancing eLearning With AI-Generated Voice-Overs
AI-generated voice-overs are a strategic tool for L&D professionals grappling with the need for extensive digital content.

subject: How to work with online marketplaces; EUIPO domain abuse warning; Latin America policy and filings changes; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
03 March 2024
 
 
How to work with online marketplaces; EUIPO domain abuse warning; Latin America policy and filings changes; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
IP Hall of Fame
 
Nominations for the 2024 IP Hall of Fame close on 15 March. If you know somebody who deserves recognition for their ground-breaking contributions to the world of intellectual property, nominate them today by 
clicking here
.
 
Long Read
 
Winterfeldt IP Group attorneys offer strategic tips for brand owners to meaningfully 
working together with online marketplaces
 in order to combat infringement.
 
Monday 26 February
 
Netflix and Meta see their stock soar, as tech brands ride the AI wave and the WTR Brand Elite hits a 
six-year high
.
 
Recent developments in Chile, the Dominican Republic and Venezuela indicate that brand owners should have an 
eye on Latin America
.
 
Plus:
Louis Vuitton Malletier loses trademark dispute over ‘LV’ monogram
 (Japan)
Import of three counterfeit Hermès sweaters for private use does not constitute trademark infringement
 (Norway)
 
Tuesday 27 February
 
In the first of a new series, we uncover the domestic social media platforms that should be on enforcement radars, starting with 
four in China
.
 
BMW reflects on a 
first-of-its-kind joint lawsuit win
 after teaming up with Amazon to pursue counterfeiters in Spain.
 
McDonald’s 
changes its name
 to WcDonald’s, Aldi loses its M&S gin bottle appeal, Superdry settles a dispute, and more.
 
An expert in Sweden offers their insights for brand protection at the 
country’s borders
.
 
Plus:
Two draft IP laws submitted for public consultation: what you need to know
 (Albania)
EUIPO Board of Appeal confirms existence of link between cigarettes and chocolate
 (European Union)
 
Wednesday 28 February
 
Discussions for 
Rouse to acquire Australia’s QANTM IP
 are at an “early stage”, the company confirms.
 
The UK Intellectual Property Office joins forces with social media influencers to launch a new 
anti-counterfeiting cosmetics campaign
.
 
Trademark filings 
drop across Latin America
, as only Colombia sees growth in the latest WTR Register Tracker.
 
The USPTO partners with Clarivate, Myanmar begins to accept copyright registrations, the IP Office of New Zealand updates its trademark guidelines, and more, in this week’s 
IP office news
.
 
Plus:
Long-awaited draft regulation under Québec’s Bill 96 finally published - more questions than answers?
 (Canada)
Garfield's Odie character successfully protected in opposition proceedings
 (Peru)
 
Thursday 29 February
 
The EUIPO reveals an 
“upward trend” of abusive domains
 targeting trademark owners.
 
The European Parliament adopts its new SEP regulation and the head of the Consortium for Common Food Names calls for US action in our latest 
legislation and policy watch
.
 
Plus:
Partial use of trademark in revocation proceedings once again under General Court’s scrutiny
 (European Union)
Figurative marks for Class 9 goods held to simply illustrate how to use the goods
 (Taiwan)
Infringement spat between two paint rivals highlights limits of using common words as trademarks in India
 (Market Insight: India)
 
Friday 1 March
 
A ‘Dungeons & Dragons’ genericism debate, Dr Bernice A King’s INTA keynote and OpenAI’s OPEN AI injunction feature among 
Friday’s news stories
.
 
WTR data analysis examines how US district courts treat 
claims under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act
.
 
China rises in this year’s 
Brand Finance Global Soft Power Index
, as Gulf states cultivate their influence.
 
Plus:
Recent prejudicial interpretation on cancellation of trade names - what you need to know
 (International)
Blow for Google in GRMAIL opposition
 (Singapore)
 
Saturday 2 March
 
This week’s opinion column suggests that The Smiley Company offers a case study on how to 
raise IP awareness
 with a simple brand.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.
 
Subscribe
Follow on
 
 
Follow on

subject: Announcing the Training Industry Strategy Summit
body:
Take your learning strategy to the next level.
View this email  in your browser
Registration is now open for the
Training Industry Strategy Summit! 
As a learning leader, developing a robust learning strategy for your organization is a crucial part of your role. However, it’s not uncommon for learning leaders to lack confidence in the plans they intend to implement. The 
Training Industry Strategy Summit
 is here to change that.
This online event, happening this 
September 25-26
, offers a venue for you to gain the knowledge, tools and connections you need to confidently create and execute your learning strategy.
You’ll learn: 
The core principles of an effective learning strategy.
How to navigate the speed of change and its impact on your L&D plans. 
How to evaluate the impact of your strategy. 
And much more! 
You will learn from the L&D strategies at companies like Teladoc Health, BDO Canada., and Zapier, participate in engaging sessions, and network with other learning leaders who share your passion for effective and impactful learning.
Are you ready to take your learning strategy to the next level?

subject: Explore Strategies for Retaining Top Talent — March 28 Webinar
body:
Join us to discuss the impact of talent retention, effective business strategies, and tips on how to use technology to predict turnover.
View in browser
 
 
 
Strategies for Retaining Top Talent
 
WEBINAR
 |  March 28 |  11 a.m. – noon CT
Register Now
 
Talent retention must be a continuous focus and effort — and is a concern for many organizations. Join our 
complimentary 
webinar where will we explore strategies to help you build a culture of retention where top talent stays. We’ll define talent retention, highlight the consequences of poor retention, and describe how technology, business strategies, and policies can positively impact talent retention.
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:
Describe the costs of the flipside of retention: turnover
Discuss recommended practices on utilizing technology to predict turnover and retain talent
Review the strategies and policies that may increase talent retention

subject: Reminder: Tap into Tax Credits for Green Energy Investments and Manufacturing
body:
Learn about tax credits for green energy investments and manufacturing under the Inflation Reduction Act for private and public entities.
View in browser
 
 
 
Monetizing Clean Energy Credits from the Inflation Reduction Act
 
WEBINAR
  |  March 7  |  11 a.m. – noon CT
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credit, Taxes
Register Now
 
The Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) creates significant opportunities for organizations to tap into tax credits for their green energy investments and manufacturing activities. Both private and public sector organizations can take advantage of these incentives, including governmental and tax-exempt entities. 
 
CLA’s federal tax strategies team will review what credits are available under the IRA, which types of entities can benefit from the incentives, how credits can be transferred between taxpayers, and the registration process to receive available cash or tax credit benefits.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize various tax credit and incentive opportunities under the IRA 
Describe the latest legal and regulatory updates under the IRA 
Discuss tax credit investments and tax credit transferability in more detail  
Identify how to claim potential tax credits available for your organization   
Who should attend  
This session is designed for leadership and finance professionals in all industries looking to take advantage of the potential tax savings with the Inflation Reduction Act.

subject: BMW on Amazon anti-counterfeiting win; new social media enforcement series; algorithms threatening trademarks
body:
29 February 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week, BMW Group reflected on a 
first-of-its-kind joint lawsuit
 with Amazon that saw the company successfully enforce its rights against counterfeiters in Spain. We sat down with BMW Group’s head of trademarks to find out how the team worked with Amazon and what other brand owners can do to leverage the platform’s reach in their anti-counterfeiting efforts. Elsewhere, we launched a new series outlining local social media websites that brand owners should have on their enforcement radars – starting with 
platforms in China
.
 
Other trending content:
 
Are algorithms making trademarks obsolete?
 
Yili Group VP reveals how IP strategy ensures smooth business operations
 
UKIPO teams up with influencers on new anti-counterfeiting campaign
 
Discussions for Rouse to acquire Australia’s QANTM IP at an “early stage”
 
Why brand owners should have an eye on Latin America
 
What Texas’s economic boom means for trademark litigation
 
Asia-Pacific suffers cross-regional filing decline
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
Brand owners and online marketplaces: how to combat infringement through effective collaboration
 
Rights holders and platforms meaningfully working together hold the key to success in fighting infringement. Winterfeldt IP Group attorneys offer some strategic tips.
Read more
Market Insight 
India 
Remfry & Sagar 
Infringement spat between two paint rivals highlights limits of using common words as trademarks in India
 
The High Court of Calcutta has clarified when common words can be used as registered trademarks. The dispute between two paint companies illustrates how use of regular words by other industry players can impact a business’s exclusive trademark rights.
Authors:
Sonal Goel
 
Insight 
K&K Advocates
 
Elsiana Inda Putri Maharani
 
Adrian Luthfi Imantaka
 
Specialist Chapter: New E-court System Aims to Simplify Proceedings and Significantly Drive Down Operational Costs in Indonesia
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Litigation Review 2024
 
The debut of a digital platform for all Commercial Court cases will create a more effective and efficient system for all parties – provided the technological advantages outweigh the disadvantages. 
Read more »
 
IP Law Galli
 
Cesare Galli
 
Italy: Stronger enforcement dovetails with augmented border control and harsher punishments
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
Over 20 specialised IP courts utilise the country’s laws – particularly its Code of Industrial Property – to halt infringement and prosecutive infringers. Concurrently, national Customs and border control efforts continue the good fight against the flow of offline fakes. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | BMA House, London 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge.

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 February 25, 2024
body:
Upcoming Leader Talk, DEI resources and more
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
As Black History Month comes to a close, it's crucial to remember that diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) is an ongoing commitment to the diverse perspectives fueling innovation and inclusivity in our organizations.
Training Industry has a variety of resources to support your DEI efforts year-round. From articles on neurodivergence to accessibility, 
our DEI topic area
 covers content that supports learning and development (L&D’s) role in fostering an inclusive workplace.
We also have a curated 
list of DEI resources
 from across the web including courses, reports, articles, podcasts and more to help promote awareness and drive change in your training programs.
And don’t miss our new podcast episode releasing Thursday, Feb. 29 for more ways to improve your DEI initiatives.
Have ideas you’d like to contribute? Reach out to us at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
.
Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor 
🗣 [Leader Talk] Leveling Up: Skilling of the Workforce
Staying ahead in L&D means prioritizing skills development. Join us for our 
upcoming Leader Talk
 where industry leaders will share tips for strategic upskilling, creating role-specific competency models and skills maps, developing targeted training to bridge skills gaps and more. This is your chance to transform your approach to L&D and ensure your team is future ready. Don't miss out on strategic insights to help navigate the upskilling imperative!
Reserve Your Spot 
 
💞Design Thinking and L&D: The Perfect Match 
Training Industry Courses' 
Design Thinking Workshop
 prepares learning leaders like you to use design thinking as a key tool for diagnosing business problems and developing innovative learning solutions at your organization. In the next half-day workshop March 15 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. ET, you will learn to put yourself in your learners' shoes to create effective solutions that enable high performance and to understand why some of your old interventions may be falling flat.
Learn More
 
📖[E-Book] What Learners Want: New Strategies for Training Delivery
Only 21% of employees believe their training is always effective. Our Training Industry Research e-book, 
“What Learners Want: New Strategies for Training Delivery,”
 explores the concept of learner preferences, how appealing to those preferences may lead to higher engagement, and how to avoid the pitfalls of lackluster training. Keeping up with learning trends sets employees and businesses up for success from the get-go. Check out this e-book for insights on how learner choice impacts training effectiveness.

subject: USPTO domains investigation; influencer counterfeit report; regional filing data trends; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
25 February 2024
 
 
USPTO domains investigation; influencer counterfeit report; regional filing data trends; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
We unpick two 
recent UAE laws
 that aim to provide a robust system for combatting infringement and counterfeiting in the region.
 
Monday 19 February
 
Record UDRP filings and the latest ICANN registrant data request levels feature in 
this month’s Domain Watch
.
 
Plus:
Court of Appeal issues decision in NotMilk dispute
 (Chile)
Recurring issues and delays at the Trademark Registry - why stakeholder confidence is being eroded
 (Nigeria)
 
Tuesday 20 February
 
WTR data analysis reveals a 
drop in filings
 at major North American and European registers, with a boom in UK filings abroad also proving temporary.
 
Google fails
 in its GRMAIL opposition, Meta challenges a UK THREADS mark, Forbes heads to the metaverse, and more.
 
Plus:
New Balance unsuccessful in opposition against NYAN BALANCE
 (Japan)
DNPI resolution recognises and regulates non-traditional trademarks
 (Uruguay)
 
Wednesday 21 February
 
Clarivate launches a new 
IP research centre
 to lead the industry's evolution.
 
This week’s 
IP office updates
 include an impostor warning at the IP Office of the Philippines, an update on India’s list of well-known trademarks, and more.
 
Plus:
Polaroid figurative mark: when are geometric figures distinctive?
 (European Union)
GO’s appeal is no-go: Federal Circuit says EVERYBODY VS RACISM fails to function as source identifier
 (United States)
 
Thursday 22 February
 
A WTR investigation exposes more than 100 web addresses using the 
USPTO name in their domain string
, raising concerns about those with links to suspicious low-cost filing agencies.
 
A new report by the UK Intellectual Property Office finds that male consumers are far more likely 
to buy counterfeit goods
 from social media influencers.
 
The Asia-Pacific region suffers a 
decline in trademark filings
 across major registers, according to data analysis.
 
Plus:
OLYMPUS: a mountain, the residence of the gods and a distinctive trademark?
 (European Union)
WIPO cybersquatting cases grow by 7% to reach new record in 2023
 (International)
Rolex loses out on disgorgement of profits from laches defence in Fifth Circuit ruling
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 23 February
 
We go behind the scenes at 
China’s biggest dairy company
, Yili Group, to find out how its IP strategy ensures smooth business operations.
 
Data analysis reveals what 
Texas’s economic boom
 means for trademark litigation before the district courts.
 
Mercedes overtakes Tesla
 in brand value, Gilead prevails in a fake drug suit, Under Armour releases an NFT collection, and more.
 
Plus:
Social media: simple communication or real evidence of use?
 (European Union)
The TCIRs system: leveraging customs recordation and seizure for robust IP protection
 (Thailand)
 
Saturday 24 February
 
We ask whether 
trademarks are becoming obsolete
 in the face of algorithms that make purchasing decisions, in this week’s Saturday opinion column.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.
 
Subscribe
Follow on
 
 
Follow on
 
 
Law Business Research

Registered in England and Wales number 03281866

subject: Introducing CIO Intelligence
body:
You don't often get email from fortune@msg.fortune.com. 
Learn why this is important
Stay in the know on the latest tech developments with our new newsletter.
 
View this email in your browser.
 
 
It's an exciting time to oversee technology for a business.
 
From AI and cybersecurity to cloud computing and regulatory compliance, companies are spending more money than ever on products and services. The expectations are high, and the questions—from the board and the C-suite—are more complex, and ever more frequent.
 
At the center of it all is the chief information officer. An estimated 72% of businesses surveyed by Deloitte last year reported having a CIO. Other key decision-makers include chief technology officers, chief data officers, chief digital officers, and chief information security officers. These are the leaders who are propelling transformative technologies that can generate significant value to shareholders.
 
Beginning Feb. 28, a new 
Fortune
 newsletter, 
CIO Intelligence
, will explore the key issues shaping the roles of CIOs and other technology leaders. The newsletter will explore topics ranging from generative AI projects to the cloud vs. on-premise debate; tech talent and technical debt; and the protection of sensitive data as fraudsters utilize AI at wider scale and with sharper precision. 
 
 
My name is John Kell, and I’m thrilled to begin writing this newsletter every Wednesday from New York, where I’ve also frequently covered the generative AI boom that’s got everyone talking. If you're a CIO, or if you're overseeing an important aspect of your company's technology, I want to hear from you.
 
Please join me as we explore how top tech leaders are developing their winning playbook.
 
John Kell
 
Subscribe to 
CIO Intelligence
 
 
This email was sent to m.neu@lcwmail.com 
Unsubscribe
 | 
Manage subscriptions
Fortune Media (USA) Corporation
40 Fulton Street New York, NY 10038

subject: The Secret Behind the Most Successful Training Managers
body:
Learn about the seven core responsibilities of training management.

.
 
Training Industry's 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™)
 program is organized around the 
seven core responsibilities
 that are critical to training manager success. Utilizing a blended learning approach including self-paced eLearning, live facilitation and group application activities, this program develops training professionals across all seven responsibilities.
In the first step, the interactive 
eLearning modules
 offer a deep dive into each of the core responsibilities. This self-guided prework includes videos, interactive activities and assessments, where you'll gain the necessary background information before attending the live and virtual, instructor-led 
practicum
 of your choice. Click below to preview the modules, including how they align to the seven core responsibilities of training management.
Preview the Modules
Want some guidance on whether or not the CPTM program is right for you? Click below to schedule a complimentary virtual consultation with one of Training Industry Courses' directors of professional development.
Schedule a Consultation
If you're ready to register for the CPTM program now, 
select your practicum here
.
"My role as division chief of our professional development and training division really allowed me to see where my competencies lacked, where I needed to improve and also learn more about training management in general. I was able to take what I've learned in the CPTM program and develop a cohesive strategic plan and goals for my division that fit right into my organization's overall strategy. As someone whose background was not in training, this program really stepped up my game and I feel more empowered to work on behalf of our training [department] and training professionals. I was able to use the program skills almost immediately after passing the exam."
— Stephanie Fugate, CPTM, Division Chief, Professional Development and Training, USAID

subject: Reminder: Navigate the Complex Landscape of Employment-Related Tax Credits
body:
Join us on February 29 to learn about employment-related tax credits such as the ERC, WOTC, federal empowerment zone credits, and more!
View in browser
 
 
 
Navigating Credits and Incentives: ERC, WOTC, and More
 
WEBINAR
  |  Thursday, February 29  |  11 a.m. – noon CT   
Recommended CPE: 1 credit, Taxes  
Register Now
 
Attend our 
complimentary 
webinar as CLA tax professionals show you how to navigate the complex landscape of employment-related tax credits. We’ll cover the employee retention credit (ERC), the work opportunity credit (WOTC), federal empowerment zone credits, and more!  
 
Learn how to use credits and incentives to add value and discover potentially significant tax savings for your organization.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Identify the purpose of the credits 
Describe the opportunities and limitations of each credit 
Explain the process to claim the credits and the impact of each on the tax return 
Discuss the updates, guidance, and warnings from the IRS related to eligibility for the ERC 
Discuss common questions related to the listed credits 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for business owners, CEOs, CFOs, and tax or human resources professionals.

subject: Investigation into USPTO domain misuse; internet policy news; influencer advertising data
body:
22 February 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
A WTR investigation has uncovered more than 
100 web addresses using ‘USPTO’
 in their domain string, raising concerns over the potential misuse of the agency’s name by some fraudsters looking to target US business owners. Staying in the domain space, we examine the latest developments at ICANN and in WIPO’s UDRP data in 
this month’s Domain Watch
.
 
Other trending content:
 
Four out of five influencers do not disclose advertising content
 
“Deeply distraught” – Ukrainian community reacts to EU rejection of Snake Island trademark
 
ZATAP’s vision for the future of resale authentication
 
USPTO, DPMA and EUIPO see filings decline; boom in UK filings abroad proves temporary
 
Clarivate launches IP research centre to lead industry evolution
 
How an IP head built a culture of female empowerment – starting with a high tea
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
Recent UAE laws provide robust infringement and counterfeit combatting regime
 
We unpick the trademark implications of two laws that have come into force in the United Arab Emirates in the past two years.
Read more
Market Insight 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
Rolex loses out on disgorgement of profits from laches defence in Fifth Circuit ruling
 
A Fifth Circuit decision has clarified the difference between the restoration and customisation of luxury watches, as well as the impact that a delay in filing infringement charges can have on the success of a disgorgement claim.
Authors:
Keval Amin
 
Insight 
Unitalen Attorneys at Law
 
Ray Lei Zhao
 
Specialist Chapter: Proposed Revisions to China’s Trademark Law Take Aim at Bad-Faith Applications and Boost Protection
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Litigation Review 2024
 
The country’s trademark infringement judgment criteria are set for a significant overhaul in coming years, compelling rights holders to closely analyse differences between the current and proposed legislation. 
Read more »
 
Cabinet M Oproiu
 
Raluca Vasilescu
 
Romania: Customs doubles down on flow of counterfeits across non-EU borders
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
The country’s significant borders with non-EU countries increase the pressure and urgency of Customs’ anti-infringement efforts. A system combining domestic and EU laws is proving effective at stemming the tide of fake goods entering by land and sea. 
Read more »

 and

If you continue accessing/using Calendly on or after March 8, 2024, you and any Authorized Users will be bound by these updated terms
.
Considerations:
This is a legal notice which is why you’re receiving it even if you’ve opted out of marketing communications.
To be clear, if your Calendly Account(s) were purchased under a Master Service Agreement ("MSA") with Calendly, the Customer Terms do not apply to you as your MSA governs your access and use of Calendly Services.
As a current Customer, these terms will be effective beginning on March 8, 2024 (and the 
prior version of our Terms of Service
 will apply until then).
What We’re Updating:
This is a complete overhaul of our online terms. We are refocused on creating an easier self-service experience for our customers and believe you deserve the best. So while there are some material changes, the overall themes are - transparency, clarity and limiting legalese.
Start at our brand new 
Legal Homepage
 - your one-stop-shop for all things Legal and Compliance. Consider this your roadmap to determining how to navigate the relevant links/terms in clear language and in one place, holistically.
From there, you should be able to easily navigate which additional terms and policies may apply to you and your Authorized Users (if any).
We’ve added or updated certain terms, including requirements around customer obligations when using Calendly, Calendly’s SMS functionality, our AI features, and more specific terms on confidentiality, use of customer data, and indemnification obligations.
We’ve updated our 
Acceptable Use Policy
 - which applies to all Customers, Authorized Users, Invitees and Website Visitors - to clarify the types of activities that are permitted and prohibited when accessing/using Calendly’s Services and/or Websites.
We’ve also updated our 
Privacy Notice
 to provide more information on how we collect and use personal information in connection with our business practices and new products and features.

subject: SEU Congress 2024 Registration is OPEN!
body:
You don't often get email from office@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
View this email in your browser
 
Registration is now open for the SIETAR-Europa 2024 Congress in Lille, France
Register here
 
We’re so exciting about the upcoming Congress in Lille, which will be a unique opportunity to share ideas, catch up with old friends and make new ones.
Even in the weeks before the Congress, participants will be able to take part in virtual learning opportunities such as a workshop on 'Cultural Reflexivity – a practical approach for training, coaching and consulting in today's complexity' by Gesa Kramer and Kirsten Nazarkiewicz.
The SIETAR Europa Congress itself begins on the evening of 
June 5th, 2024 with an opening reception
. On June 6th, 7th and 8th we will learn, explore and challenge each other.  For example, the programme in Lille will offer such treats as: 'Engaging Otherness: The Ecosystem of Us and Them' with Milton Bennett or 'The Promises and Pitfals of incorporating Artificial Intelligence into workshops on Cross Cultural themes' with Ruth Ann Lake. 
Click here for more about the programme
The Congress will wrap up on 
June 8th
 with 
the biggest party of interculturalists
 that Europe has seen for a while! 
Click here to register
 
The topic of this year congress is "Systems: the ecosystem of interculturalism"
This congress wants to explore systemic dependencies and place interculturalism into a paradigm that looks ahead by acknowledging its past and that shapes its future with intention. We want to begin inventing solutions for problems that are emerging on the horizon, give space for difficult conversations that address the roots of divisions, animosities, and violence, and learn from each other the practical ways in which we can advance communication, co-creation, and constructive dialogue; together.
We are looking forward to seeing you there!
 
Best wishes.
The SIETAR Europa Congress Steering Committee

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
Love is in the air, and it’s not just because of Valentine’s Day — it’s from your faithful editors here at Training Industry, Inc. We aim to provide you with actionable solutions and key insights from expert-written articles on our website and in our magazine.
To show our love, we’ve compiled a great list of articles, events and resources just for you.

Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)

Register for our upcoming 
Leader Talk
, “Using AI to Transform Content Development.”  
As always, we love hearing from you. Please reach out to 
editor@trainingindustry.com

Danielle Johnson 
Associate Editor 
The World’s Biggest Business Event Arrives in Miami!
The Business Show helps you to start or grow your dream business and takes place at The Miami Beach Convention Center March 6-7. 300 world-class exhibitors are showcasing their products and services to elevate your business, and there are 150 seminars and master classes offering you expert guidance. Attend keynotes from the star of Netflix’s “Selling Sunset,” Realtor Maya Vander, and speakers from some of the largest global organizations including Google, Walmart and IBM.

Training Industry Research has identified seven core responsibilities and associated competencies that make up our Training Manager Competency Model™. Based on this model, our 
Training Team Assessment

Our 
Feb. 22 Leader Talk

subject: INTA’s Dana Northcott on industry evolution; resale authentication tech; reaction to Ukraine viral slogan ruling; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
18 February 2024
 
 
INTA’s Dana Northcott on industry evolution; resale authentication tech; reaction to Ukraine viral slogan ruling; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
2024 INTA president Dana Northcott discusses the evolution of the trademark profession and INTA’s future focuses, in an 
interview with WTR
.
 
Monday 12 February
 
Rouse principal Moe Mynn Thu explains everything trademark owners need to know about new levels of protection for 
well-known marks in Myanmar
.
 
Plus:
No exclusivity in the word ‘Premier’, says Delhi High Court
 (India)
Dream is over after Court of Appeal finds infringement of Umbro’s ‘double diamond’ logo
 (United Kingdom)
 
Tuesday 13 February
 
WTR examines 
50 years of Hello Kitty
 brand licensing agreements and trademark filing data.
 
A Manchester City lawsuit, Corsearch design search upgrade and GoDaddy brand-blocking tool feature in 
Tuesday’s news digest
.
 
Plus:
Procter & Gamble v Momeasy: key takeaways
 (Uganda)
Court of Appeal rules that easyGroup suffered damage in Easy Live Auction dispute
 (United Kingdom)
 
Wednesday 14 February
 
IP office updates include more 
USPTO AI guidance
, Norway fee changes and Germany’s copyright expansion.
 
We share insights on working with 
UAE customs authorities
.
 
Plus:
Trademark Gazette now published twice a month: what you need to know
 (Estonia)
Hummel successfully appeals against rejection of chevron position mark
 (Japan)
 
Thursday 15 February
 
A Ukrainian community reacts to the EUIPO’s 
rejection of a viral slogan
 relating to a Russian warship.
 
ZATAP co-founder and CEO David Geisser shares his vision for the future of 
resale authentication
.
 
Plus:
auDRP denial highlights evidentiary burden on complainants
 (Australia)
General Court upholds validity of registered Community design for LEGO toy brick
 (European Union)
Scotch Whisky GI infringement case clarifies independent rights of registered owners following Madya Pradesh High Court ruling
 (Market Insight: India)
Federal Circuit cements threshold between sentiment and source identification in registration refusal
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 16 February
 
An EU study reveals that 
four out of five influencers
 do not disclose advertising content, creating risks for partnering brands.
 
Chanel prevails
 against resellers, the EUIPO expands on its role in fighting fake medicine, a wine metaverse launches, and more.
 
We head to the frontline of 
brand protection in the Philippines
 to uncover strategies for protecting IP rights at the border.
 
Plus:
Office actions relating to International Registrations designating Brazil: what you need to know
 (Brazil)
Middle-earth defeats LORD OF THE WINGS
 (New Zealand)
 
Saturday 17 February
 
Nutromics' head of intellectual property argues that female leaders who are vulnerable can be the best mentors, as she recalls the event that sparked a unique women’s initiative, in this 
week’s opinion column
.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
latest Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.
 
Subscribe
Follow on
 
 
Follow on

subject: INTA president interview exclusive; Apple Vision Pro opportunities; Hello Kitty filing strategy
body:
15 February 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
Apple’s new Vision Pro virtual reality headset offers fresh opportunities to create unique brand experiences, but it comes with some nuanced IP risks. This week, we took a closer look at the brands 
leaping on the technology
, and the IP factors worth considering. Elsewhere, we celebrated 
50 years of Hello Kitty
 by analysing parent company Sanrio’s trademark filings to reveal the diversity of its prosecution strategy over the past half a century.
 
Other trending content:
 
What Super Bowl counterfeit surge means for Nevada court docket
 
How to protect well-known marks in Myanmar
 
Brand Strategy Summit Europe returns with world-class speaker line-up
 
Manchester City lawsuit development; Corsearch design search upgrade; GoDaddy launches brand-blocking tool – news digest
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
“Your in-house mandate must change”: 2024 INTA president on evolution of trademark profession
 
Dana Northcott, 2024 president of INTA, sits down with WTR to discuss the evolution of trademark attorneys to general counsel for brands, INTA’s future focuses and what members can expect from the 2024 Annual Meeting.
Read more
Market Insight 
India 
Remfry & Sagar 
Scotch Whisky GI infringement case clarifies independent rights of registered owners following Madya Pradesh High Court ruling
 
The Scotch Whisky Association has filed an infringement suit that sheds light on the interaction between registered owners and authorised users of geographical indications when it comes to the right to sue in India.
Authors:
Aarti Aggarwal
 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
Federal Circuit cements threshold between sentiment and source identification in registration refusal
 
The informational matter doctrine has proved crucial in deciding where to draw the line between source identification and sentiment following a TTAB refusal to register the mark ‘everybody vs racism’.
Authors:
Sydney McDermott
 
Insight 
Beijing East IP
 
Yan Zhang
 
Tianmei Deng
 
Austin Chang
 
Specialist Chapter: China’s New Punitive Damages System Bolsters Protection Against Trademark Infringement
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Litigation Review 2024
 
The improvement of relevant laws and regulations makes it easier for courts to reach decisions by laying out necessary steps to precisely calculate punitive damages based on agreed compensation. 
Read more »
 
Baker McKenzie
 
Bernard William Malone
 
Ana Paula Gallardo
 
Argentina: A Closer Look at Trademark Law Reforms
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Prosecution Review 2024
 
Argentina’s Trademark Law, first passed in 1980, has been reformed considerably in recent years. As Argentina becomes an increasingly significant destination for brand owners, applicants need to be aware of the relevant laws and regulations. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | BMA House, London 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge.

subject: Join the SIETAR DEIB Learning Series
body:
You don't often get email from no-reply@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
Addressing Workplace Challenges and Trends
 
View this email in your browser
 
We are excited to invite you to the upcoming session of 
the SIETAR Global DEIB Learning series,
 where we delve into crucial conversations surrounding Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) in the workplace. 
In SIETAR People are at the heart of the organization, and fostering a culture of DEIB is essential to achieve sustainable objectives and drive improvement.
Our DEIB Learning series is dedicated to providing high-quality training and content tailored to DEI professionals, practitioners, and intercultural actors, empowering them to make meaningful contributions to DEIB within their respective workplaces.
Join us on 
February 27th from 18:00 to 19:15 CET
 for an engaging session titled:
In Conversation: Addressing the DEIB Challenges and Trends in the Workplace
Featuring distinguished guest speakers:
Pari Namazie,
 Global Executive and Leadership Team Coach, Former SIETAR Europa President
Pr. Carlos Antonio González
, Digital Diplomacy and Geopolitical International Expert, IRELAC Vice President
Tamara Makoni
, Award-Winning Inclusion and Culture Specialist, Founder & CEO of KAZURI Consulting
Liesbeth Huysmans
, ACC (ACTP), Intercultural Consultant, Coach & Trainer, as Chair's final remarks
This session, hosted by Papa Balla Ndong, DEIB Strategist and SIETAR Europa Member, promises to offer fresh insights and actionable strategies for addressing critical DEIB challenges and trends. We are committed to fostering authentic conversations, embracing empathy, and collectively working towards effective DEIB solutions.
By participating in this session, you will have the opportunity to:
Define DEIB concepts
Brainstorm solutions
Anticipate challenges
Envision goals
Key questions to be explored include:
How to move DEIB Strategy to a systemically integrated practice?
How can DEIB help us and our business accelerate change and growth?
What is and will be the impact of AI in Intercultural Work?
And more...
  
Please register via the Link below 
Register here
 
We look forward to your participation and collaboration!
Best regards,
SIETAR Europa Member Benefits Committee

subject: Join the League of Extraordinary Training Programs
body:
You don't often get email from sara.lundkvist@fmsend.eu. 
Learn why this is important
Hi Melissa,
I hope everything is well with you. I'm Sara and I work as a Platform Specialist at Promote. I'm reaching out to see if you or one of your colleagues would be interested in our learning platform. 
To make this message a bit more engaging I'm trying something new - so here comes a superhero saga about Promote and You...
In a world where training programs often fall short of their true potential, there emerges a champion from the shadows of conventional learning platforms, a guardian of knowledge transfer, and a beacon of innovation: The Promote Platform. This isn't just any hero; it's the superhero the training world desperately needs. Let's dive into the saga of Promote, the Superhero of Training Providers.
Origin Story
In the bustling metropolis of Learning and Development, where challenges loom large and the quest for impact and engagement never ceases, Promote was forged. Conceived by the minds at Promote International, this platform was imbued with extraordinary powers to combat the forces of ineffective training and disengagement. Its mission: is to revolutionize how knowledge is applied in the real world.
Powers and Abilities
Promote's strength lies in 
40+ years of research on effective learning methodologies.
An approach focusing on driving behavior change and creating learning journeys for maximum impact.
No superhero is complete without a sid
ekick, and Promote's AI features are the perfect companion.
 
This AI works tirelessly behind the scenes, optimizing the learning experience, saving precious time, and uncovering insights that lead to better strategies and outcomes.
Join the League of Extraordinary Training Programs
Promote, with its unique blend of powers, invites training providers to become part of a new era. An era where training is not just a task but a transformative journey. Where every program launched has the potential to change the professional landscape, empower individuals, and shape the future of organizations.
A Beacon of Hope and Excellence
As the saga of Promote continues, it stands as a beacon of hope in the Learning and Development universe. Its legacy is not just in the programs it has transformed but in the countless professionals it has empowered, the leaders it has created, and the communities it has built.
In a world craving impact, engagement, and real transformation, The Promote Platform emerges not just as a superhero but as a symbol of what's possible when innovation, commitment, and the right tools come together to redefine the future of training.
So, as the sun sets over the skyline of the training world, one thing is clear: 
with Promote by your side, you are no longer just educators; you are heroes, equipped to lead learners into a future where knowledge is not just acquired but lived, breathed, and applied.
 The adventure has just begun.
Maybe a little bit corny but I hope the message got through :)
Are you interested in trying the platform? I'd be happy to schedule a short demo. Alternatively, you can 
 
take a look at it here
 
: 
 
https://promoteint.com/sv/en/training-provider-try-platform/
I am looking forward to hearing from you!
Have a great day!
Kind regards from a snowy Sweden,
Sara Lundkvist
Promote Platform Specialist
Promote International
Slussplan 9
111 30 Stockholm, Sweden
Try the platform
www.promoteint.com
 
Message sent by Promote International at Slussplan 9, 111 30 Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden.

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
At Training Industry, we’re dedicated to providing you with the resources you need to better manage the business of learning in your organization.

here
.

editor@trainingindustry.com
 with your pitches or drafts. 
Sarah Gallo, CPTM 
Senior Editor 
Check Out Our New AI Topic Area!
To help you navigate AI’s rapid development and ever-evolving uses in L&D, we’ve dedicated a topic area on 
TrainingIndustry.com
 strictly to AI. This section offers web and magazine articles, podcasts, webinars and more content related to AI’s role in developing a learning strategy, enhancing personalized training experiences and pushing the boundaries of what's possible in L&D. our latest M&A column
. The fourth quarter of 2023 saw strategic learning tech moves to support organizations’ focus on upskilling and reskilling to develop a future-ready workforce. subject: New WTR 1000; Apple Vision Pro opportunities; AI copyright code; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
11 February 2024
 
 
New WTR 1000; Apple Vision Pro opportunities; AI copyright code; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
WTR 1000 2024 – out now
 
The 
2024 WTR 1000
, revealing the world’s leading trademark professionals, is available now.
 
IP Hall of Fame
 
Help us to choose this year’s IP Hall of Fame inductees. 
Nominate today
.
 
Monday 5 February
 
Sanofi outlines its collegiate approach to 
combatting genericism
.
 
Stock surges for Apple and Dell lead a tech company bounceback in this month’s 
WTR Brand Elite analysis
.
 
Plus:
General Court confirms that former tennis player’s mark may remain registered for certain Class 25 goods
 (European Union)
Sika fails to stop Nippon Paint from using disputed get-up involving colours and numeral
 (Malaysia)
 
Tuesday 6 February
 
A new report reveals the extent to which 
plain packaging on tobacco products
 has spread around the world, but with “no indication” of moving to other products.
 
Chinese police IP stats
, Canon’s Amazon takedown results and New Balance’s new resale platform feature in Tuesday’s news digest.
 
We examine brand protection strategies at the 
Japanese border
.
 
Plus:
Nothing went south for The North Agency
 (Australia)
General Court rebukes Board of Appeal in LABKABLE opposition
 (European Union)
 
Wednesday 7 February
 
The UK government sets aside plans for an 
AI copyright code of practice
, with implications overseas.
 
The USPTO clarifies its AI guidance, the EUIPO introduces a GI service, Chile extends deadlines for wildfire victims, and more, in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
 
Plus:
Court of Appeal upholds IPEC decision in anti-ageing serum dispute
 (United Kingdom)
Ownership of social media accounts: appellate court issues second decision
 (United States)
 
Thursday 8 February
 
New headset technology the 
Apple Vision Pro
 presents big opportunities for brands – and nuanced IP risks.
 
We 
head to Thailand
 to understand the challenges of – and best solutions for – brand protection at the country’s borders.
 
Plus:
Joint European Commission-EUIPO report on detentions of products infringing industrial and IP rights
 (European Union)
IPEC ‘de-cider’ over Aldi’s lookalike packaging leaves a sour taste for brands
 (United Kingdom)
Premier League appeal victory highlights principles of composite mark comparison
 (Market Insight: India)
Jack Daniel’s case prompts Ninth Circuit Punchbowl reversal
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 9 February
 
Court data analysis reveals what a 
Super Bowl counterfeiting surge
 might mean for the Nevada district docket.
 
Coca-Cola is the target of a 
satirical art project
 and fast-food brand values fall in Friday’s news digest.
 
Plus:
CJEU: no ‘repair’ clause in EU trademark law
 (European Union)
‘livingedge.com’ dispute: living on the edge of bad faith
 (International)
 
Saturday 10 February
 
Canon, Hasbro, Liverpool Football Club and Mars are among the 
stellar line-up of speakers
 at this year’s 
WTR Brand Strategy Summit Europe
.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
new Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.

subject: Reminder: Navigate the Complex Landscape of Employment-Related Tax Credits
body:
Join us on February 29 to learn about employment-related tax credits such as the ERC, WOTC, federal empowerment zone credits, and more!
View in browser
 
 
 
Navigating Credits and Incentives: ERC, WOTC, and More
 
WEBINAR
  |  Thursday, February 29  |  11 a.m. – noon CT   
Recommended CPE: 1 credit, Taxes  
Register Now
 
Attend our 
complimentary 
webinar as CLA tax professionals show you how to navigate the complex landscape of employment-related tax credits. We’ll cover the employee retention credit (ERC), the work opportunity credit (WOTC), federal empowerment zone credits, and more!  
 
Learn how to use credits and incentives to add value and discover potentially significant tax savings for your organization.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Identify the purpose of the credits 
Describe the opportunities and limitations of each credit 
Explain the process to claim the credits and the impact of each on the tax return 
Discuss the updates, guidance, and warnings from the IRS related to eligibility for the ERC 
Discuss common questions related to the listed credits 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for business owners, CEOs, CFOs, and tax or human resources professionals.  
 
Speakers

subject: New WTR 1000 out now; INTA’s corporate IP reporting guide; Sanofi on genericism
body:
08 February 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week, we launched the 
2024 
WTR 1000
. Following months of extensive research, the 
WTR 1000
 reveals the world’s leading trademark professionals, offering the definitive tool for those seeking stellar trademark expertise and partners worldwide. Click 
here to access the full 
WTR
 
1000
.
 
Elsewhere, WTR sat down with past INTA president Zeeger Vink to discuss the value of the new 
INTA presidential taskforce report on IP reporting
. With a checklist of actions for corporate counsel to take when reporting on trademarks and brands to their colleagues, investors and customers, the report acts as a practical guide and starting point for change, Vink said.
 
Other trending content:
 
Sanofi’s collegiate approach to combatting genericism
 
UK government sets aside plan for AI and copyright code of practice
 
Tobacco plain packaging spreads around the world; “no indication” of move to other product categories
 
US court due to hear range of allegations against Shein is unusual choice, docket data suggests
 
Icons of industry: help us to choose this year’s IP Hall of Fame inductees
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
AI inventor Stephen Thaler urges courts to recognise "sentient" systems
 
In an exclusive interview, Stephen Thaler claims that the IP system needs an overhaul to recognise the creativity of “sentient” AI technology and to promote innovation across industries.
Read more
Market Insight 
India 
Remfry & Sagar 
Premier League appeal victory highlights principles of composite mark comparison
 
The Delhi High Court has favoured the Football Association Premier League in an appeal brought by textile company Premier Mills. The decision sheds light on the laws that govern the comparison of composite trademarks in India and how they can be applied in disputes.
Authors:
Bisman Kaur
 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
Prior analogous trademark use proves fatal for Cosmic Crusaders in TTAB cancellation
 
After a precedential 2022 decision, the TTAB has highlighted how prior analogous trademark use can impact priority in a recent spat between two competing comic creators.
Authors:
Eleanor B Atkins 
Insight 
Villaseca Abogados
 
Alvaro Arévalo 
Francisco Valverde 
Chile: Turbulent Year Sees IP Rethink and Introduction of Madrid Protocol
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Prosecution Review 2024
 
The year 2022 witnessed an overhaul of Chile’s IP regime with significant changes made to its Industrial Property Law and the Madrid Protocol finally entering into force. While the IP law reforms have broadened to include a wider range of non-traditional marks, concerns have been raised about the protocol’s implementation. 
Read more »
 
AFD China Intellectual Property Law Office
 
Xiao Ning
 
Mingzhao Yang
 
High-compensation patent litigation highlights courts’ growing willingness to award significant damages
 
Featured in 
Inside China’s IP Market: a Guide 2024
 
How to determine compensation amounts and effectively protect rights holders’ interests is a critical point of concern. It is therefore vital to analyse patent infringement litigation cases that have awarded high compensation and which kinds of claims and evidence have been well received by Chinese courts. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | BMA House, London 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge.

Extensions updates underway
Hi C.,
In the coming months, we’ll transition our browser extensions and Outlook add-in to version 4.0. That transition will bring new features and functionality, along with two changes that we wanted to give a heads up on:
We’re updating our browser permissions request
.
If you’re using our extension on Chrome, Firefox, or Edge, you’ll be asked to confirm an updated set of permissions. These permissions will make our extension even easier to access, no matter where you’re working on the web. You deserve transparency around anything related to your privacy and security — that’s why we’ve outlined 
how we will (and won’t) use these new permissions
 and how admins can apply customizations or restrictions at an organization level.
We’re updating the way starring (or favoriting) works
.
Currently, you can favorite both main scheduling pages (including team pages) and event scheduling pages. 
View a quick visual comparison
 of the two. Soon, you’ll no longer be able to favorite main scheduling pages, but you 
will
 still be able to favorite event scheduling pages. We recommend you revisit any main scheduling pages you have starred, if any, and bookmark them in your browser or switch to favoriting event scheduling pages instead.
Questions, comments, or feedback? We’re all ears — reply to let us know.
Happy scheduling,
The Calendly Team 
This is an essential product communication, which is why you're receiving this even if you've unsubscribed from Marketing emails.

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 February 4, 2024
body:
TICE 2024 agenda, new podcast episode and more. 
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
As we shake off the January dust and get into the swing of 2024, Training Industry has a great lineup of articles, events and resources to help you get up to speed.
Check out the
 new episode
 of The Business of Learning to learn about emerging trends in learning tech from learning leaders Elizabeth Greene and Dr. Stella Lee.
Browse our 
TICE 2024
 agenda to learn about the event’s speakers, breakout sessions and more. Reserve your spot in our upcoming 
Leader Talks
 to learn how you can transform your sales team through training.
Finally, check out this week's articles on subjects like understanding assessment tools, improving your company culture with positive thinking and an in-depth look at the mergers and acquisitions that shaped the industry in the fourth quarter of 2023.
As always, we love hearing from you! Reach out with any questions, comments or article suggestions to
editor@trainingindustry.com
. Have a great week!
Mike Allen, CPTM 
Editor 
[Workshop] Build and Sustain an Effective Compliance and Ethics Training Program
Join us virtually for a 
two-day workshop
 where a faculty of experienced compliance professionals will provide a comprehensive, in-depth look at the core principles of a successful training programs, including who and what to train, developing engaging content, measuring success and identifying indicators for change.
View Agenda & Register
 
The Business of Learning, Episode 72: What’s Next in Learning Tech?
In The Business of Learning's season seven kickoff, we explored AI advancements and other trends in the learning tech space with learning leaders Dr. Stella Lee and Elizabeth Greene. 
Tune in
 for insights on how to make strategic tech selections for L&D, learning tech’s role in skills-based training and how to maximize your organization’s learning tech stack.
Listen Now
 
Just Announced: Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE) Agenda
Our 
TICE 2024
 agenda is now available! TICE brings L&D leaders together for three interactive days of learning and networking where you will discover solutions to common challenges and ways to better prepare you and your workforce for the future. Explore the agenda to see the speakers, breakout sessions, learning tracks, keynotes and networking events that will be happening June 4-6 in Raleigh, N.C. We hope to see you there!

 where sales and learning experts share strategies for developing high-performing sales teams. subject: INTA IP reporting guide; Notorious Markets analysis; Stephen Thaler AI interview; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
04 February 2024
 
 
INTA IP reporting guide; Notorious Markets analysis; Stephen Thaler AI interview; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Long Read
 
Two 
new GI regulations
 take effect in China, with some contradictions.
 
Monday 29 January
 
The 
LEGO Group triumphs
 using copyright claims to stop counterfeiters with a record-breaking turnover.
 
This month’s 
Domain Watch
 sees closed generics off the table, a big win for Verizon, and new gTLDs hitting sunrise.
 
Plus:
ZARA gift cards: CJEU clarifies scope of ‘referential’ use of third-party trademarks
 (European Union)
Law No 206: new rules on trademarks in the cultural field and new powers of the Ministry of Enterprise
 (Italy)
 
Tuesday 30 January
 
Audi reacts
 to its CJEU win, the strongest academic medical centre brands are revealed, Anaqua and AnyGen AI partner up, and more.
 
We head 
to Nepal
 for brand protection insight at the border.
 
Plus:
Blow for Monster Energy in BABYMONSTER opposition
 (Singapore)
DUMAX and DULUX - same paint, different colour?
 (South Africa)
 
Wednesday 31 January
 
The Office of the US Trade Representative’s 
Notorious Markets List
 reveals some notable absences.
 
A fake Brazilian IP office website and Norway’s first multimedia mark are among the talking points of this week’s 
IP office updates
.
 
Plus:
CJEU considers burden of proving exhaustion of rights conferred by EUTMs
 (European Union)
Delhi High Court restrains Indiamart from including PUMA marks in drop-down menu search options
 (India)
 
Thursday 1 February
 
INTA’s new presidential task force report
 on IP reporting offers a practical guide for corporate counsel and a starting point for change, says past president Zeeger Vink.
 
Local experts share advice on working with 
Customs in Poland
.
 
Plus:
Supreme Court awards New Balance Rmb30 million in damages in dispute with infringer
 (China)
Chanel defeated in trademark opposition against COCOCHI
 (Japan)
Validating trademark use in the face of cancellation challenges
 (Market Insight: China)
Prior analogous trademark use proves fatal for Cosmic Crusaders in TTAB cancellation
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 2 February
 
INTA unveils its IP 
"judiciary of the future"
, Mango heads to Roblox, Abion launches in Dubai, and more.
 
The US district court due to hear a range of allegations against Shein is an 
unusual choice
, docket data suggests.
 
Plus:
KIPO SJP's investigative authority further expanded
 (South Korea)
Court of Appeal confirms Samsung's liability for offering third-party infringing apps on its app store
 (United Kingdom)
 
Saturday 3 February
 
AI inventor Stephen Thaler and his lawyer, Ryan Abbott, urge the courts to 
recognise "sentient" systems
, in a WTR interview.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
new Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.
 
Subscribe
Follow on
 
 
Follow on
 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866

subject: A Certification Program Designed For You, by You
body:
CPTM is the credential you need to advance your career.
View this email in your browser
.
 
The 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM)
 credential is an industry leading credential focused specifically on the training manager role.
Through decades of research on the 
core processes of great training organizations
, Training Industry recognized that training managers need practical job aids and strategies to be successful. The CPTM program was designed specifically to help you strategically align training to business results, which is 
the foundation of great training
.
The program is application and business focused. In fact, 
90% of CPTMs
 said they were able to apply the tools they gained through certification to their job right away.
To learn more about how certification will equip you with the tools and strategies you have been looking for, 
download the program brochure
Learn More

We understand the challenges that learning and development (L&D) professionals face in managing training programs that align with organizational goals and drive business impact. subject: Notorious Markets omissions; LEGO Group’s copyright strategy; Boeing crisis examined
body:
01 February 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
The Office of the US Trade Representative’s 
annual Notorious Markets Report
 reveals some notable absences this year, with AliExpress dropped from the list. But those calling for the inclusion of social media platforms were left disappointed. Elsewhere, 
the LEGO Group’s legal team
 reveals the strategy that went into arguing that its products should be protected as artistic works, in order to triumph against record-breaking copycats in China.
 
Other trending content:
 
Boeing’s blowout offers lessons for brand owners facing crisis
 
Surging counterfeit litigation drives up US dispute numbers
 
Why Madrid may not be your best strategy in the US
 
Domain Watch: closed generics remain off the table; big win for Verizon; new gTLDs hit sunrise
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Long Read
 
New foreign GI regulations take effect in China, with some contradictions
 
Local experts unpick the differences between two regulations on the registration, administration and protection of geographical indications, set to enter into effect today.
Read more
Market Insight 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
Prior analogous trademark use proves fatal for Cosmic Crusaders in TTAB cancellation
 
After a precedential 2022 decision, the TTAB has highlighted how prior analogous trademark use can impact priority in a recent spat between two competing comic creators.
Authors:
Eleanor B Atkins 
China 
Kangxin Partners PC 
Validating trademark use in the face of cancellation challenges
 
Non-use cancellation attacks can be a major struggle for trademark owners in China. To successfully defend against such an action, they must be able to provide convincing evidence of valid use, which can take various forms. Careful selection of goods/services classes during registration will help to fight against future challenges.
Authors:
Cynthia Wang
 
Insight 
Satyapon & Partners Ltd
 
Satyapon Sachdecha
 
Kritsana Mingtongkhum
 
Shantanu Ajit Tambe
 
Thailand: Proactive enforcement reduces infringement and increases investor confidence in growing economy
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
Concerted government efforts to halt counterfeiting and the flow of fakes are paying off handsomely, but more work is needed to make the country a leading jurisdiction for IP enforcement. 
Read more »
 
Markery Law LLC
 
Stacey Watson
 
Jackie Patt
 
Katrina Hull
 
United States: Common Mistakes in Prosecuting Trademarks and How to Avoid Them
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Prosecution Review 2024
 
While trademark registration with the USPTO offers owners a plethora of rights, it is crucial for trademark owners to be aware of the many pitfalls – for example, with regard to the proper and timely identification of all goods and services intended to be covered by an application – before embarking on prosecution. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | BMA House, London

On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge.

subject: Reminder: Learn About the Latest R&D Credit Developments
body:
Join us to learn the latest research and development credits that may impact your organization, including changes to IRS code Section 174.
View in browser
 
 
 
CLA’s Annual R&D Credit Update
 
WEBINAR 
|  Wednesday, February 7  |  11 a.m. – noon CT 
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credit, Taxes
Register Now
 
Research and development (R&D) credits can be a valuable tool for innovative organizations. However, the rules surrounding R&D tax credits can be complex and are continuingly changing at the federal and state level.  
 
Attend our 
complimentary
 webinar to learn how the latest R&D developments may impact your organization, including the important change to research expensing under IRS code Section 174.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize what activities and expenses qualify under the R&D credit rules 
Describe how the credit can be applied against income and payroll taxes 
Discuss how recent judicial and legislative developments impact the credit 
Recognize the impact of the Section 174 capitalization requirement 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for leadership and finance professionals in all industries looking to take advantage of potential tax savings with R&D credits.

Border and customs protection around the world

Melissa,

Terms of Service
 and our 
Privacy Policy
.
We encourage you to read our updated terms and policies in full, but at a glance, here are some key updates:
Updated the 
Indeed Ads Program Terms
 to clarify how ads are published and sponsored on the website and how our pricing models work.
Added information to our 
Terms of Service for All Users
 about Indeed's use of algorithms, machine learning and other forms of 'artificial intelligence'.
Published an FAQ on 
AI and 'Automated Employment Decision Tools'
.
Updated the 
Region-specific section
 of our Privacy Policy and our 
Data Processing Agreement
 to account for changes in applicable cross-border data transfer laws, including the EU-US Data Privacy Framework.
Updated the 
Data Collection and Use
 and 
Who We Share Your Data With
 sections of our Privacy Policy to clearly present the information we collect and share and the legal bases we rely on to use personal data.
Updated our 
Privacy Policy
 with information about our demographic data collection practices and your rights to edit and remove this data at any time.
Added an Ad Choices section to our 
HR Tech Privacy Center
 to increase transparency and control over the types of digital advertising you receive as well as updated information about how we collect and share data between our affiliates.
Starting February 1, 2024, Indeed will only be available for use by people 18 years of age and older in certain regions. This includes countries within the EEA, as well as Switzerland, UK, Turkey, and Ukraine.
For users in India:
 please note that we have updated our 
Privacy Policy
 in line with the 2023 Digital Personal Data Protection Act. By continuing to use our services, you consent to the use of your data as described in the Privacy Policy.
Please note our headquarters in the United States and Ireland have new mailing addresses.
For the US: Indeed Tower, 200 West 6th Street, Floor 36, Austin, TX 78701, USA. 
For Ireland: Dublin - Block B, Capital Dock, 80 Sir John Rogerson’s Quay, Grand Canal Dock, Dublin 2, D02, HE36, Ireland.

subject: Tap into Tax Credits for Green Energy Investments and Manufacturing
body:
Learn about tax credits for green energy investments and manufacturing under the Inflation Reduction Act for private and public entities.
View in browser
 
 
 
Monetizing Clean Energy Credits from the Inflation Reduction Act
 
WEBINAR
  |  March 7  |  11 a.m. – noon CT
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credit, Taxes
Register Now
 
The Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) creates significant opportunities for organizations to tap into tax credits for their green energy investments and manufacturing activities. Both private and public sector organizations can take advantage of these incentives, including governmental and tax-exempt entities. 
 
CLA’s federal tax strategies team will review what credits are available under the IRA, which types of entities can benefit from the incentives, how credits can be transferred between taxpayers, and the registration process to receive available cash or tax credit benefits.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize various tax credit and incentive opportunities under the IRA 
Describe the latest legal and regulatory updates under the IRA 
Discuss tax credit investments and tax credit transferability in more detail  
Identify how to claim potential tax credits available for your organization   
Who should attend  
This session is designed for leadership and finance professionals in all industries looking to take advantage of the potential tax savings with the Inflation Reduction Act.

subject: Heads-up: Scoro Wrapped will be released on January 31.
body:
You don't often get email from hello@scoro.com. 
Learn why this is important
We’re contacting you to let you know that we’ll be releasing Scoro Wrapped on January 31st to all your site users. 
 
 
Dear Scoro site admin,
We’re contacting you to let you know that we’ll be releasing 
Scoro Wrapped on January 31st
 to all your site users. 
What is Scoro Wrapped?
Scoro Wrapped is Scoro’s version of a year-in-review based on individual statistics. Each user will see a fun summary of their 2023 based on data in Scoro, such as their most productive day, most productive month, time spent in meetings, etc. By default, everyone will have the option to share these insights on LinkedIn to showcase their achievements.
 
Here’s a little sneak peek of what to expect:
 
What action is required from you?
No action is required if you are happy to let your team share such insights on LinkedIn.
 
However, we understand the importance of privacy and control. Therefore, we’re also giving you the option to disable direct sharing to LinkedIn before Scoro Wrapped becomes available for your site users.
 
To disable the sharing, go to 
Settings > Administration > Security settings
 and untick the respective setting. This way, the LinkedIn share button will be greyed out on the Scoro Wrapped cards.
 
Scoro Wrapped will be available for all users until February 8th. You can disable or enable the sharing option anytime between January 29th and February 8th.
 
Team Scoro
P.S. You’re receiving this email because you are listed as a billing or primary point of contact for an existing Scoro account.
 
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.
You are receiving this email because you have a Scoro account. For more information about how we process data, please see our

.

subject: IP Disruptors revealed; Boeing crisis lessons; USPTO impersonation concerns; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
28 January 2024
 
 
IP Disruptors revealed; Boeing crisis lessons; USPTO impersonation concerns; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
IP Disruptors: Special Report
 
Our 
brand new Special Report
 reveals the technology providers, industry leaders and institutional figures that we consider to be true disruptors in the IP space. These 20 companies and individuals are driving change and upending IP norms, revolutionising how IP managers, teams and owners operate in the future.
 
Monday 22 January
 
A new low-cost filing platform sparks concern as WTR uncovers 
letters that impersonate
 official USPTO documents.
 
Local experts offer brand protection advice for managing imports and exports 
at the Vietnam border
.
 
Plus:
General Court: Board of Appeal erred in maintaining LUTAMAX registration only for Class 5 sub-category
 (European Union)
New regulation establishes official fees for trademark cancellation and invalidation proceedings
 (Slovenia)
 
Tuesday 23 January
 
Dwayne Johnson gains 
ownership of THE ROCK
, David Beckham launches an anti-counterfeiting suit, IP litigation is expected to rise, and more.
 
The Bahamas government seeks views on reforms, President Joe Biden nominates a deputy USTR, and more in 
this month’s policy watch
.
 
Plus:
EUIPO: ‘iconic’ Prada triangle pattern is basic and commonplace
 (European Union)
COOLFLEX held to be descriptive for mattresses
 (Switzerland)
 
Wednesday 24 January
 
Meta 
boosts its IP protection tools
 as a new survey finds that social media infringement is on the rise.
 
An 
Italy fraud warning
, Japan’s Letters of Consent and an expanded SME fund feature in this week’s IP office updates.
 
Plus:
The EVENTUM case: infringement of trademark owned by company in liquidation and legal standing of one of its partners
 (Spain)
FILA v EILO: Re-examination and Evaluation Board carries out global appreciation of visual aspects of conflicting marks
 (Türkiye)
 
Thursday 25 January
 
Boeing’s blowout
 offers lessons for brand owners facing crisis.
 
We gain insights from the front line of 
brand protection in India
.
 
Plus:
General Court scrutinises complementarity of Class 33 goods and Class 35 services
 (European Union)
French fashion magazine Elle defeated in opposition against ELLLE HOTEL
 (Japan)
Winning strategies for resolving domain name disputes in China
 (Market Insight: China)
 
Friday 26 January
 
Pokémon's 
Palworld
 investigation
, an “unsettling” decision in Thatchers’ dispute with Aldi, and the validity of the LEGO brick design are among Friday’s talking points.
 
Data analysis reveals an uptick in US trademark disputes driven by a 
boom in counterfeit cases
.
 
Plus:
The doctrine of clarifications in Ecuador: rules and procedures
 (Ecuador)
Supreme Court issues landmark decision on criteria for dilution under Trademark Act
 (South Korea)
 
Saturday 27 January
 
Potomac Law Group partners Julia Anne Matheson and Janet Satterthwaite reveal why 
Madrid filings may not be your best strategy
 in the United States.

Follow on
