subject: USPTO interview exclusive; world’s busiest filing agents; CIPO fee increases; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
24 December 2023
 
 
USPTO interview exclusive; world’s busiest filing agents; CIPO fee increases; and much more
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days.
Long Read
In an 
exclusive interview
, USPTO trademark commissioner David Gooder outlines key developments and challenges at the agency over the past 12 months, before revealing his plans and focuses for the coming year.
Monday 18 December
The Canadian Intellectual Property Office 
increases its fees
 for the first time in almost 20 years, in an effort to help reduce the substantial backlog of unexamined applications. 
We reveal the challenges of – and solutions for – brand protection at 
Qatar border points
.
Tuesday 19 December
Temu 
takes on Shein
, Unilever is accused of greenwashing, Oatly wins the right to use ‘milk’, and more.
Apple and L’Oréal lead the filing pack, as Meta and Amazon file for virtual reality and telehealth brands, according to 
Corsearch data analysis.
Wednesday 20 December 
WTR uncovers the companies filing the highest numbers of 
trademarks in-house
.
Finland raises its fees, the USPTO confirms two new offices, the EUIPO welcomes ARIPO leaders, and more, in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
Thursday 21 December
Prosecution work halves for the most active Chinese agents, as the world’s 
top trademark representatives
 diversify, according to new filing data.
We outline best practices and strategies for combatting counterfeit goods at the 
South African border
.
Friday 22 December
Local experts run through the 
biggest UK trademark decisions
 of the year – with one lined up for 2024 that is sure to keep the industry talking.
Paramount and Warner Bros Discovery consider a merger, Rolex is 
fined €91.6 million
, ‘.ai’ domain names increase, and more.
Saturday 23 December
Non-traditional EU marks, a China law change and bitcoin bad faith are among the talking points of the five 
most-read Legal Updates
 of 2023.
Special Report: Safeguarding Style
WTR 
latest Special Report
 delves into the multifaceted landscape of brand creation and protection in the fashion and luxury industry, exploring the filing strategies, anti-counterfeiting technologies and international collaborations that are essential to success.
Subscribe
Follow us on LinkedIn 
  and Twitter 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866
Manage your email preferences, unsubscribe or opt out.
To receive our emails without interruption, please add us to your safe senders list.

subject: Are You the Learning Leader You Want to Be?
body:
Reaching your goals requires investment.
View this email in your browser
.
 
You have career goals, but you also have day-to-day responsibilities that can monopolize your energy and focus. How are you prioritizing yourself and your professional development plan?
To reach your dreams of becoming a leader in learning and development (L&D), there's no better place to look than Training Industry's 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™)
 credential. Download this 
pre-filled professional development plan
 to help you get started.
How can CPTM position you for success in training management?
Build your foundation
: The on-demand eLearning gives you the foundation you need to apply advanced L&D concepts with your peers in the live session, along with tools and templates to make the knowledge actionable in your role.
Build your network
: The CPTM program includes a four-day live, virtual session. Your cohort in this experience will become your lifelong peers and, once you become a CPTM, you gain access to the CPTM alumni network, with a range of exclusive 
benefits
.
Build your confidence
: When you have the foundation, tools and support you need, you gain confidence as a professional. That's why 
100% of CPTMs 
who certified last year agreed that earning their CPTM credential increased their confidence in their ability to perform their job role.
To learn more about how CPTM can fit into your professional development plan, 
schedule a call
 one of our professional development specialists, or click below to download the program brochure.

subject: Calendly Product Update — 2023 Best-of List
body:
You don't often get email from product-feedback@send.calendly.com. 
Learn why this is important
Explore these end-of-year updates from Calendly.
͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ 
Hi C.,
This is Jeff from 
Calendly
, sharing our end-of-year product update of the most popular things we launched! Before I start, I want to thank each of you for not only being amazing Calendly customers, but also the kind suggestions you’ve shared over the past year. It’s 
messages like these
 that inspire us!
Updated Design
We’ve always believed a 
clean, simple-to-use design
 sets many scheduling tools apart. However, we can always learn more about “user experience” by listening to you all.
After dozens of customer interviews, we launched a refreshed Calendly with a convenient sidebar for navigation, more intuitive Event Type editing, and better Availability settings — while still offering the powerful scheduling capabilities you depend on.
Speaking of 
Event Types
, long-time users know this is our system for allowing you to make available different blocks of times for your invitees: 30-minute Video Call, 15-Minute Quick Phone Call, 45-Minute In-Person Meeting. (Multiple event types require an 
upgrade to a paid subscription plan
.) 
Event Types got even better this year with some updates including the ability to 
customize your settings before you share your link
. Now, there’s less need to create a whole new event type to update settings (e.g., duration, location) for a quick, one-off change. 
Try Out the New UI
New Availability Setting: Global Holidays
“Just in time for the holi…” We have customers all over the world, so I try to be careful and not assume it’s the holiday season for you! But, if you do observe holidays, you’ll really love our 
new holidays settings
 — all year long.
Our default Holidays feature automatically blocks event types on country-specific holidays, providing an easy way to respect cultural and personal commitments. Go to your Availability settings (bottom left-hand section of the navigation), and you’ll now find a new Holidays tab to get started.
While you’re in your 
Availability settings
, ensure you still like your “default hours” — or even think about adding another schedule. For example, my default hours for meetings are 9:00 to 5:00 Monday through Friday, but I have a special vacation schedule I can turn on to allow for a meeting on Thursdays. 
Try Holidays
Improved Collective and Round Robin Event Types
I love collaborative scheduling, so this is one of my favorite updates of the year!
Hundreds of teams use our 
collaborative scheduling features
 to schedule better together as coworkers: 
Distribute meeting opportunities with available teammates such as sales or customer-success professionals (
Round Robin
 feature)
Team up with a coworker (hiring manager plus recruiter) to encourage a job candidate to join your company (
Collective
 feature)
But you all wanted more — and we’re giving it to you: 
Collective 
plus
 Round Robin
.
Available on the 
Teams and Enterprise subscription plans
, you can now mix and match Collective and Round Robin capabilities to easily get a combination of teammates scheduled. For example, you can improve: 
Product demos to prospects
: Set up an event type with an account executive plus one of five rotating sales engineers
Panel interviews
: Pair a hiring manager with one of three rotating team leaders plus one of four rotating peers interviewers
New-customer onboarding calls
: Include a sales manager who closed the deal plus their assigned customer success manager and one of four rotating technical implementation specialists
Try Collective and Round Robin
Routing Improvements
Have you always wanted to 
add scheduling to your website
 like so many companies did in 2023, yet you’ve yearned for more control over who could book a meeting? And once the customer or recruit booked a meeting, you wished it would route to the right teammate?
That’s where 
Routing
 comes in: Now, you can qualify people by asking questions before they book a time, and then route them to the correct person on your team.
Our marketing and sales customers inspired us to improve Routing by building integrations with their existing tools: 
Integrate Calendly Routing with your 
HubSpot
, 
Marketo
, or 
Pardot
 third-party forms (available on our 
Teams plan
)
Use our own 
Routing forms
 (
Teams plan
) – if you don’t have a third-party form
Conduct Salesforce CRM lookup
 and account matching (
Enterprise plan
)
Examine 
Routing Analytics
 to track meeting conversion rates and see how forms perform
Sync data back to your marketing-automation system such as Marketo
 to power retargeting campaigns (e.g., if someone fills out a form, but doesn’t book a meeting, trigger an email) (
Teams plan
)
Get Routing
Analytics Improvements
We aimed our first introduction of 
Analytics
 at account administrators seeking to understand scheduling trends — across their team. Now, each person on your team can view their own meeting data in their 
personal Analytics Dashboard
. 
Available on the 
Standard subscription plan
, your personal Analytics Dashboard allows you to fine-tune scheduling with 
insights
 like popular meeting times, top event types, total completed events, and more. 
Learn More
Account-Admin Tool Updates
Have you thanked your account administrator lately? As our thank-you, we’ve recently released a bevy of updates to make their lives easier: 
Admin Dashboard
: See organization-wide activity — pending invites, missing calendar and video conferencing connections, and key event stats — in one central location. (Available on the 
Standard subscription plan
)
User Profiles
: Review teammate-specific details, such as their calendar and video integrations, availability, and quick links to their event types, by clicking on a user’s avatar. (
Standard plan
)
Group Admin Improvements
: Group Admins can now invite teammates, create Managed Events, and view meeting data in the Analytics Dashboard for their Calendly Groups. (
Teams plan
)
Top Webinars From 2023
Thousands of you attended our webinars this year for 
getting started
, using 
Calendly as a team
, and learning more about best practices in your role. These were our most popular webinars in 2023:
Sales & Marketing teams: 
How to Fill Pipeline During Economic Uncertainty
 
Customer Success and Support teams: 
Build a Better Journey for Retention: Pro Tips for CS Teams
Recruiting teams: 
Hire Faster with Calendly: Pro Tips for Recruiters
Education teams: 
How Dartmouth Supports Student Wellbeing with Calendly
Financial Services teams: 
How Financial Services Companies Drive Revenue with Calendly
 
CRM Improvements
Salesforce
: One of our most popular integrations is with Salesforce, as it allows sales teams to sync meeting data into this popular CRM. We improved the integration this year by allowing admins to now 
sync data to Salesforce by groups
 (e.g., a Sales Group), sync profile links and Calendly Managed Event links to Salesforce, and sync no-show status to the CRM. (Available on our 
Enterprise plan
)
Dynamics
: Our Microsoft-loving customers spoke up and asked for an integration with Microsoft’s CRM: Dynamics. And of course we had to deliver. With our Microsoft Dynamics 365 integration, when Calendly meetings are scheduled, your invitee information and scheduled meeting information is automatically added (or updated) in your records. (Available on our 
Enterprise plan
) 
Other Popular Integrations
Linktree
: Easily add your Calendly to this service used by millions of social influencers and more.
Gong
: Gong released its outbound-sales engagement platform this year, and chose Calendly as a scheduling integration.
Zapier
: Don’t see an integration you like? Zapier has probably made it possible for you. 
View Integrations
Domain Control
In 2023, we launched 
Domain Control
 for account admins and IT departments looking to guide employees signing up for Calendly to join their primary accounts, where team scheduling features and account-wide integrations (e.g., Managed Events, Salesforce, etc.) are set up and ready to go. 
Learn More
Updated 
Browser Extensions
 and 
Mobile Apps
Join me and many others, and make it easier to use Calendly wherever you are with our 
mobile apps
 and 
browser extensions
.
Our tools are now better at group collaboration with shared event type avatars and meeting polls, faster at serving up exactly what you’re looking for with event type search, more flexible with one-off meetings, and more embedded in your other tools from Google Calendar to Gong. 
Calendly Access Update
Do you allowlist Calendly IPs? If so, you’ll want to read more about an 
upcoming change.
 
Additional Popular Resources
Report: 
Total Economic Impact of Calendly by Forrester Research
 
Report: 
State of Scheduling Report
 
Customer Stories
Oh my, there was so much to write about this year! Next year’s product-launch list is going to be even greater. Stay tuned! And thank you again for all of your input and support! 
Happy 2024,
Jeff Hardison
Head of Product Marketing @ Calendly
P.S. And one more thing! 
Here’s how to find how many meetings
 you created this year with Calendly. Share your end-of-year results with us in the comments. 
Need help?
  
Help Center
 ‌ | ‌ 
Pricing & FAQs
 ‌ | ‌ 
Contact Us
 
More than a scheduling link.
 
 
 
 
 
115 E. Main Street, Suite A1B, Buford, GA 30518
www.calendly.com
 ‌ | ‌

subject: Publisher-Exclusive Update: OpenSesame's 2023 Year in Review
body:
You don't often get email from hello@opensesame.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
As we approach the end of 2023, it's the perfect time to reflect on the incredible journey we've had together at OpenSesame. Your dedication to building world-class elearning courses has played a pivotal role in making this year a success.
Let's dive into some exciting statistics from our 2023 year in review!
Average Course Rating:
Courses added in 2023 achieved an average rating of 
4.16 out of 5 stars
, marking a 5% increase from the previous year. This is a testament to the quality and relevance of the content you and other publishers have brought to our platform. Your commitment to excellence has not gone unnoticed!
Total Number of Courses Added:
Drumroll, please! In 2023, we added a staggering 
11,812
 new courses to our ever-expanding library, representing a 
129%
 increase over the previous year. Your creative contributions have enriched the learning experience for professionals worldwide, and helped thousands of learners advance their purpose. Here are the categories that grew the most in 2023:
Sales
Communication
Sustainability
Cybersecurity Compliance
Sexual Harassment
Number of Courses Updated:
This year, with your help, we executed a total of 
31,809
 course updates, ensuring that our content remains fresh, relevant, and in tune with the latest industry trends and best practices.
New Languages Added:
This year, we introduced 
3,344
 courses built in multiple languages, opening up access to learning for individuals across the globe. This has helped us break down barriers to access and cater to an even broader audience.
Accessibility enhancements:
This year we have made significant strides in the realm of content accessibility and have dedicated significant resources to making these courses more easily discoverable within the OpenSesame catalog. Today, 
11,567
 courses in the OpenSesame Plus catalog are accessible based on Section 508 and/or WCAG standards. We look forward to continuing to work with our publisher community to expand this offering, and make it easier for customers to find and identify content that’s accessible for all.
We sincerely appreciate your partnership and the effort you've invested in making OpenSesame a trusted source of world class elearning courses. As we wrap up this year, we want to extend our heartfelt gratitude to you and all our esteemed publisher partners. Your commitment to learning, innovation, and quality has made 2023 a year to remember. Here's to a bright future filled with continued collaboration and success!
Thank you once again for being an integral part of the OpenSesame community. Wishing you a joyous holiday season and a fantastic start to 2024!
Cheers,
The OpenSesame Team
    
    
    
    
© 2023 OPENSESAME
OpenSesame
1629 SW Salmon St.
Portland, OR 97205
OpenSesame is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. You may unsubscribe from these communications at any time.

subject: Online brand protection: share your experience before it’s too late
body:
21 December 2023 
Editor's Round-Up
Online brand protection survey
WTR invites you to play a crucial role in shaping the future of online brand protection by participating in our 
brief survey
. 
Originally launched in 2021 to assess the impact of global lockdowns and the surge in online shopping, our survey uncovered that 57% of respondents had experienced an increase in infringement that year. 
Two years later, our updated survey aligns with more recent dynamic shifts in the online landscape, ranging from Meta's metaverse investments to Elon Musk's Twitter acquisition. In such a rapidly evolving space, your contribution is not just valuable, but essential.
 
The 
short survey
 – which only takes a few minutes – offers trademark professionals an opportunity to provide insights that deepen our understanding of digital threats, enabling us to identify challenges and create proactive solutions. As tactics employed by malicious actors continue to evolve, your experiences could help fellow professionals remain ahead of the curve when it comes to combatting online threats.
 
All responses will be handled confidentially, with only anonymised and aggregated data used for publication. 
The deadline to complete is less than two weeks away:
3 January 2024
 
Your contribution matters. The collective wisdom of WTR users forms the foundation of our mission to provide an accurate depiction of the current online brand protection landscape. In a digital world where threats to brand integrity are ever-present, your involvement in the WTR online brand protection survey is a proactive step towards better safeguarding brands and IP rights.
 
Click 
here
 to take the survey now.
 
Thank you for your participation.
 
Best regards,
Tim Lince
Special Projects Editor
WTR

subject: Happy Holidays!
body:
You don't often get email from nick@fromdayone.co. 
Learn why this is important
I'm writing to wish you well and share some announcements
 
Hi! It's Nick Baily, founder and CEO of From Day One. I’m writing to wish you a very happy holiday season from our whole team, as well as to share some announcements.
I'd also love to chat with you anytime about our 2024 conference schedule and sponsorship availability. Just hit reply to this email to connect.
Book of the Year!
Harvard professor Amy Edmondson, a fireside chat speaker for our upcoming 
January virtual conference
, just won Business Book of the Year from the 
Financial Times
. 
Right Kind of Wrong: The Science of Failing Well
 is the first book on management to win the 
FT
 prize in its 19-year history. We'll be giving complimentary copies to audience members who sign up for it. 
Join us
! 
One of the Fastest Growing Companies in America
From Day One has been included in the 2023 Inc 5000, a 
list
 of the most successful
 and fastest-growing companies in America, according to Inc Magazine. From Day One landed among the top 20% of companies honored, and we're the #18 among media companies. Many thanks to our incredible team and all of our partners for our continued growth!
Our First Ever Benefits-Only Event
On Wednesday, March 20, we’ll be hosting 
half-day live conference
 in Boston, convening the region’s top benefits leaders at the John F. Kennedy Library and Museum. Taking place from 8am-12:30pm, the conference will focus on innovative, inclusive, and cost-effective approaches to worker well-being. 
Apply here
 to meet leaders who are shaping the future of benefits at their organizations and beyond. 
What Our Friends Are Up To 
It’s been a season of wins for so many of our sponsors. 
WorkTango
 has been named a 
Top 25 Work Tech Vendor in 2023
, in partnership with The Starr Conspiracy. 
HiBob
 has earned a spot on G2’s 
2023 Best Software Awards for Global Software Companies
, and 
Achievers
 has been honored as a 
Great Place to Work
. Well-deserved, all around!
Meanwhile, 
Talkspace
 is powering the
 NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
's program to offer free therapy to NYC teens ages 13-17. 
15five
 has launched their new offering 
Spark AI
, which provides managers with real-time recommendations for coaching and strategic decision-making. And 
Maven Clinic
 has just launched a new virtual doula program, in keeping with its mission to improve the birth experience, especially for people from marginalized backgrounds.
We can’t wait to see how our sponsors grow and succeed in the new year. 
May you enjoy both rest and revelry this holiday season. We hope to see you in 2024! 
Cheers, 
Nick

subject: The Forum Quarterly, December 2023
body:
Welcome to The Forum’s December newsletter, the final edition of our Combining Forces
(x)
 year! 
Hello Forum family,
It's been my pleasure to serve as The Forum's Interim Executive Director. While there is no national conference in 2024, I assure you that the work continues.
Religious, worldview and spiritual diversity is in the spotlight with employee resource groups, organizational leaders and higher education grappling with world events. Registration is open for the 2nd annual Interfaith Symposium.
Out of Hand theater group recorded a wonderful podcast for The Forum earlier this year and we are finally getting this gem out in the world. Enjoy 
Equity at Dinner
 on your next podcast walk.
The holidays can be lonely for many people, for various reasons. This month's Digital Short highlights the impact that one small word or action can have on a life.  
Thank you sincerely for your involvement with The Forum. And please follow our website for news and updates throughout the new year.
In Peace,
 
At Piper Sandler, we believe 
diverse, equitable and inclusive teams with unique backgrounds, skills, and experiences
 create an ideal environment in which our employees can thrive, personally and professionally, while contributing their 
unique and valuable perspectives
 to the firm.
We strive to 
enable bright, committed people to work in partnership within an inclusive environment that allows each person to achieve personal success and add value
 to our teams and communities. By living up to the values of our organization we support our employees, and benefit our clients, shareholders and our communities.
Interested in joining the team? Visit 
https://www.pipersandler.com/careers
.
 
Thank you, Piper | Sandler, for making this newsletter possible.
Forum Profiles
 opens a window in to the life of DEI change makers and leaders.
 
Manu Meel
CEO of Bridge USA
Best homework assignment ever: Join 
The Hopeful Majority
 as we build nuance and fight outrage. 
Get to know your host, Manu Meel, who also happens to be the keynote speaker at the Spring Interfaith Symposium on March 7, 2024 in Minneapolis, MN. 
Listen. Watch. Tune In.
 
Register for the Symposium
 
And here's an upcoming virtual conference from Forum sponsor and partner The Winters Group:
 
More Info and Register Here
 
 
Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? Spoiler Alert - It's Equity!
 
Out of Hand, Winner of The Forum's 2023 
Winds of Change
 Diversity Award offers a customized program called Equitable Dinners at Work. These events support their clients’ commitment to advancing equity and inclusion by providing meaningful opportunities for empathy and engagement. In addition, these programs build 
the muscle of courageous conversation by providing a safe space to practice talking about race and other difficult topics. 
More than 12,000 people have participated in Equitable Dinners since they began in 2020.
After Equitable Dinners, 96.7% of survey respondents feel moved, and 98.4% feel inspired to make a change. This is especially exciting because 
Equitable Dinners does not just reach people who are already interested in racial equity; Equitable Dinners at Work reaches thousands of employees at their jobs.
Tune in, wherever you get your  podcasts, for this episode, recorded especially for The Forum community. 
Listen Here...
 
Forum Digital Short
: Hello
 
Watch Here
 
Peace, Love and Joy to You!

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 Dec. 17, 2023
body:
Tips and trends for 2024, TICE early bird registration and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
As the end-of-year energy pulses around us, it's the perfect time to pause and reflect on the future of learning and development (L&D).
This week, we have a collection of insightful articles and resources designed to help you navigate that future with confidence and innovation:
This week’s 
roundup of articles
 offers tips on future-proofing your workforce, making the most of AI for training and other tools to stay ahead in these evolving times.
Gain insights to shape your strategy for the new year with our 
2024 Trends Report
.
Start planning your professional development for next year — get your early bird ticket for our 
2024 Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
.
Wishing you a restful week as we head into the end of the year! 
Is there something else you’d like us to cover? Email 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with suggestions.
 
Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor 
TICE 2024 Early Bird Registration
Ready to elevate your L&D strategy this summer? Join us at the 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
, June 4-6, 2024 in Raleigh, N.C. Immerse yourself in three days of dynamic learning and networking with a vibrant community of training professionals. Together, we'll connect, collaborate and uncover innovative solutions for today's training challenges. Secure your spot by Dec. 31 to lock in our early bird rate of $1,495. Don’t miss this opportunity to transform, learn and grow with us!
Register Now
 
Training Industry’s New Vendor Directory
With thousands of training vendors across the L&D landscape, choosing the right partner can be a daunting task. Save time by starting your search with the Training Industry 
Vendor Directory
. Our comprehensive directory showcases a diverse range of vendors, categorized in 78 specialties, all dedicated to providing innovative products and services to meet your training needs.
Check It Out
 
[E-Book] How Virtual Reality Can Become a Reality for Your Organization
Advances in virtual reality (VR) technology and hardware have made VR a more accessible, affordable and effective option for training programs. Still, some organizations might be held back by a lack of information regarding the tech and anticipated hurdles that come with it. 
This Training Industry Research e-book
 provides data-backed insights on VR’s relevance to L&D, common VR challenges organizations face and tips for overcoming them. Download now to find out the potential of VR for your training efforts.
Learn More

subject: X trademark abuse leniency; USPTO pendency plan; digital piracy Congress hearing; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
17 December 2023
 
 
X trademark abuse leniency; USPTO pendency plan; digital piracy Congress hearing; and much more
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
Monday 11 December
USPTO trademark commissioner David Gooder expands on the agency’s 
ambitious trademark pendency plan
.
We head Down Under to explore brand protection strategies at 
the Australian border
.
Plus:
TRADIAS v TRIODOS: Board of Appeal erred in finding that relevant public would be likely to remember similarities rather than differences
 (European Union)
When does a trademark become vulnerable to removal for non-use? A reflection on the Tanzanian position
 (Tanzania)
Tuesday 12 December
A small business owner in the Philippines expresses confidence in an ongoing 
dispute with Louis Vuitton
.
Ferrari launches
 an anti-counterfeiting reward scheme, adidas joins Roblox; Bukalapak signs an IP-focused memorandum of understanding, and more.
Plus:
Federal Court decides BIG MAC and BIG JACK ‘beef’
 (Australia)
General Court confirms EUIPO’s refusal to register transfer of DIEGO MARADONA mark
 (European Union)
Wednesday 13 December 
Brand protection improves 
on X
, but the platform is now “more lenient” towards trademark abuse, rights holders report.
The Brazil IP office celebrates a birthday, the EUIPO boosts its case law search, France reports recent anti-counterfeiting data, and more, in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
Plus: 
EUIPO Board of Appeal invalidates 3D Rubik’s cube mark
 (European Union)
Federal Circuit remands GET ORDAINED decision as TTAB departs from own established practice
 (United States)
Thursday 14 December
Entertainment and sports broadcasting executives 
call on the US Congress
 to adopt no-fault injunctive relief in the fight against digital piracy.
Data analysis reveals similarities in the trademark filing strategies of Japanese cosmetics giants 
Kosé and Shiseido
.
We offer insights on working with 
Customs in the Czech Republic
.
Plus:
‘Oh deer!’ moment for defendant as Pernod Ricard gets exclusivity over STAG mark
 (India)
Letter of consent system among notable amendments to Trademark Act coming into effect next spring
 (South Korea)
How amendments to the Trademark Act have helped align Norway with the rest of Europe
 (Market Insight: Scandinavia)
Fifth Circuit grants motion to transfer in TikTok case
 (Market Insight: United States)
Friday 15 December
The 
most active US district court judges
 are more likely to grant critical trademark motions, WTR data analysis finds.
A Chinese copyright ruling on 
AI-generated images
 leads to fallout overseas.
BURGER KING is 
declared well known in India
, AI art is refused protection in the United States, UKTV rebrands as U, and more.
Plus:
Position marks: geometric sign located on side of shoe can be inherently distinctive
 (European Union)
Therapists’ passing-off claims, libel and harassment allegations unravelled
 (United Kingdom)
Saturday 16 December
An IP practitioner in Iran offers her observations on the value of intellectual 
property to local women entrepreneurs
 and progress in the field, in this week’s opinion column.
Special Report: Safeguarding Style
WTR 
latest Special Report
 delves into the multifaceted landscape of brand creation and protection in the fashion and luxury industry, exploring the filing strategies, anti-counterfeiting technologies and international collaborations that are essential to success.
Subscribe
Follow us on LinkedIn 
  and Twitter 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866

Message:
RE: Somali and Swahili Translation Position 
I am writing to express my strong interest in the Somali and Swahili Translation position at your organization, as advertised on the job board. With my exceptional language skills, cultural understanding, and extensive experience in translation, I am confident in my ability to make valuable contributions to your team. 
As a native speaker of both Somali and Swahili, I possess fluency in both languages, acquired through formal education and years of immersion in diverse cultural settings. I have a deep understanding of the nuances and complexities of these languages, including regional dialects, which allows me to deliver accurate and culturally appropriate translations. 
I have 5 years of professional experience as a translator, covering various fields and domains. I have successfully translated a wide range of documents, including legal contracts, medical reports, technical manuals, marketing materials, and literary works. Additionally, I have provided translation services for written content and have experience with simultaneous translation during conferences and events, facilitating effective communication between multilingual audiences. 
In my previous roles, I have demonstrated a strong commitment to delivering high-quality work while adhering to strict deadlines. My attention to detail, combined with excellent research skills, ensures that I provide accurate and contextually relevant translations for diverse projects. 
Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity of contributing to your team's translation needs. 
Sincerely, 
ABDULLAHI ADAN

subject: An email was logged on records you're following
body:
An email was logged on records you're following
 
 
“I want the conversations with my direct reports to be more inclusive… believe me, I know it’s important. But I don’t know how to start or what to say…especially in this polarized environment we’re in now.” 
  
This is what we often hear from people managers these days. 
  
Hi Mahlia, 
  
This year has brought its own unique challenges to the DEI space and from the conversations we’ve had with our clients it seems fostering an inclusive environment within our organizations has never been more crucial. 
  
Inclusive leadership not only promotes a sense of belonging among team members but also harnesses the collective strength of diverse perspectives, experiences, and ideas. The ability to understand and appreciate the unique qualities each team member brings to the table is a powerful catalyst for creating a workplace that thrives on collaboration and mutual respect. 
  
Attached is a list of great questions to ask your direct reports for more inclusive conversations.
 
Ask sincerely and with curiosity. 
Show authentic interest in the answers. 
You’ll not only gain insights on their strengths and career goals, you might also find answers to some of the most pressing problems you’re dealing with. 
  
We encourage you to integrate these inclusive conversations into your own leadership practices. 
  
We’d also love the opportunity to discuss ways we can collaborate around inclusive talent strategies. Here are some times after the holidays we could connect for 30 minutes: 
  
Wednesday, January 3
rd
 at 2pm or 3pm EST 
Thursday, January 4
th
 at 10am, 11am or 1pm EST 
Monday, January 8
th
 at 2pm or 3pm EST 
Tuesday, January 9
th
 at 11am, 3pm or 4pm EST 
  
Let me know if any of these times work best for you or if you would prefer a different time, and I’ll send an invite accordingly. 
  
I look forward to hearing from you and wishing you happy holidays! 
  
All the best, 
  
  
Pedro Seminario
Business Development Associate

This year, the ELT underwent a year-long inclusion and belonging learning path, which included six-month IDI-based coaching and quarterly sessions on equity and leadership, systems thinking, and intercultural conflict style. We want to keep this momentum going and support the ELT in their comfort in advocating and advancing equity and inclusion through discourse, workshops, and training.
 
View in HubSpot

MeShawn Green

subject: USPTO pendency targets; Louis Vuitton opponent interview; counterfeit pharma challenges
body:
14 December 2023 
 
Editor's Round-Up
In an exclusive interview with WTR, USPTO trademark commissioner David Gooder has outlined the agency’s continuing efforts to reduce 
average trademark pendency
, revealing his “ideal” time to examination and how long he expects the office to take to reach that target. Elsewhere, a small business owner in the Philippines has voiced his confidence about the fact that Louis Vuitton appears to have “gone quiet” since his recent victory over 
use of the LV mark
. 
Other trending content:
The US public is increasingly underestimating the dangers of buying medication online, consumer survey finds
Microsoft AI fights for its rights
Cuba trademark legislation passes in US House; EU-Canada platforms collaboration – legislation and policy watch
Brazil IP office celebrates birthday; EUIPO boosts case law search; France anti-counterfeiting data – IP office updates
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
 
Market Insight 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
Fifth Circuit grants motion to transfer in TikTok case
 
False advertising allegations have fuelled a recent spat between two Chinese digital giants. A district court decision to deny a motion to transfer the case has been revoked by the Fifth Circuit in a bid to clarify the criteria required to issue a writ.
Authors:
Kathleen Lynch
 
Insight 
Sujata Chaudhri IP Attorneys
 
Sujata Chaudhri
 
Pradeep Bhupatiraju
 
Tushar Baranwal
 
Overcoming the Inventiveness Barrier to Patentability
 
Featured in 
Inside India’s IP Market: a Guide 2024
 
Under Indian law, there are certain criteria that must be met to obtain a patent. However, these are often not clear cut, meaning that applicants are often left in the dark when it comes to deciding how best to meet these requirements. However, smart, strategic thinking can substantially increase the probability of overcoming the inventiveness hurdle and securing patent rights. 
Read more »
 
COHAUSZ & FLORACK
 
Reinhard Fischer
 
Tamara Moll
 
Germany: EU directives, international treaties and domestic initiatives boost IP protection
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
German anti-counterfeiting authorities found their work in national legislation harmonising with EU initiatives and contracted international treaties (eg, the Paris Convention). This sturdy foundation supports the country’s border measures, criminal prosecution, civil enforcement and infringement prevention. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | London, UK 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge. 
Learn more here

subject: Top 12 gifts of the season 🎄💫
How to Use the Training Manager Competency Model
body:
Level-up your training in 2024!
View this email in your browser
.
 
LEARN HOW TO
HONE YOUR L&D
COMPETENCIES
COMPETENCY MODEL GUIDE
TRAINING INDUSTRY COURSES
 
What Is the Training Manager Competency Model?
Competency models represent the skills and abilities necessary to be successful in a given role. Based on the seven core training manager responsibilities identified by Training Industry research, the 
Training Manager Competency Model™
 includes all the competencies training professionals need to lead high-performing training functions. So, how can you use the model to level-up your training in 2024?
1. Identify Your Competency Gaps
We've created the 
Training Manager Competency Model Assessment Tool
 to help you measure your own competencies as a training professional. Once you've completed the assessment, you'll get access to a benchmarking report sharing the results from 1,000+ training professionals to see how you compare.
2. Assess Your Training Team
If you're leading or contributing to a learning and development team, you can use the competency model to align your team. Through the assessment, you'll be able to identify your team's strengths and opportunities for improvement! After completing the 
training team competency assessment
, you'll have the option to access a custom competency report detailing the results and discuss your competency gaps with one of our directors of professional development to help you create a custom team development plan based on your results.
3. Make a 2024 Development Plan
Make a plan that you can stick to, targeting your most critical competency gaps. You can use
 this template
 to create specific, measurable, achievable, relevant and time-bound (SMART) goals that align to the seven core training management responsibilities outlined in the 
Training Manager Competency Model™
.
4. Consider Training Industry Courses
If you're looking for ways to address your competency gaps, 
Training Industry Courses
 are here to help. From half-day 
workshops
 to two-day 
certificate programs
, all the way to our flagship 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™)
 program, every course is designed to target one or more training manager competencies. If you need some guidance, our professional development experts can help you identity courses that will meet your needs. You can schedule a consultation, or click below to learn more about what Training Industry Courses can offer you.
View Our Competency Model Guide
 
Learn More About Courses
 
Our 2023 End of Year Sale is Here.
If you're ready to get a head start on your professional development goals, you can use discount code 
FROZEN10
 to receive 
10% off
 all 
Training Industry Courses
 and 
Training Industry Research
 through Dec. 31. 
Shop Now >>
 
 
Career Growth Through Certification
Did you know that training professionals consider certifications to be 
more beneficial
 to their career than other types of courses, including advanced degrees? If you're interested in advancing your career in L&D, the 
Certified Professional in Training Management (CPTM™)
 credential could be just what you're looking for! Browse L&D certification resources below.
Explore the Top Training Certifications for L&D Professionals

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 Dec. 10, 2023
body:
AI in L&D infographic, competency modeling podcast and more!
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
It may be known as “the most wonderful time of the year,” but it’s also crunch time for learning and development (L&D) leaders who want to plan an effective training strategy that will lead learning in the year to come. This week, we’re happy to share the tools and resources you’ll need to propel your organization’s training initiatives forward.
To get started, check out:
Our new infographic, “
AI-Powered Learning Technologies: 3 Use Cases to Consider
,” for insights on artificial intelligence’s practical uses amid the ongoing hype. 
The 
latest episode
 of The Business of Learning, “Harnessing the Power of Competency Modeling,” to hear from industry experts on building effective competency models to identify and align employees’ skills with their roles.
Our 
Training Team Assessment
, based on the Training Manager Competency Model™, to gain a holistic view of your team’s strengths and weaknesses that’ll help you create a targeted plan for their professional development.
As always, we welcome your feedback. Email 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any comments and suggestions. 
Danielle Johnson
Associate Editor 
[Infographic] AI-Powered Learning Technologies: 3 Use Cases to Consider
Our new infographic explores AI-driven learning technologies, offering insights into three use cases for L&D. Navigate the landscape of AI's impact on training with clarity—discover its practical uses amid the ongoing hype. subject: Cybertruck trademark hurdles; working with influencers; counterfeit drugs warning; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
10 December 2023
 
Cybertruck trademark hurdles; counterfeit drugs warning; working with influencers; and much more
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
Long Read
Parlux Holdings general counsel Jessica Cardon reveals how parties can optimise 
brand licensing negotiations in the influencer era
.
Monday 4 December
Grupo AlEn’s IP manager and coordinator reveal how the Cloralex brand became one of the first in Mexico to be 
granted a non-traditional trademark
 registration by establishing secondary meaning.
ICANN launches its WHOIS data requests ticketing system and a new warning is issued over misuse of ‘.ai’ domains in 
this month’s Domain Watch
.
Plus:
Halal trademark certification considered by Full Federal Court
 (Australia)
TRUMP EU trademark remains ‘un-trumped’
 (European Union)
Tuesday 5 December
Tuesday’s news digest includes a 
counterfeit olive oil bust
, ICANN’s chief information officer stepping down, and a name, image and likeness dispute involving EA Sports.
We 
head to Peru
 for brand protection advice at the customs border.
Plus:
Does the common element ‘crunch’ lead to a likelihood of confusion?
 (European Union)
IP High Court: SWEET SAPPHIRE is a trademark, not a generic grape variety
 (South Korea)
Wednesday 6 December 
Peru teaches prisoners about trademarks, a US delegation visits Pakistan and the DPMA appoints a 
new vice president
 in this week’s IP office updates.
We identify trademark registrations that suggest Tesla may 
encounter legal hurdles
 in introducing its Cybertruck to the Asia-Pacific, European and South American markets.
Plus: 
General Court considers proceedings for revocation of licence recordal before EUIPO
 (European Union)
Shoprite Checkers v Pick 'n Pay: a whole herd of horses from the same stable?
 (South Africa)
Thursday 7 December
Cuba trademark legislation passes in the US House, while EU-Canada platforms collaborate, in this month’s 
legislation and policy watch
.
The results of a new survey suggest that awareness campaigns about counterfeit are 
struggling to get through
 to the public.
Plus:
Chinese courts sanction Ford’s misuse of ‘Cognac’ on automobiles
 (China)
Major crackdown on counterfeit apparel in one of Lima’s biggest shopping galleries
 (Peru)
Friday 8 December
Lego and Epic Games team up, a warning is issued over 
counterfeit Wonka bars
, Ulmer and Greensfelder prepare for merger, and much more.
We present best practice for brand protection 
at Spain’s borders
 and entry points.
Plus:
JPO finds that MONO+ is not similar to MONO
 (Japan)
Q v Q: single-letter trademarks before the General Court
 (European Union)
Saturday 9 December
Microsoft Bing’s AI chatbot 
fights for its right
 to be recognised as a creator, but blames humans for any infringement arising from its knowledge gaps, in this week’s opinion column.
Special Report: Safeguarding Style
WTR 
latest Special Report
 delves into the multifaceted landscape of brand creation and protection in the fashion and luxury industry, exploring the filing strategies, anti-counterfeiting technologies and international collaborations that are essential to success.
Subscribe

  and Twitter

subject: Europe's disjointed climate narratives
body:
You don't often get email from fortune@msg.fortune.com. 
Learn why this is important
Discover the Fortune CEO Weekly Europe newsletter with this special preview.
 
View this email in your browser.
 
Welcome to a special preview edition of Fortune CEO Weekly Europe, a new newsletter about the executives, companies, and issues shaping every facet of business in Europe, written by executive editor Peter Vanham.
 
If you would like to receive Fortune CEO Weekly Europe in your inbox, you can subscribe 
here
.
 
EU's climate-minded proposals are clashing with energy giants' renewed love of fossil fuels
I spent much of last week in the UAE, where the United Nations COP climate meeting is now in full swing. And one of the most striking observations I made while there was the diverging nature of Europe's two climate narratives.
 
On the government side, the European Union was among those making the most climate-minded proposals. The EU
 
spearheaded an effort
 
to set a global goal of tripling renewable energy by 2030. It also called for “concrete actions to
 
phase out fossil fuels
 
throughout energy systems globally,” and said it would be “pushing for language that reflects this in the final COP decision.”
 
 
Based on that strong advocacy, you would never guess that almost all of Europe’s largest companies in the past year made U-turns in these exact areas.
 
Rather than phasing out fossil fuels, Shell, for example, said that its production of oil and gas will remain stable until 2030, and that it will invest three to four times more in oil and gas until 2035 than in “low-carbon products,”
 
Euronews
 reported
. 
Similarly, TotalEnergies spent more than three times on oil and gas what it spent on renewables this past year, the
 
Financial Times
 wrote
 
in May. BP, too, made a “pivot back to oil,”
 
Reuters reported
 
in February. 
 
 
These deviations from the EU's course of action matter because Shell, TotalEnergies, and BP are not just Europe’s largest energy companies, but are among the continent’s largest companies 
tout court
. On 
Fortune
’s
 
inaugural Fortune 500 Europe
 
list of largest companies by revenue, they came in at Nos. 1, 4, and 6, respectively.
 
 
This situation is problematic because the following two things cannot be true at the same time: that Europe pursues a policy of rapid decarbonization, betting that this creates prosperity for its people, 
and
 that its largest companies continue investing in fossil fuels for the sake of their stakeholders.
 
 
If the former statement is correct, Shell, BP and Total will cease being Europe’s largest firms sometime in the next decade because they lack renewable investments. If it is the latter, European policymakers will have wasted a lot of money on renewable technologies that won’t drive its economy forward for at least another decade. 
 
Such disjunction almost makes one wistful for the bygone era of state-owned energy companies. In Europe, not all state-owned energy companies are a thing of the past. Germany’s Uniper (No. 3) and France’s aptly named “Electricite de France” (No. 10) are state-owned (though Uniper only temporarily). They also stand out as having climate goals that reflect the EU's.
 
Is that the secret to energy alignment, then? Should Europe revert to exerting greater control over its energy companies to force through its energy agenda? Should its energy companies take more cues from policymakers, rather than their shareholders? Or should each just carry on doing what they think is right?
 
Wherever you stand on this issue, it's clear everyone needs to be on the same page soon. Energy supply is Europe’s No. 1 economic concern, and energy companies are more vital to its economy than those in the U.S. It’s a catch-22 that doesn’t bode well for Europe’s future competitiveness. 
 
Peter Vanham
 
Want to read more Fortune CEO Weekly Europe?
Sign up to receive the newsletter in your inbox every Wednesday.
Subscribe to Fortune 
CEO Weekly Europe

subject: US litigation data takeaways; border protection tips; domain name news
body:
07 December 2023 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week on WTR we scrutinised 
data from Docket Navigator
, which revealed that the Southern District of New York grants 80% of preliminary injunction requests in trademark disputes, and that it is statistically more likely to reach settlements than other key courts. Elsewhere, our series presenting intelligence on best practice for border protection strategies in jurisdictions around the world headed to 
Peru
 and 
Ecuador
. Meanwhile, our latest Domain Watch column reported that ICANN’s system to manage requests 
for domain name registration data
 has gone live. 
 
 
Other trending content:
 
 
Tesla faces trademark obstacles for Cybertruck in Australia, Brazil and UK
 
 
Establishing distinctiveness: lessons from Cloralex’s colour registration in Mexico
 
 
Why admin fees could help to incentivise IP mediation
 
 
Counterfeit olive oil bust; ICANN CIO steps down; EA Sports NIL dispute – news digest
 
 
Trevor Little
 
Managing editor

subject: Response to HubSpot List Import + other things
body:
Hi Melissa, 
 
How are you? I hope you had a lovely Thanksgiving, that your teaching and other things on your plate are going well, and that you’re having a good holiday season so far!
 
Re your email below….
 
Understood re: prospect contacts and the lists they came from.  I still don’t have a firm understanding on what each list represents but your categorization of what kinds of leads/prospects you pursued based on subject matter expertise, as well as based on specific messaging in emails or marketing, is helpful.  Plus you’ve mentioned to me in the past that anything labeled ‘warm leads’ were leads that came in through the LCW website. 
 
 
 
Thanks for the directions re: the Teams lists and the location of the source files in your SIDE PROJECTS folder. I moved that to SALES/sales ops/hubspot, for posterity.  Re: the Scoro source files, I unfortunately do not have access to the “Melissa Neu” folder under LCW Dropbox. 
 
Then, re: the filtering process you outlined below with the screenshots – these are contacts that were imported into HubSpot after various conferences or marketing events, right?  These are different from the imports from your SIDE PROJECT folder? Some filenames in this dropdown are self explanatory (e.g., “FDO-2022”), but some, like ‘people export’ or ‘mailchimp set up import’ – I’m not sure what those are. 
 
Finally and separately, on Nov 15 you emailed that by Monday Nov 20 you were going to share with me “an updated playbook with the HubSpot Instructions that you requested, have sent you a follow-up email to our last meeting with a few sources and clarifications 
(RP: that’s what this email was, I assume?)
, have the finalized consulting report view to you, and completed the final changes to the quote and proposal templates.”  Did I miss that? I haven’t seen it and I wanted to check.  
 
Thank you!!
RP
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
From:
 Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, November 28, 2023 2:57 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Pedro Seminario <P.seminario@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 HubSpot List Import Follow-up
 
Dear Rebecca,
 
Thinking about our most recent conversation, I wanted to clarify a few things about HubSpot and the lists we uploaded into the system. One of HubSpot's great tools is the ability to assign leads, contacts, and companies to sales reps. For our purposes, the list that the contact came from was less important than knowing who it was assigned to and what the BD associate's expectations were when working with that lead. Often, Hannah and Pedro never saw the source file, but I would alert them when an upload was complete.
 
Now that your team has fewer and different people, it is hard to see that different contacts were assigned to different folks for different reasons. Our team would meet on average three times a week to coordinate. Unless it impacted messaging, it wasn't always necessary for us to know which of the lists the prospective client came from. Similarly, each member of our team had a different focus. In other words, Pedro would be focused on promoting translations and eLearning, Hannah would focus on facilitations, and I would concentrate on finding enterprise-wide clients (multi-modal learning opportunities) and consulting opportunities. The team was focused on this because we had varying subject matter knowledge and tenure at LCW. It also worked on the team's strengths – Pedro has extensive translation experience (for example) and eLearning. 
 
As I mentioned, the lists were only relevant as they pertained to specific messaging in emails or marketing. For example, the Forum attendees were on a list because we campaigned pre- and post-event. In contrast, we always invited folks from our assigned warm leads list to the events or promotions because folks on this list had submitted a website inquiry to LCW in the past three years. That doesn't mean that the Forum folks didn't get other communication, but in this example, we needed to differentiate that group based on messaging. 
 
To this end, while the three of us haven't talked much about the website integration or marketing side of HubSpot, one of the critical features we took advantage of was how leads were routed from the web. As outlined above, we would get leads assigned to us based on the client's indicated need or area of interest.
 
Taking advantage of HubSpot's capacity for sequencing, we didn't often need to refer to lists once the imports happened. Nevertheless, I completely understand your needs. Ultimately, this long-winded email is meant to share the following:
 
What you found in Teams was a snapshot of working documents pre-HubSpot implementation. However, I was diligent in keeping source files for all the uploads. The source files are kept here: LCW Dropbox\SIDE PROJECTS\MELISSA\CRM\HubSpot
Please note there are iterations here, and the documents are explicitly formatted for upload.
Some lists were cleaned and uploaded into Scoro first (such as the warm leads list.) By cleaning, we worked with the associate consultants and the intern to update all contact details, remove contacts that don't work at their job any longer, and either identify that person's replacement or find contact details for them in their new role (or both). If you ever want to look at those source files, you can find the Scoro uploads here: LCW Dropbox\Melissa Neu\Melissa's DropBox\ME\CRM.
Besides the lists we used in HubSpot for specific campaigns, you can always pull a list based on a previously uploaded file through filters. Here are the steps:
From the Contacts view, go to advanced filters: 
 
Click on advanced filters and then click on add filters:
 
After you click on add filters, you will be given a list of options to filter by. You will want to select "Import."
 
 
After selecting import, you will be given a list of options, and you can choose to select any list by name. You can also choose more than one list at a time. 
As soon as you click your list, the filter starts. Once filtered, you can assign these to someone, put them in a campaign, share them in a view, and/or put them into a list.
 
You will notice that some lists were marketing lists; those source files are kept here: \LCW Dropbox\MARKETING\HubSpot\Set-up. Please note that some of these contacts are captured in other lists. These uploads, at times, were only changing settings to ensure that folks subscribed to the mailing list were tagged in HubSpot.
 
I hope that this information provides more clarity as to where the source files are and how the system operates. Let me know if you have any questions or need me to walk you through this information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
 
C. Melissa Neu
(she/her)
Business Development Manager

subject: RE: Following Up Re: DEIB Engagement
body:
Hello Sarah and Melissa,
 
I hope this message finds you well. As we enter the next phase of our DEIB roadmap, we would like to continue our discussion with LCW. We have gone through the Discovery Phase and now would like to establish shared vocabulary, frameworks, and skills of DEIB concepts to create consistent and broad DEIB fluency.
 
We are currently seeking a partner to deliver unconscious bias training. As a global organization with 3,000 employees, we are looking for a scalable training solution that will cater to Individual Contributors, People Managers, and Senior Leaders. The training should be available in English, French, Chinese, Japanese, Malay, and Spanish, and should be compatible with our LMS, Cornerstone.
 
Our hourly workforce is 1’500 employees, salary workforce consists of about 1,600 employees, including 420 people managers globally. Our senior leadership team is composed of 12 Executive Leaders and 80 Senior Global Leaders.
 
We aim to select a partner ideally by the end of this year and implement the training starting March/April 2024.
 
Is this something LCW can assist us with?
 
I am looking forward to hearing from you
 
Best regards,
Anna
 
Anna Drozdz
Tel: 00.41.79.579.66.13
Director, Global Talent Management
www.haemonetics.com
From:
 Sarah Nodarse <s.nodarse@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 27 April 2023 21:22
To:
 Helen Fatseas <hfatseas@haemonetics.com>; Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Anna Drozdz <anna.drozdz@haemonetics.com>
Subject:
 RE: Following Up Re: DEIB Engagement
 
EXTERNAL:
 
This email originated from outside of Haemonetics. Do not click any links, open any attachments, or reply unless you trust the sender and know the content is safe. Use this 
HaemoNet link
 for information on reporting suspicious emails. 
 
Hi Helen & Anna,
Thank you so much for getting back to us. We appreciate you giving us the detail on what you plan to do next. Sounds like a solid plan!
 
I happen to have years of experience analyzing employee engagement survey data and delight in the activity, so I’d be happy to give a sanity check to any analysis you get back as a professional courtesy, no pressure! It was a delight to meet you both and we would love to be of service any way we can.
 
Take care, enjoy the process, and reach out if you need anything at all!
 
Best,
Sarah

Sent:
 Wednesday, April 26, 2023 1:32 PM
To:
 Sarah Nodarse <
s.nodarse@lcwmail.com
>; Melissa Neu <
m.neu@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Anna Drozdz <
anna.drozdz@haemonetics.com
>
Subject:
 Following Up Re: DEIB Engagement
 
Dear Sarah & Melissa,
 
At this time, we altered our strategy and engaged with a consulting partner to perform a global assessment of our organization, who will pinpoint specific areas of concern related to our most recent Employee Engagement Survey.  We will use the results of this survey to leverage the vendor(s) with the best fit to address the challenges they detect and plan the global solutions as required.
 
While we may not be ready to engage you with the work at this time, we do hope to stay connected as we found great value with the approach made by LCW. 
The assessment will begin in late Spring and we will keep you apprised of our progress as we learn more.
 
Thank you once again for your proposal and unique perspective for addressing our need for a formalized DEIB program.
 
Best regards,
 
Helen Fatseas and Anna Drozdz 
 
 
 
Helen Fatseas
Talent Development Senior Manager

subject: USPTO fraud crackdown; South Africa filing trends; client partnerships advice; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
03 December 2023
 
 
USPTO fraud crackdown; South Africa filing trends; client partnerships advice; and much more
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
Final week to vote
There is less than a week left to nominate in-house colleagues for the 2024 WTR Industry Awards. Complete our 
short nomination form
 to ensure inspiring teams get the recognition they deserve.
Long Read
In-house experts reveal exactly what brands need from their 
partners in the courtroom
.
Monday 27 November
Exotec explains how embedding intellectual property into the core of its business model led to the creation of France’s 
first industrial unicorn
.
We outline the best solutions for brand protection at the 
South Korean border
.
Plus:
NORO MORE: Cantarella’s ORO marks found to be invalid in light of Section 58
 (Australia)
‘Prosecco’ to be registered as GI following landmark Court of Appeal decision
 (Singapore)
Tuesday 28 November
The USPTO issues a 
scathing show-cause order
 against a Chinese entity accused of fraudulent filing activity, which could lead to the termination of over 50,000 applications.
FIFA releases its IP guidelines for the 2026 World Cup, Meta and Christian Louboutin file a joint lawsuit, domain infringement targets Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot, 
and more
.
Plus:
Exhaustion and relabelling: Supreme Court rules that prominent use of MySoda brand on certain labels was infringing
 (Finland)
Versailles Court of Appeal finds infringement of renowned 3D Mikado trademark
 (France)
Wednesday 29 November 
The USPTO launches its 
new trademark search system
 and the Austrian Patent Office welcomes its new president, in this week’s IP office updates.
Experts outline what the 
new mediation law
 means for IP disputes in India.
Plus: 
General Court confirms reputation of MASTERS mark for golf tournaments
 (European Union)
easyGroup unsuccessful in EASYOFFICE appeal
 (United Kingdom)
Thursday 30 November
South African trademark filings show 
increasing foreign interest
 and an unusual top filer.
We 
head to Ecuador
 to provide anti-counterfeiting insights from the customs frontline.
Plus:
Court of Appeals considers use of ‘eco’ in trademarks
 (Argentina)
EUIPO Board of Appeal rejects motion mark for cheese
 (European Union)
Friday 1 December
US district court data reveals the 
likelihood of settlement
 in the New York Southern District, with an unexpected top asserting party.
The United Kingdom establishes an 
online fraud charter
, AI copyright infringement cases rise, an IP series airs on Hong Kong TV, and more.
Plus:
INTERCRUISES v INCRUISES: Board of Appeal incorrectly held that evidence of use was unrelated to travel agency services
 (European Union)
JPO rejects colour marks for Kubota tractors
 (Japan)
Saturday 2 December
Admin fees and a hybrid legislative approach could help to 
incentivise IP mediation
, argues this week’s opinion column.
Special Report: Safeguarding Style
WTR 
latest Special Report
 delves into the multifaceted landscape of brand creation and protection in the fashion and luxury industry, exploring the filing strategies, anti-counterfeiting technologies and international collaborations that are essential to success.
 
Subscribe
Follow us on LinkedIn 
  and Twitter 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866
Manage your email preferences, unsubscribe or opt out.
To receive our emails without interruption, please add us to your safe senders list.

subject: Full Calendar - Upcoming Events
body:
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI. We will have more to come for 2024!
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
December 13: The Arc of Change for People and Culture in 2024
Recent history affirms that unpredictable events will buffet the workplace of 2024, yet the trajectory of trends in 2023 gives an indication of how organizations will need to be ready for changing expectations among workers and other stakeholders. What are the emerging patterns that leaders should watch in the realms of diversity and inclusion, talent acquisition, employee rewards, learning and development, social responsibility and sustainability? What new points of focus will arrive in the greater field of people and culture? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
January 10: A Fresh Commitment to a Culture of Well-Being
While many employers recognize the connection between well-being and productivity, creating a healthy balance in the real world of work can be challenging. What are the key choices and thoughtful compromises that must be made for workers to thrive as well as produce? How can managers be trained to make the well-being of their workers a top priority? How can companies get a better sense of which benefits and rewards are most effective–and encourage workers to take advantage of them? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
January 24: Atlanta, Georgia
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
February 6: Houston, Texas
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
February 14: Getting to the Next Stage of Diversity and Belonging
At a time of resistance and corporate austerity, DEI advocates will need to re-energize themselves and their organizations with new ideas, programs, and reasoning for the cause of diversity. What can DEI practitioners learn from companies with consistent success? How are companies changing their policies to respond to court rulings and lawsuits? What practices have brought the most progress in bringing diversity to leadership ranks? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
February 20: Seattle, Washington
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
February 27: Silicon Valley, California
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
March 6: Employee Engagement: Tapping the Secrets of Energizing Workers
Companies want their employees to be enthused and involved, yet employers need to be thoughtful in fostering these qualities in authentic ways. What’s the latest thinking about how employers can understand the motivations of their workers–and how to respond? What are the best methods for recognizing achievement, both individually and among teams? What’s the connection between engagement and job satisfaction? In the hybrid work environment, what binds workers together and wards off anxiety and loneliness? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
March 26: Washington D.C.
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
April 3: Benefits That Fit Individual Needs Without Busting the Budget
Having made a commitment to recognize the unique needs of individuals, the secret is in the execution. What are the emerging benefits and rewards that workers are seeking, from fertility care to financial wellness? How can companies use technology to stay in close touch with what individuals are experiencing–and where they need help as a result? How can companies choose among myriad point solutions and innovative new platforms? What are the most cost-effective rewards in terms of investments and outcomes? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
April 9: Chicago, Illinois
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
May 14: Minneapolis, Minnesota
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
May 22: The Art and Science of Employee Retention, Coaching and Advancement
While the pace of job-hopping has eased, employers have a powerful motivation to retain skilled workers, both for financial and cultural reasons. How can employers use new tools, including AI, to gain insights about what’s inspiring their workers to stay committed–or walk out the door? Since attrition is often caused by poor relationships with managers, what are innovative ways for employers to train their workers to be better leaders at a time when workers have higher expectations for job satisfaction? How can technology help make coaching more effective? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
June 12: 
Bringing Talent Acquisition into the Digital Age
Despite layoffs making headlines now, all the demographic and digital trends point toward tough competition for workers in the future–maybe sooner than most expect. What are the new techniques and tools that talent-acquisition can use to envision the workforce their company will need in the future? What data and insights can HR and TA leaders provide to the company to be ahead of trends? How can companies do a better job of internal recruiting and promoting internal mobility? What are the best practices for hiring based on skills and potential, rather than credentials? 
Register now
.

subject: Uncover more insights and trends with all-new charts  🚀
body:
Explore what’s new: more powerful charts, easier account management, Metric Library, and more. 
 
The Product Newsletter 
NOVEMBER 2023 
NEW
 
Introducing the all-new Databoard Designer with beautiful new chart visualizations!
We are thrilled to announce the release of our new Databoard Designer and Visualizations, which will take your data analysis to the next level!
Here's what you can do:
✅ Explore 
new advanced charts
, including Radial Progress, Spiderweb Diagrams, Bubble Charts, Data Story, and more, to help you understand complex data better.
✅ You can 
add multiple metrics and compare periods
 to a single visualization to see how different metrics relate.
✅ You can 
easily switch between different visualization types
 to find the best way to represent your data.
✅ Plus 
change the colors of individual metrics
 to make it easier to identify important data points.
Want to learn more?
Check out our 
blog for all the details
.
 
Discover fresh visualizations now 
Manage Users, Permissions, & Settings More Easily
Managing users, permissions, and settings just got a whole lot easier!
With the new Account Management Application (AMA), you can now access advanced settings all from one place:
🔹 Easily 
update account details
, including the account owner and company information.
🔹 Add, delete, and edit user permissions
 across all Databox products.
🔹 Customize and brand your Databox account with 
white-labeling
.
🔹 Manage client accounts
, including account manager, user permissions, client name, and more.
🔹 Access 
advanced settings for your Data Source connections
. 
🔹 Manage 
user permissions
, 
metadata
, 
timezone
, and more.
🔹 Enable 
single sign-on (SSO)
 to improve security measures.
For more details on how to use AMA, check out 
this help article.
 
Explore AMA now 
 
Learn More About The Metrics
With the new Metric Library, you can learn everything there is to know about your metrics and integrations, without ever having to leave Databox.
Search the Metric Library to:
Get a 
detailed description of your metrics and integrations
, including troubleshooting guides.
Quickly 
access pre-built Dashboard templates
 to get ideas on what to track.
Find 
answers to common questions 
with help articles.
Find new metrics now 
COMING SOON
 
 
Find Opportunities To Improve
Do you ever wonder if your CPC is too high or if your conversion rate is too low? 
Soon you’ll be able to answer these questions with the Benchmarks tool. You’ll be able to 
explore how you stack up to companies like yours and save those benchmarks to your account, to track how you progress over time. 
Don’t just compare your performance. Use Benchmarks to:
Set more 
realistic goals
.
Find 
opportunities to improve.
Prove results 
to clients, investors, managers, and your board of directors
.
 
NEW INTEGRATIONS

 which will allow you to connect to TikTok with just one click, and consolidate all your TikTok organic and ads data on one dashboard or report.
