Hi C.,
This is Jeff from 
Calendly
 with some product updates, resources, and tips to share to make scheduling easier and more productive for our sales, marketing, and customer success customers.
How Many People Schedule 
Meetings From Your Forms?
Some of our most successful customers 
add scheduling capabilities to their website
. Yet, you know what holds some others back? They worry just anyone will find their Calendly, and book a time without qualifying them! That’s what I love about our 
Routing features
, as they allow you to ask invitees questions before they can book time with you and your team. 
Available on the Teams subscription plan and above, 
Routing
 is now improved with Routing Analytics that reveal how your routing forms perform with candidates, clients, and potential customers. Within your 
Calendly Analytics
, you can now see reports on conversion rates and track scheduling trends coming from your Calendly, HubSpot, Marketo, or Pardot forms. Note: Only account admins and owners can 
check out routing analytics
. 
Get Routing Analytics
Survey: How Do You Organize 
Your Professional Contacts?
Getting more organized is often a priority as we start a new year. When it comes to managing your professional contacts (candidates, clients, and customer leads), we’d love to learn more about how you currently keep track of these relationships. Let us know by taking this 
3-minute survey
! 
Take the Survey
What Forrester Research Found 
When They Studied Calendly
If you haven’t checked out 
Forrester Research’s study on Calendly
 — which includes interviews with customers DocuSign, Atlassian, GardaWorld, and Semrush — you can grab it 
here
.
Personally, I’ve always enjoyed talking to research analyst firms like Forrester, because they work with thousands of customers who want advice on which tech products to buy. And, as a Calendly employee, they can give me a “voice of the customer” reality check when I need one! Here are a few things Forrester heard from Calendly’s customers:
“One of the pain points was trying to schedule with external clients while keeping their data safely secured. Calendly really supports their existing workflows. I don’t think we have any other tools that do that level of advanced extra routing for a team.” - Atlassian’s Global Collaboration Specialist
“First [added value is] connectivity, [then] ease of access to our calendar so that there was a way that team members could manage their tasks. Another added value is consistency, as we’re delivering our engagement consistently to optimize customer and employee experience along with ease and flexibility.” DocuSign’s VP of Success at Scale
“We can definitely say that when a sales rep is involved and has a meeting on the calendar for a renewal, the chances of expansion go up and Calendly definitely plays a part in that.” - Semrush’s Sales Project Manager
“A couple of years ago, we were at 21 days [in our recruiting process], and then we got it down to 17 days. [Now it is] about 15 and a half days from application to when they’re earning a paycheck.” - GardaWorld’s Senior Director of Talent Acquisition
That’s just a sample of what these customers have to say in the report. 
Feel free to download it
, or read the 
blog post
 if you prefer. 
Get the Report
An Even Edgier Extension
Have you added our 
browser extensions
 yet to make your life easier? Join customer Trevor Robinson and thousands of others who use it to quickly grab their scheduling link in their email tool, use our LinkedIn integration, and more!
And, Microsoft Edge users, Calendly’s extension is easier to find than ever before — no more detours to the Chrome Web Store. Find us with all your other 
Edge Add-ons here
. If you haven’t had the chance to try our extension yet, it grants you one-click access to Calendly from anywhere on the web, or even from the 
Outlook
 app if that’s where you spend most of your day.
We’re also available on 
Chrome
 and 
Firefox
, but if there’s a different browser or application you’d like to see us tackle next, 
reply
 to let us know. 
Get the Edge Extension
Salesforce Integration Update
If you take advantage of the 
no-show status feature
 in Calendly to track meeting attendees, those updates can now sync to Salesforce automatically. This feature requires the 
latest version of the Salesforce integration package (2.6)
 and manual enablement of the no-show flow template in Salesforce. 
Learn More
Additional Resources
Webinar: 
How to Use Calendly to Close More Deals
 
Report: 
Total Economic Impact of Calendly by Forrester Research
 
Webinar: 
Getting Started with Calendly
 
Webinar: 
How Teams Use Calendly
 
Thanks for reading, 
Jeff Hardison
Head of Product Marketing @ Calendly
Need help?
  
Help Center
 ‌ | ‌ 
Pricing & FAQs
 ‌ | ‌ 
Contact Us
 
More than a scheduling link.
 
 
 
 
 
115 E. Main Street, Suite A1B, Buford, GA 30518
www.calendly.com

subject: 50,000 US applications at risk of termination; unusual filer tops South Africa register; India's new mediation law
body:
30 November 2023 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week, the USPTO issued a 
scathing show-cause order
 to a Chinese company accused of “providing false, fictitious, or fraudulent information in trademark submissions”. The office’s actions could lead to the termination of over 50,000 US trademark applications, WTR reporting warned. Meanwhile, analysis of 
South African filing data
 revealed increasing interest from foreign brand owners, with one particularly unusual applicant filing the highest number of trademarks in the country last year. 
 
 
Other trending content:
 
 
What the new mediation law means for IP disputes in India
 
 
A new dawn in Argentina: how president-elect Javier Milei’s “chainsaw plan” could impact trademarks
 
 
“You can’t change DEI overnight”: the INTA Foundation’s long-term strategy to facilitate change
 
 
How start-ups should protect themselves and wield IP to drive growth: tips from a robotics unicorn
 
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
 
Deputy editor
 
Long Read
 
What brands need from their partners in the courtroom
 
In-house experts offer their perspectives on what makes for a perfect partnership with law firms when litigation is on the cards.
Read more
Insight 
Adams and Reese LLP
 
Kristina Montanaro Schrader
 
Maia T Woodhouse
 
United States: How a multi-pronged legislative approach is curbing the online trade in fakes
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
The Lanham Act and Trademark Counterfeiting Act work hand in hand to boost anti-counterfeiting enforcement, protecting rights holders and legitimate suppliers against a rising tide of infringement. 
Read more »
 
OLIVARES
 
Alonso Camargo
 
Mexico: Declarations of Use, How to Avoid Losing Trademark Rights
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Prosecution Review 2024
 
Declarations of use were introduced as an effective legislative initiative to clear up trademark registrations that were not being used and blocking registration of new marks. However, the lack of harmonisation between Mexican law and the Madrid Protocol puts international trademark holders at risk of losing their rights. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | London, UK 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge. 
Learn more here

subject: HubSpot List Import Follow-up
body:
Dear Rebecca,
 
Thinking about our most recent conversation, I wanted to clarify a few things about HubSpot and the lists we uploaded into the system. One of HubSpot's great tools is the ability to assign leads, contacts, and companies to sales reps. For our purposes, the list that the contact came from was less important than knowing who it was assigned to and what the BD associate's expectations were when working with that lead. Often, Hannah and Pedro never saw the source file, but I would alert them when an upload was complete.
 
Now that your team has fewer and different people, it is hard to see that different contacts were assigned to different folks for different reasons. Our team would meet on average three times a week to coordinate. Unless it impacted messaging, it wasn't always necessary for us to know which of the lists the prospective client came from. Similarly, each member of our team had a different focus. In other words, Pedro would be focused on promoting translations and eLearning, Hannah would focus on facilitations, and I would concentrate on finding enterprise-wide clients (multi-modal learning opportunities) and consulting opportunities. The team was focused on this because we had varying subject matter knowledge and tenure at LCW. It also worked on the team's strengths – Pedro has extensive translation experience (for example) and eLearning. 
 
As I mentioned, the lists were only relevant as they pertained to specific messaging in emails or marketing. For example, the Forum attendees were on a list because we campaigned pre- and post-event. In contrast, we always invited folks from our assigned warm leads list to the events or promotions because folks on this list had submitted a website inquiry to LCW in the past three years. That doesn't mean that the Forum folks didn't get other communication, but in this example, we needed to differentiate that group based on messaging. 
 
To this end, while the three of us haven't talked much about the website integration or marketing side of HubSpot, one of the critical features we took advantage of was how leads were routed from the web. As outlined above, we would get leads assigned to us based on the client's indicated need or area of interest.
 
Taking advantage of HubSpot's capacity for sequencing, we didn't often need to refer to lists once the imports happened. Nevertheless, I completely understand your needs. Ultimately, this long-winded email is meant to share the following:
 
What you found in Teams was a snapshot of working documents pre-HubSpot implementation. However, I was diligent in keeping source files for all the uploads. The source files are kept here: LCW Dropbox\SIDE PROJECTS\MELISSA\CRM\HubSpot
Please note there are iterations here, and the documents are explicitly formatted for upload.
Some lists were cleaned and uploaded into Scoro first (such as the warm leads list.) By cleaning, we worked with the associate consultants and the intern to update all contact details, remove contacts that don't work at their job any longer, and either identify that person's replacement or find contact details for them in their new role (or both). If you ever want to look at those source files, you can find the Scoro uploads here: LCW Dropbox\Melissa Neu\Melissa's DropBox\ME\CRM.
Besides the lists we used in HubSpot for specific campaigns, you can always pull a list based on a previously uploaded file through filters. Here are the steps:
From the Contacts view, go to advanced filters: 
 
Click on advanced filters and then click on add filters:
 
After you click on add filters, you will be given a list of options to filter by. You will want to select "Import."
 
 
After selecting import, you will be given a list of options, and you can choose to select any list by name. You can also choose more than one list at a time. 
As soon as you click your list, the filter starts. Once filtered, you can assign these to someone, put them in a campaign, share them in a view, and/or put them into a list.
 
You will notice that some lists were marketing lists; those source files are kept here: \LCW Dropbox\MARKETING\HubSpot\Set-up. Please note that some of these contacts are captured in other lists. These uploads, at times, were only changing settings to ensure that folks subscribed to the mailing list were tagged in HubSpot.
 
I hope that this information provides more clarity as to where the source files are and how the system operates. Let me know if you have any questions or need me to walk you through this information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
 
C. Melissa Neu
(she/her)
Business Development Manager

subject: An email was logged on records you're following
body:
An email was logged on records you're following
 
 
Hi Mahlia, 
  
Hope you had a great holiday weekend and enjoyed time with family and friends! I wanted to take this opportunity to schedule time for us to discuss your end of year planning and your goals for 2024. I know this time of year can be very busy and I look forward to the opportunity to partner in the new year. 
  
Some of the ways we are working with organizations like Post Consumer Brands is by collaborating on Talent Review/succession planning processes and making them more inclusive and equitable together. We offer a comprehensive curriculum: 
  
 
  
We understand that creating a sustainable culture of inclusion is an 
ongoing process

subject: Introducing Fortune CEO Weekly Europe
body:
Keep up with Europe's biggest business stories with our new newsletter.
View this email in your browser.
 
How can Europe’s companies remain relevant in the 21st century?  
  
For much of the past few decades, European companies could cruise along in the global economy, fueled by cheap energy, the benefits of integrating markets, and preferred access to both the U.S. and Chinese consumer. The halo of German cars and machines, Italian and French luxury goods, and the continent’s financial prowess did the rest.   
 
But today, Europe’s businesses are under stresses they haven’t experienced in at least 40 years. The reliance on cheap Russian gas is over; oil and gas will need to largely disappear from the energy mix by 2050; and both the U.S. and China are far ahead in manufacturing and technology, making the 
Fortune 500 Europe
 list look like a blast from the past.  
 
 
Who are the industry leaders shaping Europe's future? Starting Nov. 29, a new newsletter, 
Fortune CEO Weekly Europe
, will shine a light on the European industries and leaders of tomorrow. It will show who succeeds where others fail, and explore whether and how Europe’s economy can regain its strength globally, with special attention to sustainable business transformations.   
 
 
My name is Peter Vanham. I’m an executive editor at 
Fortune
, and I’m excited to write this newsletter every Wednesday for you from my hometown, Geneva, Switzerland. You may know me as a once-a-week author of the 
CEO Daily
 newsletter, the writer of the weekly 
Impact Report
 newsletter, or from my book on stakeholder capitalism.  
 
 
Europe is my home, and I look forward to taking you on a journey to rediscover our continent. 
 
Until soon, from Europe!  
  
Peter 
Subscribe to Fortune 
CEO Weekly Europe

subject: Josh Bersin + Eightfold + FD1: Three strategies for success in the "Intelligence Age"
body:
You don't often get email from erin@fromdayone.co. 
Learn why this is important
Dear From Day One Members:  Join us tomorrow for a webinar fireside chat featuring Josh Bersin, Eightfold, and our very own Steve Koepp, Co-Founder and Chief Content Officer at From Day One. See below for more details, and please note we have a number of webinar dates available in Q1 if you'd like to explore a similar webinar for your organization.  
 
We're offering incentives for 2024 commitments executed in 2023 
- please reply to this email directly for more details and I'd be happy to point you in the right direction!
 
Erin Sauter
Cofounder
From Day One
 
On Mon, Nov 27, 2023 at 10:49 AM Eightfold AI <
marketing@em.eightfold.ai
> wrote:
 
We've entered an era where the shortage of workers, obsolescence of skills, and new level of employee agency will present employers with historic challenges. Most companies are not ready. The new "Intelligence Age" is a time when skills, employee creativity, information and AI will define our companies.
In tomorrow's webinar, we'll explore three strategies for success: rethinking the organization as dynamic rather than static, rethinking management with human-centered leadership, and rethinking HR as no longer an expense center, but rather a function like R&D that must build and invest in the company's people. All told, this means we need to redesign our companies around the person and shift to a new model for work. The time to act is now.
Join us tomorrow

subject: INTA Leadership takeaways; reaction to USPTO design patent bar; border protection in Malaysia; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
26 November 2023
 
INTA Leadership takeaways; reaction to USPTO design patent bar; border protection in Malaysia; and much more
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
WTR wants your views
WTR wants to hear your views on the current state of online IP protection, to help build a picture of the evolving landscape, the biggest threats, and the way forward. Complete our 
short survey
 today.
Monday 20 November
Starbucks’ NFT enforcement, an IP office extinction warning and Barbie’s DEI mission are among the big talking points of the 2023 
INTA Leadership Meeting
.
We head to Malaysia to understand the challenges of – and best solutions for – brand protection at the 
country’s borders
.
Plus:
Determining the similarity of conflicting marks: insights from TIPO decision in Louis Vuitton opposition
 (Taiwan)
Larsson strikes again: UKIPO deems LARSSON mark to be invalid
 (United Kingdom)
Tuesday 21 November
Anti-counterfeiting experts explain how to 
protect your brand from opportunists
 this holiday season.
Tuesday’s news headlines include a 
$2.45 million BABY SHARK win
, Marc Jacobs “fraudulent assertions” and a TRUMP revocation claim.
Plus:
How to protect an assignee from an assignor’s bad faith: lessons from recent cases
 (China)
BAUR AU LAC case: Federal Supreme Court puts an end to trademark dispute between two families
 (Switzerland)
Wednesday 22 November 
Practitioners are divided over the new 
USPTO design patent bar
.
The US Copyright Office extends its deadline for comments on AI, while WIPO 
launches an IP awareness platform
 for music and digital content creators, in the latest IP office updates.
Plus: 
Nivea saves its skin from risk of confusion
 (European Union)
Hitachi unsuccessful in HITASI opposition
 (Japan) 
Thursday 23 November
In the next stop of our journey to understand the challenges of brand protection at the borders and ports-of-entry in various countries, we 
head to Taiwan
.
Javier Milei has been elected as the next president of Argentina. Local experts consider what 
impact his administration will have
 on the IP landscape. 
Plus:
Virgin wins brand reputation dispute in Commercial Court
 (United Kingdom) 
Respondent’s activity defeats ‘.au’ DRP
 (Australia)
EU legislation and amended national IP code prove a formidable combination
 (Market Insight: France)
The Beijing Measure: whether data should be a registered and protected form of intellectual property in China
 (Market Insight: China)
Friday 24 November
WTR sits down with INTA Foundation board members to find out more 
about their mission
 and how the trademark community can support it.
Porsche outlines its metaverse vision, Coventry City FC tackles counterfeits, Temu 
calls for help
 in its fight against impersonators, and more.
Plus:
ARCTIC WATER considered descriptive over 20 years after registration
 (Norway) 
Inditex v EUIPO, or the importance of filing new evidence with conversion request following revocation for non-use
 (European Union)
Saturday 25 November
This week’s Saturday opinion 
reflects on the opportunities
 that the APAA conference and INTA Annual Meeting have provided Asia-based IP practitioners this year.
Special Report: Safeguarding Style
WTR 
latest Special Report
 delves into the multifaceted landscape of brand creation and protection in the fashion and luxury industry, exploring the filing strategies, anti-counterfeiting technologies and international collaborations that are essential to success.
Subscribe
Follow us on LinkedIn 
  and Twitter 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866

body:

.
 
The Latest
Resources for L&D
Leaders Like You
TRAINING MANAGER RESOURCES
UPCOMING COURSES
Our End of Year Sale is Here!
Here at Training Industry Courses, we understand the challenges that learning leaders face, so we want to make sure you have the resources you need to meet your professional development goals in 2024 and beyond! 
For this weekend only, you can receive an additional discount when you enroll in any program offered by 
Training Industry Courses
, designed to empower you to deliver creative training solutions that are aligned with organizational goals. Receive 
15% off 
your next purchase with code 
FROSTY15
.
New Courses Launched
Be at the forefront of innovation in learning. Reserve your spot in the next session of our newly launched Competency Modeling Certificate.
Competency Modeling Certificate
Learn how to build a custom competency model for your organization, and how to assess employees against your model to identify skills gaps. Join the first session happening 
Feb. 5-6
 from 1-5 p.m.
 
 
 
Upcoming Professional Development Opportunities

Next Session: 
Dec. 1

($89 off)

Dec. 12-14

($284 off)

Revolutionize both learning and development (L&D) and human resources (HR) practices, creating flexible and proactive systems of change that offer a competitive and adaptive approach with this certification

($89 off)

Partnering with business leaders in consultative relationships requires you to navigate relationships and internal processes. In this workshop, you’ll gain best practices for consulting, managing expectations, and addressing stakeholder needs.

Measuring the Impact of L&D

Dec. 18-19

During this certificate, you’ll gain the tools you need to implement a multifaceted approach to measurement that allows you to craft an impactful evaluation story used to demonstrate the value of your training and development programs.
Learn More
 >>
What's It Like Taking a Course With Training Industry?
Our courses combine the most important elements of learning — subject matter experts, both live and self-paced components, resources and templates to use on the job, networking with industry peers, and continuously updated, research-backed course content.
To preview some of our course content, access the job aids below:
Strategies for Conflict Resolution: Playing to Partner > Playing to Win
Conquering Your Learning Technology Needs Assessment
Helping Training Managers Become D&I Champions
Discover More Resources
 >>
 
What's Happening This Month
2024 TRENDS REPORT NOW AVAILABLE
We just released our annual trends report, “
Trends 2024: L&D as a Key Business Driver
.” This report examines the growing importance of L&D for organizational success and highlights six trends influencing the future of corporate training. 
Read now
 to explore L&D trends related to improving talent retention, artificial intelligence (AI), learner engagement, the revival of instructor-led training and more.
Get the Report
 >>
THE EVENT TO LEARN AND GROW AS A L&D LEADER 
Get ready to connect, collaborate and elevate your learning and development (L&D) strategy next summer at the annual 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
. At TICE, we’re all about fostering connections and empowering L&D leaders like you to make a lasting impact. 
Register
 by 
Dec. 31, 2023 
to take advantage of our lowest rates!
Register Now
 >>
RESEARCH TO INFORM YOUR L&D STRATEGIES
2024 is right around the corner, and the pace of disruption and change to the training industry is more evident than ever. We have you covered with 
Training Industry Research
, where our unmatched knowledge of the training market and emerging trends can help you adapt, pivot and improve your impact in 2024. Use discount code 
FROSTY15 
on your next purchase before Nov. 27 to receive 
15% off 
all 
research reports
.

3 Key Takeaways From Launching a Consulting Business

We understand the challenges that learning and development (L&D) professionals face in managing training programs that align with organizational goals and drive business impact. To help address those challenges, we created a comprehensive suite of courses that will empower you to deliver creative training solutions.

subject: Free upcoming presentation: How to get business with the government
body:
To view this email as a web page, go 
here.
Join us on 
December 6th, 2023 at 2:00 pm ET (11:00 am PT)
 for the next live presentation in our Vendor Victory Series. This time we’re going to show you how to get business with the government, so you can bring home those lucrative contracts. 
You'll learn how to find RFPs that are great for your business, as well as effective sales and marketing strategies. By attending, you’ll discover techniques that will immediately allow you to start generating impactful results within your company.   
By joining our presentation, you’ll learn: 
Proven sales and marketing techniques to help you acquire government contracts. 
How to find RFPs that are a great fit for your business. 
Insights into how government buyers decide which firms to hire – and how to adjust your strategy to maximize the odds of success. 
With over 2,000 people signed up for our last presentation in the Vendor Victory series, this one is sure to be a hit as well.

subject: Leadership highlights; brand protection in the holidays; USPTO’s new design patent bar
body:
23 November 2023 
 
Editor's Round-Up
This week, we brought you all the highlights from INTA’s 
biggest ever Leadership Meeting
. With over 1,600 brand professionals in Houston for the event last week, everything from 
Starbucks’ NFT enforcement to an IP office extinction warning and Barbie’s DEI mission were on the agenda. Meanwhile, as the holiday season kicks into gear, the increase in sales makes online platforms a hotbed for infringement and brand impersonation. Anti-counterfeiting experts offered their tips for 
protecting brands from opportunists
 this time of year. 
Other trending content:
 
Practitioners divided over new USPTO design patent bar
Revealed: media industry’s leading law firm representatives
With online infringement on the rise, community engagement is key
Microsoft leads tech brands bounceback, but other sectors suffer: WTR Brand Elite analysis
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Deputy editor
Insight 
Fiducial Legal By Lamy
 
Karine Disdier-Mikus
 
Pierre Nieuwyaer
 
France: EU legislation and amended national IP code prove a formidable combination
 
Featured in 
Anti-counterfeiting and Online Brand Enforcement: Global Guide 2023
 
Rights holders rely on anti-counterfeiting authorities to expertly use legislative enforcement tools, protecting domestic IP at home and across the European Union. 
Read more »
 
Tahota (Beijing) Law Firm
 
Charles Feng
 
Yifan Lu
 
Lian Xue
 
The Beijing Measure: whether data should be a registered and protected form of intellectual property in China
 
Featured in 
Inside China’s IP Market: a Guide 2024
 
Shenzhen, the Zhejiang and Jiangsu provinces and Beijing have enacted data IP registration-related legal documents, responding to calls for the establishment of a data property rights system. Beijing’s efforts highlight it as a pilot area for national data IP work. 
Read more »
 
Events 
 
  12 - 13 March 2024 | London, UK 
WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe 2024
 
On 12 and 13 March, WTR Live: Brand Strategy Summit Europe is returning to London to bring together senior brand leaders, in-house trademark professionals, policy makers and their trusted legal advisers. 
 
Over the course of two days, this high-level conference will provide you with commercial and strategic insight, empowering your brand to overcome any challenges it may face, while maintaining its competitive edge. 
Learn more here
Subscribe
Follow us on LinkedIn 
  and Twitter 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866

subject: Reminder: Employee Benefit Plan Webinar: Explore Economic Impacts, Year-End Actions
body:
Join this webinar to hear actions you can take before year-end to help keep your employees’ retirement benefits competitive and safe.
View in browser
 
 
 
2023 Year-end Planning for Employee Benefit Plans
 
WEBINAR
  |  November 30  |  11 a.m. – noon CT 
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credits,   Specialized Knowledge
Register Now
 
As 2023 comes to an end, current economic events have impacted all aspects of business — including employee benefit plans. Now, at year-end, we are looking at developments and recommended practices regarding employee benefit plans with an eye toward future potential changes and opportunities.
 
This 
complimentary 
webinar will discuss actions you can take before year-end to help keep your employees’ retirement benefits competitive and safe. 
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize trends and legislation that may impact employee benefit plans 
Outline recommended practices regarding employee benefit plan compliance 
Identify plan fiduciary considerations 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for plan sponsors, business owners, HR professionals, finance professionals, and employee benefits managers. 
 
Speakers  
Joey Kennedy
, Manager 
Breezy Paulus
, Director
Please 
register
 by November 29, 2023.

Hi, y’all. 
  
Please see thread below
 
  
Summary:
 Our prospect Baker Tilly has expressed interest in an “Understanding the Muslim Experience in America” digital asset – either eLearning or microlearning. He said that he’s drawn to the eLearning but is “wondering if given the timeline to develop, I opted for [microlearning] to get something out to our team members.”  
  
This is something I conferred with Kelly about, when Baker Tilly asked for pricing, then provided the 3 options below. He’s referring to options 1 and 2, which I’ve highlighted in blue for you.

subject: PEP Talk: Learn to Navigate the Complexities of Pooled Employer Plans
body:
Join our webinar for insights and guidance to help navigate complexities of pooled employer plans and compliance with regulatory standards.
View in browser
 
 
 
PEP Talk: Demystifying PEPs — Roles and Responsibilities Explained
 
WEBINAR
  |  December 14  |  1 – 2 p.m. CT
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credit, Specialized Knowledge
Register Now
 
Join our 
complimentary 
webinar to gain valuable insights and guidance to help you navigate the complexities of pooled employer plans (PEPs) and achieve compliance with regulatory standards. Whether you are considering joining a PEP or already participating in one, this webinar will provide you with knowledge and tools to effectively fulfill your roles and responsibilities. 
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Define what a PEP is 
Recognize the roles and responsibilities of the pooled plan provider (PPP)  
Identify the roles and responsibilities as an adopting employer 
Identify audit requirements and what to expect if you are a part of a PEP 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for plan sponsors, business owners, HR professionals, finance professionals, and employee benefits managers. 
 
Speakers  
Rachel Mahmood
, Principal 
Michele Chalmers
, Managing Principal of Office  
Please 
register 
by December 13, 2023.

body:

Join leaders from AbbVie, DHL, Great Place To Work, and Hilton
 
 
Dear Fortune Reader,
How can you put people first and build a strong company culture despite a weak economic environment? Join us and find out in this conversation with leaders from the “100 Best Companies to Work For.”

Tony Bond,

, and AbbVie Business HR Director for Global Operations 
Véronique Molinari.

Tuesday, December 5, 2023
8:00 AM EST/1:00 PM GMT/2:00 PM CET

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 Nov. 19, 2023
body:
Check out the latest resources from Training Industry.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
It’s that time of year — for family, fun and a little bit of planning! Our team has put together some great resources to help you plan your training strategy for the coming year.
We just released our 
2024 Trends Report
, which identifies six trends influencing the future of corporate training. We also have dozens of webinars and events that you can watch live or on demand, as well as articles, infographics, e-books and reports on a variety of topics — all ready and waiting. 
We want to ensure this newsletter is hitting the mark. Please complete 
this short survey
 to let us know the resources that you want delivered to your inbox. As always, we love hearing from you. Send us your comments to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
.
Michelle Eggleston Schwartz, CPTM
Editor in Chief
Training Industry’s 2024 Trends Report
We just released our annual trends report, “
Trends 2024: L&D as a Key Business Driver
.” This report examines the growing importance of L&D for organizational success and highlights six trends influencing the future of corporate training. 
Read now
 to explore L&D trends related to improving talent retention, artificial intelligence (AI), learner engagement, the revival of instructor-led training and more.
Read Now
 
Leader Talk: Create Impactful Learning Experience
Employees want opportunities for growth and a sense of purpose in their roles. To meet these expectations, learning leaders must ensure that training is engaging with tangible outcomes that help learners reach their goals. Join us
 Dec. 7 
for this 
complimentary virtual event
 where you will gain insights on how to create impactful learning experiences that improve learner engagement and learning outcomes.
Register Now
 
2023 Top IT and Technical Training Companies

short survey

brand restrictions

.

subject: Prepare for an 'age of austerity' in 2024
body:
Plus: Meet the women ditching the corporate rat race to become "Snail Girls" with "lazy girl jobs."
View this email in your browser.
 
Saturday, November 18, 2023
Lee Clifford
Finance Editor
The U.S. is on the cusp of switching from a decade of plenty to a long and painful period of austerity.
So writes 
Fortune
 senior correspondent Shawn Tully 
in a new piece
 examining the forces that may exert control of the markets and economy heading into 2024. Speaking with Jim Masturzo, chief investment officer at Research Affiliates, a firm that oversees strategies for over $130 billion in mutual funds and ETFs for the likes of Pimco and Charles Schwab, Tully writes about how the year could play out: 
“Masturzo concedes that in the short term, ‘The economy could remain buoyant and investors resilient.’ But he believes that the big federal spending and ‘free money’ Fed policy that funded the bash will soon leave a stiff hangover. ‘The macro game of musical chairs cannot go on forever,’ Masturzo writes. It was the regional banking crisis starting in March, he says, that exposed the first cracks. But after a steep selloff, frenzied excitement over the future of AI sent Big Tech soaring once again.” 
“Now, Masturzo believes the economy and the markets stand near an historic inflection point that can only temporarily be averted by such probably ephemeral phenomena as the AI craze and the favorable Nov. 14 CPI report that got shares jumping. The exhaustion of the COVID money, the end of student loan forbearance, and the stubbornly rising prices bound to spook consumers will ‘pave the way for an eventual recession,’ and usher in years of austerity.”
This will have profound effects on the markets, too. As Tully writes: “In the new paradigm, the best investment categories of the last decade should prove the worst performers going forward, while the beaten-down, unloved sectors of recent years are likely to thrive.”
You can read the full analysis—including which stocks are likely to thrive in the new era of austerity—
here
.
Expect subpar returns in a new ‘age of austerity,’ says a top analyst at Research Affiliates
Nov. 16, 2023

SUCCESS

TECH

The maker of ChatGPT is building an app store model in which anyone can create and download custom GPTs.
WELL

LEADERSHIP
‘The Marvels’ flop shows that Kevin Feige’s ‘brilliance,’ which drove $29B for Marvel, is no match for Disney’s insatiable need for content
 
The dismal opening weekend of 
The Marvels
 highlights that the Marvel movie studio is facing a box office problem for the first time in its history. 
Linda Yaccarino scrambles to clean up Elon Musk’s mess after the X owner once again drives her advertisers away
The ad executive-turned-CEO wasted no time reassuring advertisers that X has made “efforts to combat antisemitism and discrimination.”

Hi Mahlia, 
  
My name is Pedro Seminario, a team member at the DEI and cultural competence firm, LCW. I’m a colleague of Dan Gough, head of our consulting team. 
  
This year we’ve had the pleasure of providing you with our facilitation on 
Intent vs Impact
. 
Thank you for being our client.
 
  
I wanted to take this opportunity to let you all know that we are discounting our identity-specific Spotlights when purchased in a bundle. These one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops are focused on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills, and a culture of belonging throughout the enterprise. Here are the costs before and after the discount (discounts apply when you make the full payment up front, and you may schedule the sessions at times convenient for you):

Separately, we are all very aware that our field of DEI has been experiencing a lot of backlash in 2023, and that many of us have had to adapt by using more varied language during our work of advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion – so that we can reach all of our important constituents.  We’ve compiled this list, in case it’s useful to you at all: 
  
Words to use instead of "DEI", when embedding inclusion & equity within our organization: 
Inclusive leadership 
Leading across cultures 
Organizational culture 
Balanced teams 
Building intercultural competence as a leadership, communication, and collaboration skill 
Accessibility (for persons with disabilities but also equitable accessibility to information, resources, key people & networks, and development opportunities) 
Fairness 
Respect 
Psychological safety 
Unity 
  
Outcomes of our work: 
Higher team performance, higher-performing teams 
More effective communication and listening skills 
Optimized potential and contributions of the people on our teams 
Being able to appreciate people for who they are and the value they bring 
Minimizing the chances that we’ll miss people’s value & contributions 
Understanding colleagues and customers more deeply and authentically 
Effective collaboration 
Leveraging team members’ strengths much more effectively 
Making (big or small) adjustments to your practices and process to improve fairness and objectivity 
Improvement of team dynamics 
Improvement of people’s ability to understand what their direct reports or colleagues need 
An environment where everyone can succeed 
Cohesive team culture 
  
Lastly, if you feel our spotlight bundle is something that would resonate with your teams, I would love the opportunity to connect and set a time for us to meet. 
  
Thank you for your partnership and for your focus, and I look forward to your response. Have a wonderful day! 
  
All the best, 
  
  
Pedro Seminario

Victoria Arnold-Rees

Early warnings about brand restrictions predicted that they would spread from tobacco products to other industries. With that now happening, members of INTA’s Brand Restrictions Committee chart the impact on multiple product sectors, and how the association is engaging with policymakers on the issue.

Fifth Circuit finds that gun manufacturer lawsuit did not toll prescriptive period
 
A recent spat between two competing gun manufacturers over the trademarked appearance of a barrel has highlighted timing issues relating to the statute of limitations, as well as restrictions and complications of involving a sister company.
Authors:
Joshua Revilla 
Insight 
LegalVision
 
Rebecca Jones
 
Sahil Verma
 
Graci Chen
 
Australia: The Prosecution Landscape From Pendency to Use Requirements
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Prosecution Review 2024
 
Both registered and unregistered trademarks are recognised and protected in Australia, either by way of formal registration under trademark legislation, or the protection afforded by the consumer law and the common law tort of passing off. Australia’s trademark legislation provides avenues for the opposition to registration of trademarks, as well as removal of trademarks from the register. 
Read more »
 
CCPIT Patent and Trademark Law Office
 
Xiao Jin
 
Trade secret litigation and arriving at a definition of ‘commensurate’ security measures
 
Featured in 
Inside China’s IP Market: a Guide 2024
 
Recent Supreme People’s Court judgments attempt to answer the questions of what kinds of security measures are accepted as commensurate, what the underlying theories are behind the word ‘commensurate’, and what aspects rights holders should pay attention to when adopting security measures. 
Read more »

subject: Melissa's Work Summary + HubSpot Marketing Module stuff
body:
Thanks so much, Melissa. Looking forward to the rest of the stuff on Monday!
 
Copying Briza on the reply, as she’s helping Chuck with a bunch of projects, tracking info on contractors being one of them, plus she’s been helping us with the HubSpot changes. And also copying Alisa, as she is involved with HubSpot decision-making. 
 
Re: the Marketing features, as I mentioned to you the decision was made relatively recently to perhaps downgrade the Marketing module to ‘Starter’ from the current ‘Professional’.  Since we don’t have a marketing team anymore we currently don’t have a coordinated Marketing strategy, but we will at some point in the future. So for now it may be best to go down to ‘Starter’ – though I don’t understand the pros and cons enough to be the decision maker.  
 
I also lack the Marketing expertise or knowledge to make a decision on your list below, but I did some digging and created a document comparing the ‘Starter’ module to the ‘Professional’ module (which is what we have now) from data on their website – see attached.  
 
Looking at the bullets you listed below, after looking a the Comparison doc:
Campaign Tracking:
 Campaign Mgmt and Campaign Reporting are both unavailable in the Starter module. 
Marketing reporting:
 10 dashboards and 10 reports per dashboards are included in Starter. Campaign reporting, custom reporting, and marketing asset comparison reporting are unavailable.
Blog:
 1 blog is included
Website integration:
 Website traffic analytics (Standard web analytics dashboard) is included in Starter. In pro, we have ‘customizable website traffic analytics’. Also, I don’t know what this means but ‘Google Search Console integration’ is not available in Starter. 
 
I’ve highlighted all pertinent boxes in orange in the attached. Hopefully this is useful to us, Briza and Alisa!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
From:
 Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, November 15, 2023 10:25 AM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Work Summary
 
Hi Rebecca,
 
I’m nearly finished with the work you have expressed my need to complete. By Monday morning, I will have shared with you an updated playbook with the HubSpot Instructions that you requested, have sent you a follow-up email to our last meeting with a few sources and clarifications, have the finalized consulting report view to you, and completed the final changes to the quote and proposal templates. The next timesheet will have no more than eight hours.
 
Several weeks ago, I wrote and requested guidance on the following projects but did not receive any. However, knowing that you will likely change the marketing subscription, these might no longer be needed.
 
HubSpot / Marcom Setup
Are these still needed?
Campaign Tracking
Marketing Reporting
Blog Set Up
Website Integration with HubSpot to allow for tracking customer journey and website interactions
 
As always, I will be here if you need me but assume that most of my work is nearing completion. I would, however, like to have one more meeting with you to discuss the marketing side of HubSpot and some of the unique billing features. You may have to change a few settings not to receive additional (very costly) fees when your contract renews. I also want to ensure you have access to the source files for Jake’s lists.
 
If you have any questions, please let me know.
 
Kind regards,
 
C. Melissa Neu

subject: An email was logged on records you're following
body:
An email was logged on records you're following
 
 
Hi Sasha, 
  
My name is Pedro Seminario, a team member at the DEI and cultural competence firm, LCW. 
Just this year, we've worked with Catalent to provide interpreters for several GMP inspections. 
Thank you for being our client.
 
  
I wanted to take this opportunity to let you all know that we are discounting our identity-specific Spotlights when purchased in a bundle. These one-hour, interactive, deep-dive workshops are focused on the experience of being a member of these communities, and contribute to building cultural competence, inclusion skills, and a culture of belonging throughout the enterprise. Here are the costs before and after the discount (discounts apply when you make the full payment up front, and you may schedule the sessions at times convenient for you):

$24K 
  
Separately, we are all very aware that our field of DEI has been experiencing a lot of backlash in 2023, and that many of us have had to adapt by using more varied language during our work of advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion – so that we can reach all of our important constituents.  We’ve compiled this list, in case it’s useful to you at all: 
  
Words to use instead of "DEI", when embedding inclusion & equity within our organization: 
Inclusive leadership 
Leading across cultures 
Organizational culture 
Balanced teams 
Building intercultural competence as a leadership, communication, and collaboration skill 
Accessibility (for persons with disabilities but also equitable accessibility to information, resources, key people & networks, and development opportunities) 
Fairness 
Respect 
Psychological safety 
Unity 
  
Outcomes of our work: 
Higher team performance, higher-performing teams 
More effective communication and listening skills 
Optimized potential and contributions of the people on our teams 
Being able to appreciate people for who they are and the value they bring 
Minimizing the chances that we’ll miss people’s value & contributions 
Understanding colleagues and customers more deeply and authentically 
Effective collaboration 
Leveraging team members’ strengths much more effectively 
Making (big or small) adjustments to your practices and process to improve fairness and objectivity 
Improvement of team dynamics 
Improvement of people’s ability to understand what their direct reports or colleagues need 
An environment where everyone can succeed 
Cohesive team culture 
  
Lastly, if you feel our spotlight bundle is something that would resonate with your teams, I would love the opportunity to connect and set a time for us to meet. 
  
I look forward to your response. Have a wonderful day! 
  
All the best, 
  
  
Pedro Seminario
Business Development Associate

body:

Hey Melissa, 
I noticed your company has jobs posted on LinkedIn as a "basic job". 
Basic jobs will appear in search results and on your company page but aren’t provided with prominent placement. 
Basically those jobs are seen by about 5% of the LinkedIn network. 
 
Most businesses don’t realize there are LinkedIn tools specifically designed for them to help promote, target and hire qualified applicants. 
Are you interested in exploring further? Let me know if you'd like to connect or just read more first.

subject: 5 Tips for Creating an L&D Strategy
body:
Set yourself up for success!
View this email in your browser
.
BUILDING
YOUR L&D
STRATEGY
L&D Plan Template
Strategic Planning Toolkit
Leading your organization's training function means setting your learning and development (L&D) strategy. Your strategy should include your objectives for the year, budgets and timelines, and any information relevant to how you came to your proposed solution(s).
What Is Strategic Alignment?
The most important element of your L&D strategy is its alignment to your overall organizational strategy. 
Strategic alignment
 is the process of prioritizing the training function’s goals and mission around key business priorities to ensure that business results are achieved. To achieve strategic alignment, you'll need to draw clear connections between your L&D strategy and organizational goals.
Here are five tips for developing (and maintaining) your L&D strategy.
Build relationships
 with key stakeholders and develop open lines of communication to understand their goals and priorities.
Understand your resources
, both internal and external, so you can consider all of your options before deciding on solutions.
Understand your learners
 in terms of their needs and preferences to create solutions that will work for their unique context.
Be realistic
 with your budget and timeline, expect things to take longer, and cost more, than you initially predict.
Prioritize sustainability
 for a plan you can stick to. This means opting for long-term, future-oriented solutions over short-term, quick fixes.
The Strategic Planning Workshop: Your One-Stop-Shop for L&D Strategy
Looking for more help? In the 
Strategic Planning Workshop
 from 
Training Industry Courses
, you'll learn to create an L&D strategy rooted in strategic alignment. Click below to learn more or click 
here
 to preview the course content.

We understand the challenges that learning and development (L&D) professionals face in managing training programs that align with organizational goals and drive business impact. To help address those challenges, we created a comprehensive suite of courses that will empower you to deliver creative training solutions.

subject: Last Call for Congress Proposals!
body:
You don't often get email from office@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
Submit yours now
 
View this email in your browser
 
Last chance to submit your proposal for the SIETAR-Europa 2024 Congress in Lille, France
 
Propose your session here
 
 
Systems: the ecosystem of interculturalism
Intercultural Communication was never and will never exist in isolation from other fields. In fact, it was born out of a variety of different disciplines: anthropology, linguistics, psychology, ethnography, etc., to name only a few. Intercultural Communication as a field came of age in a time and place that influenced its becoming: A slowly decolonizing (and not quite decolonizing) world still rife with power differences, dependencies, and in search of new ways of extracting value beyond overt domination. In recent years new perspectives have come into view that have deeply influenced the intercultural scene. From neuroscience to anti-racist justice, from migration studies to critical history; new voices, paradigms, and perspectives begin to have a significant influence on how we make sense of what it means to work on, in, and for intercultural communication. 
This congress wants to explore these systemic dependencies and place interculturalism into a paradigm that looks ahead by acknowledging its past and that shapes its future with intention. We want to begin inventing solutions for problems that are emerging on the horizon, give space for difficult conversations that address the roots of divisions, animosities, and violence, and learn from each other the practical ways in which we can advance communication, co-creation, and constructive dialogue; together.
  
The WHAT?
We live in tumultuous times. New questions are on everyone’s mind that rhyme with history, yet at the same time they seem unprecedented and overwhelming. Reflecting on these questions together might shed some light into the ecosystem of ways to understand the world where interculturalism can help. Here are some starting points that might help you think about how you can best contribute to the congress. These are not prescriptive, but we hope that they might inspire you: 
Interculturalism and the political reality of now: 
How do you work towards mutual acceptance and understanding when war is raging both in the middle of Europe and in so many other locations in the world, year after year?
How can we engage with human rights and social justice in places near and far? And how could we include new voices - often hidden and silenced - in conversations concerning human rights and social justice in a way that avoids promoting a singular cultural narrative? 
How do we bridge political divisions in our communities when populism, conspiracy myths, and hatred dominate so much of the political discourse? 
What could be our roles and responsibilities in relation to the treatment, reception, representation, and integration of asylum seekers and refugees in the current political context of increasing hostility and rejection?
Interculturalism and the future of knowledge: 
How could interculturalism contribute to education systems fit for the future?
How and why to decolonize knowledge on and about intercultural communication?
In what ways could intercultural training be transformative spaces of change?
In what ways can big data and large language models improve research practices to understand the phenomenon of culture more deeply than previously possible? 
To what degree is Artificial Intelligence capable of being interculturally competent? Are intercultural trainers, coaches, consultants, and researchers automatable?
How can interculturalists make meaningful contributions to address bias in Artificial Intelligence technologies?
Interculturalism and the livability of this planet: 
How to address the paradox of the desire to travel, to build a career around global mobility, or the internationalization of business if these very actions contribute so significantly to the decline of the health of this planet?
Global migration patterns will be amplified by extreme weather threats, particularly for the most vulnerable. What are the challenges awaiting the intercultural field that come with that?  
 
What are ways for interculturalists to contribute to the healing of this planet? 
 
The HOW: 
At our Congress, each session will be a 1.5-hour block. You can submit proposals for the following formats. 
Research
 
Presentations
If you have done research these past years that culminated in interesting insights connected to the theme of the congress, we invite you to share it with the community. Your presentation should be around 20 minutes long. We will group your presentation with others that pull on a similar string and also appoint a Panel Chair, to moderate the discussions that follow. If you have suggestions on who to be paired with or who should chair the panel, please let us know. The Research Presentations are part of the Academic Research Stream, managed in partnership with IACCM. 
 
 
Project Reflections
: 
These sessions can include several presenters. You can go deep into presenting more complex research projects, learning initiatives, or developments of tools, frameworks or other collaborations.  
 
 
Workshops
: 
Workshops should be highly interactive: learning through doing, making, feeling, and sharing. A practical way to build up each other’s skills, be generous with our methods, and, hopefully, have fun together at the same time. 
 
 
Deep Dives:
These sessions focus on one topic. They are about thinking together and going deeper than is possible alone. This might include a presentation or a talk to kick things off but then focus on discussion and collective ideation. 
One way to do a deep dive might be, for example, an ‘In Conversation’ format, where you and a second person coming from different fields or perspectives engage in dialogue on the subject and then open the conversation up to the participants in the session. But be creative - this is a new format for a SIETAR Europa Congress. 
 
  
Insight fireworks:
If you have a talk that you think everyone should hear together, then we invite you to submit a proposal for the insight fireworks session: short talks in front of everyone; 6-8 minutes, not longer.   
  
Propose your session here
 
 
Policy on Hybrid: 
We want to make sure as many people as possible can participate in the SEU Congress. We also want to make sure that those who participate online have an excellent experience. In order to achieve this, we have the following policy on hybrid sessions:
 
If you are going to offer your session in a hybrid format, at least one of your contributors must be online, and at least one is present on-site. 
Only research presentations and project reflections can be hybrid. 
Workshops or Deep Dives must be either fully online or fully in-person.
Insight Fireworks as well as all other plenary sessions will be streamed online. 
At any time, only 2 to 3 hybrid sessions can run in parallel in order to ensure adequate tech and production support for each one. 
 
 
Congress Registration
Registration for the Congress will open in 
February 2024.
 Please be aware that only those sessions can stay in the program where the person proposing the session has registered for the Congress. In principle, however, we hope that you are aware that presenting at the SEU-Congress tends to involve costs such as registration fees, and travel to and accommodation in Lille. Members of SIETAR Europa and its member organisations as well as members of IACCM will receive a member’s discount. We are aware that this can still be a burden to many and we are trying to find ways to make this Congress as accessible as possible. If you need support, please reach out to us.
Propose your session here
 
 
Best wishes.
The SIETAR Europa Congress Steering Committee
 
 
Share
 
 
Tweet
 
 
Share
 
 
Forward

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 Nov. 12, 2023
body:
Check out the latest resources from Training Industry.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
There are many factors that contribute to a successful learning and development (L&D) program, the main one being the people behind the training. That’s why, this week, I wanted to share some of our helpful (free) resources that you’ll want to bookmark because they’ve all been designed to make your job easier.
Our virtual 
Conversation Series
 events bring together L&D professionals to discuss training challenges and real-world strategies to overcome those challenges.
The 
Training Manager Competency
 Model identifies the core responsibilities and competencies of successful training professionals, helping you determine your own professional development goals.
Our 
wiki
 and 
glossary
 are fundamental resources specifically catered to learning professionals, clarifying and providing practical examples of concepts and tools essential to trainers’ roles.
And we have a whole collection of 
templates and tools
 designed to ensure your success in the business of learning.
To help us continue curating resources that are most helpful and relevant to you, we’re asking for your input in our 
Training Industry Research audience survey
. Your voice matters, so please take a few minutes to share your thoughts with us. 
And, as always, you can email us at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any other comments or suggestions. Have a great week!
Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor 
Create Unique Learning Experiences in Minutes
L&D leaders are under pressure to develop training content, but often struggle with limited resources and time constraints. Simplify and speed up your course-authoring process with 
Articulate 360’s
 award-winning creator tools. Gain access to more than 9 million course assets and templates, hundreds of professionally developed prebuilt courses, live and on-demand training with industry experts, and more.
Start Your Free Trial
 
Training Industry Research Audience Survey
At Training Industry, we highly value your insights and opinions, and we're always striving to better serve your needs. As part of this commitment, we are conducting a 
brief survey
 to understand what topics and insights are most useful to you, the organization you work for and other training professionals like you. Help us bring you more relevant content by completing this 5-minute survey.
Take the Survey
 
[Leader Talk] Coaching Strategies and Tactics
Coaching is a popular and effective way to provide hands-on, personalized training and build learner engagement. Whether you’re starting a coaching program from scratch or looking to refine what’s already in place, our 
upcoming Leader Talk
 will provide the insights you need to be successful. Join us for this complimentary online event Nov. 16 where industry experts will share their tips for developing a coaching program that fosters a healthy company culture and encourages employee growth and development.
Register Now
 
Upcoming DEI Workshop

Diversity and Inclusion Workshop
 for Training Industry Courses because she says "this work takes time, resources and the appropriate advocacy and accountability from stakeholders at every level.” Get the tools you need to create meaningful DEI impact in your organization. Learn more below or

subject: Chinese litigation and customs strategies; Barbie brand evolution; ‘.ai’ domain warning; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
12 November 2023
 
 
Chinese litigation and customs strategies; Barbie brand evolution; ‘.ai’ domain warning; and much more
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
Long Read
We examine 
Barbie’s movie makeover
 and the story of an ever-evolving brand.
Monday 6 November
Local experts outline brand protection strategies for working with 
Indonesian customs authorities
.
Evalueserve’s Iveta Petrova offers practical tips for using 
AI in trademark enforcement
.
Plus:
CJEU considers international jurisdiction over defendants from different member states
 (European Union)
PTO prepares for administrative revocation of trademarks
 (Turkey)
Tuesday 7 November
Trademark filings decline for first time since the 2008 financial crisis, 
WIPO data reveals
.
Plans for an 
X username sale
, OpenAI’s Copyright Shield, and scam Temu websites feature in Tuesday’s news digest.
China’s 
new apostille procedure
 is welcome news for foreign companies litigating in the country.
Plus:
AIWA case highlights effectiveness of Andean oppositions
 (Bolivia)
UDRP: the pivotal role of substantial evidence
 (International)
Wednesday 8 November 
The IP Office of the Philippines aims to boost its mediator roster, Canada introduces trademark opposition changes, and the EUIPO launches a GI hub in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
WTR spends four days with the 
Asian Patent Attorneys Association
.
Plus: 
Battle of the dachshunds: figurative and word elements of composite marks may be co-dominant
 (European Union)
Trademark applications to be published directly after being received by IP Vietnam
 (Vietnam)
Thursday 9 November
Partners at gold-ranked firms form an eight-step guide for 
litigating trademark disputes in China
.
We offer best practices for brand protection at the 
Chinese border
.
Plus:
Crimes against intellectual property to be included in organised crime legislation
 (Peru)
False declaration of incontestability not enough to cancel US trademark registration
 (United States)
Understanding the legislation that governs non-use cancellation attacks
 (Market Insight: China)
Fifth Circuit finds that gun manufacturer lawsuit did not toll prescriptive period
 (Market Insight: United States)
Friday 10 November
Moncler wins big in China, Vinted launches an 
authentication service
, Allen & Overy suffers a data breach, and more.
Costs, trade secrets, anti-counterfeiting and AI are among the key talking points of WTR’s 
Latin America IP Summit
.
Plus:
General Court confirms that ENDURANCE lacks distinctiveness
 (European Union)
Anytime Fitness unsuccessful in opposition against ANYTIME 24 for fitness services
 (Japan)
Saturday 11 November 
Brand enforcement in the 
‘.ai’ domain space
 needs to be a priority, warns this week’s opinion column.
Special Report: Safeguarding Style
WTR 
latest Special Report
 delves into the multifaceted landscape of brand creation and protection in the fashion and luxury industry, exploring the filing strategies, anti-counterfeiting technologies and international collaborations that are essential to success.
Subscribe

  and Twitter

subject: Employee Benefit Plan Webinar: Explore Economic Impacts, Year-End Actions
body:
Join this webinar to hear actions you can take before year-end to help keep your employees’ retirement benefits competitive and safe.
View in browser
 
 
 
2023 Year-end Planning for Employee Benefit Plans
 
WEBINAR
  |  November 30  |  11 a.m. – noon CT 
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credits,   Specialized Knowledge
Register Now
 
As 2023 comes to an end, current economic events have impacted all aspects of business — including employee benefit plans. Now, at year-end, we are looking at developments and recommended practices regarding employee benefit plans with an eye toward future potential changes and opportunities.
 
This 
complimentary 
webinar will discuss actions you can take before year-end to help keep your employees’ retirement benefits competitive and safe. 
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize trends and legislation that may impact employee benefit plans 
Outline recommended practices regarding employee benefit plan compliance 
Identify plan fiduciary considerations 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for plan sponsors, business owners, HR professionals, finance professionals, and employee benefits managers.

subject: Re: Melissa - From Day One 2024 Live Event Series
body:
You don't often get email from paul@fromdayone.co. 
Learn why this is important
Melissa,
 
Excited to share our 2024 calendar of live and virtual people meetings for the HR/DEI and CPO Community.  Please see the press release below but wanted to make sure to bubble this up in your inbox.  Could we set up a call next week to touch base on the calendar and opportunities?
 
How's next Monday or Tuesday? Would 3pm either day work for you? You can also use my Calendly link here: 
https://calendly.com/
paulmorrongiello
 
Excited to connect and discuss getting Language & Culture Worldwide involved! 
   
Best, 
Paul
Top executives in HR, Diversity, Corporate Culture, Employee Engagement, and Corporate Social Responsibility discuss hybrid work, social impact, employee engagement, and more.
FROM DAY ONE 2024 IN-PERSON CONFERENCE SCHEDULE 
* indicates exact date is confirmed.
*ATLANTA, GA — January 2
*HOUSTON, TX — February 6
*SEATTLE, WA — February 20
*SILICON VALLEY, CA — February 22
SALT LAKE CITY, UT — March 12
*WASHINGTON, D.C. — March 26
BROOKLYN, NY — April 9
BOSTON, MA — April 18
CHICAGO, IL — April 21
DALLAS, TX — May 7
*MINNEAPOLIS, MN — May 14
 AUSTIN, TX — June 6
SAN FRANCISCO, CA — June 26
BOSTON, MA — September 12
NASHVILLE, TN — October 1
PHILADELPHIA, PA — October 8 
MANHATTAN, NY — October 22
DENVER, CO — October 29
 
 
LOS ANGELES, CA — November 12
 
MIAMI, FL — November 26
 
SAN FRANCISCO, CA — December 3
FROM DAY ONE 2023 VIRTUAL CONFERENCE SCHEDULE
Jan. 10, 2024 - A Fresh Commitment to a Culture of Well-Being
While many employers recognize the connection between well-being and productivity, creating a healthy balance in the real world of work can be challenging. What are the key choices and thoughtful compromises that must be made for workers to thrive as well as produce? How can managers be trained to make the well-being of their workers a top priority? How can companies get a better sense of which benefits and rewards are most effective–and encourage workers to take advantage of them. 
Feb. 14, 2024 - Getting to the Next Stage of Diversity and Belonging 
At a time of resistance and corporate austerity, DEI advocates will need to re-energize themselves and their organizations with new ideas, programs, and reasoning for the cause of diversity. What can DEI practitioners learn from companies with consistent success? How are companies changing their policies to respond to court rulings and lawsuits? What practices have brought the most progress in bringing diversity to leadership rank
 
March 6, 2024 - Employee Engagement: Tapping the Secrets of Energizing Workers 
Companies want their employees to be enthused and involved, yet employers need to be thoughtful in fostering these qualities in authentic ways. What’s the latest thinking about how employers can understand the motivations of their workers–and how to respond? What are the best methods for recognizing achievement, both individually and among teams? What’s the connection between engagement and job satisfaction? In the hybrid work environment, what binds workers together and wards off anxiety and loneliness?
 
April 3, 2024 - Benefits that Fit Individual Needs Without Busting the Budge
Having made a commitment to recognize the unique needs of individuals, the secret is in the execution. What are the emerging benefits and rewards that workers are seeking, from fertility care to financial wellness? How can companies use technology to stay in close touch with what individuals are experiencing–and where they need help as a result? How can companies choose among myriad point solutions and innovative new platforms? What are the most cost-effective rewards in terms of investments and outcomes
May 22, 2024 - The Art and Science of Employee Retention, Coaching and Advancement
While the pace of job-hopping has eased, employers have a powerful motivation to retain skilled workers, both for financial and cultural reasons. How can employers use new tools, including AI, to gain insights about what’s inspiring their workers to stay committed–or walk out the door? Since attrition is often caused by poor relationships with managers, what are innovative ways for employers to train their workers to be better leaders at a time when workers have higher expectations for job satisfaction? How can technology help make coaching more effective?
June 12, 2024 - Bringing Talent Acquisition into the Digital Age
Despite layoffs making headlines now, all the demographic and digital trends point toward tough competition for workers in the future–maybe sooner than most expect. What are the new techniques and tools that talent-acquisition can use to envision the workforce their company will need in the future? What data and insights can HR and TA leaders provide to the company to be ahead of trends? How can companies do a better job of internal recruiting and promoting internal mobility? What are the best practices for hiring based on skills and potential, rather than credentials?
 July 10, 2024 - Learning and Development: How New Tools Are Changing Upskilling and Career Mobility 
 
 
As employers put more emphasis on skills as the currency for worker development, they’re seeking new ways to measure them, fill in gaps, and predict the skills needed in the future. How can these new tools, including AI, create better matches between employees and projects? How can employers gain insights from the data they gather? Why do real-world simulations help measure certain skills better than traditional assessments? 
 July 17, 2024 - Innovative Benefits That Support Healthy Families and Caregivers
 
 
As the pandemic’s caregiving crisis showed, employers found significant gaps in their support for the parents and other caregivers in their workforces. The resulting scramble to help has produced a wealth of new HR policies, benefit offerings, and management practices. Where is the greatest demand for support, as well as the most innovative new methods? What have been the most cost-effective ways to help caregivers of all kinds, including parents as well as “sandwich generation” workers caring for elderly and disabled relatives? 
 Aug. 7, 2024 - Employee Engagement: Using Technology to Gain Insight Into Work Needs and Ambitions
 
 
Traditional methods like town-hall meetings and surveys can be effective, but data and well-drawn insights can give top leaders a heads up about evolving patterns and trends in their workforces. How can AI and other technology be deployed in a way that brings new insights yet still respects privacy and the individual human factors at play? What approaches will bring employers new empathy for worker needs, ambitions, and well-being? 
 
 
Aug. 28, 2024 - Pursuing Higher Productivity With Human Factors in Mind
 
 
In a competitive and uncertain climate, most companies need to do more with less. Yet if workers are their greatest asset, employers need to make sure the push for greater output is sustainable. What is the latest thinking about how to measure productivity, the means for stimulating it, and ensuring that workers have the energy to meet their goals–as well as thrive over the long run?
Sept. 18, 2024 - Building a Corporate Culture That Workers Can Understand, Influence and Embrace  
Company culture is amorphous yet vital–the shared beliefs, values, traditions and behaviors that drive the actions of individuals and the organization as a whole. Who should be the architects of a company’s culture and how should it be designed and constructed? How should the culture be communicated, broadly and in everyday actions? How should a company start out on a project to evolve its culture in a credible way?  
Oct. 16, 2024 - Modernizing Your Workplace for a More Flexible, Inclusive Era
 
 
The arrival of hybrid work sent virtually every employer back to the drawing board about what the workplace should look like, including floor plans, digital platforms, meetings, and even office furniture. After more than three years of experimenting, what have innovative companies discovered about what works–and what doesn’t? How have they improved workplace environments to be healthier, as well as more productive? How have these changes affected the goals of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging?
 
Nov. 20, 2024 - Finding and Deploying HR Tech That Will Empower Workers  
 
The blossoming of innovation in HR technology has given employers untold new abilities to organize, inspire, develop, reward, and care for their workers. Yet this revolution presents new challenges for companies in choosing and supervising these tech tools. How should these tech platforms be evaluated? Which departments of the company should take responsibility–and how can organizations coordinate these moves? How can companies make sure they’re empowering their workers rather than overloading them with adaptation and distraction?
 
Dec. 11, 2024 - Pioneering Approaches to Digital Transformation and the Future of Work
 
The emergence of generative AI in 2023 marked the arrival of a transforming technology that will change human roles, add and subtract jobs, and create astounding new capabilities. How can companies manage the transition, both from the short-term competitive pressures to  long-term corporate survival? How can AI be used to unleash creativity? Where are the areas for abuse, intentional or otherwise? How will digital transformation affect fields from talent acquisition to learning and development?
Paul Morrongiello
From Day One

subject: A meeting was logged on records you're following
body:
A meeting was logged on records you're following
 
 
Hello DEI and HR Practitioners, As you know, bias doesn’t only exist when recruiting.  It’s at every stage of the talent life cycle. Mark your calendar: 12/ 6 at noon for “Let’s Talk Talent: Examining the Talent Lifecycle Through an Intercultural Competence Lens” (75 min: 1-hr presentation & 15 min Q&A) Join us for a session that will give you an overview of what it takes to build and maintain a sustainable culture of inclusion throughout your talent processes. In this session, we’ll share strategies and characteristics of organizations that fall under one of three talent systems stages: “Unstructured/Defining”, “Implementing” or “Optimizing” – around the following: Capability / Training Infrastructure Attracting & Recruiting Talent Interviewing & Hiring Talent Engaging & Retaining Talent Managing Performance & Career Advancement Pipeline Development & Talent Review Measurement & Accountability Presenters from LCW (Language and Culture Worldwide), explain their Sustainable Culture of Inclusion (SCI) Model, a framework for understanding what “success across cultures” looks like as well as a roadmap for creating it. Its grounding premise is that a sustainable, inclusive culture exists when there is: (a) a critical mass of people (especially leaders) with mindsets that are proficient in intercultural competence, as well as (b) optimized, inclusive talent & people management systems. Success across both dimensions produces both a positive working experience and equitable outcomes for all. We can’t do everything, all at once, right now – but this session will provide you with a structure that you can utilize to prioritize and plan for your organization. We hope you can join us for this valuable session. Get to know our facilitator, Sarah Nodarse from LCW. << RTF: Rich object >> Sarah Nodarse, Ph.D., Principal Consultant As a consultant and facilitator, Sarah helps leaders, teams, and organizations cultivate their potential and accelerate performance. Her approach is grounded in the belief that since organizations create culture deliberately, they have the potential to solve the world’s most pressing problems. On a mission to put the human back in human capital consulting, Sarah has extensive experience with Fortune 1000 organizations building and implementing talent management, leadership development, and culture change initiatives that enable the achievement of ambitious business goals in line with organizational values. As a senior consultant for Willis Towers Watson and The Zone Global, Sarah gained extensive experience in the non-profit, biotech, construction, consumer goods, defense and aerospace, energy and utilities, financial services, healthcare, high-tech, hospitality, manufacturing, and professional services industries. Sarah earned a Ph.D. in cultural anthropology at the University of Chicago, is a Senior SHRH-Certified Professional in Human Resources and is bilingual in English and French.
