subject: Debrief: Los Angeles
body:
You don't often get email from nick@fromdayone.co. 
Learn why this is important
The conference brought together 250+ leaders in HR from large organizations such as Paramount, Mattel, Netflix, Levi Strauss, Lionsgate, Warner Bros
 
Kicking off with a conversation about how one of Hollywood's top talent agencies has built a workplace culture of inclusion to support star clients including Bad Bunny and Karol G, From Day One hosted 
Rediscovering Community Amid Changing Corporate Values
, a live conference on Nov. 2 at the Hudson Loft in Downtown Los Angeles. 
The conference brought together 250+ leaders in HR and related fields, primarily from large and mid-sized organizations such as Paramount, Mattel, Netflix, Levi Strauss, Lionsgate, Warner Bros., and many others. 
Participants heard conversations on creating purpose-driven workplaces, sustaining momentum in diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), the business benefits of supporting caregivers in the workforce, and much more. 
The speaker lineup featured Jean-Rene Zetrenne (CPO @ United Talent Agency), Mason Williams (DEI Head @ Mattel), Nicole Husband (People VP @ W/B Discovery), Christina Glennon (People VP @ Levi Strauss & Co.), Amy Baker (People VP @ Activision Blizzard), and Brian Padilla (HR VP @ Lionsgate), as well as moderators from the Los Angeles Times, Insider, and Out magazine. 
Among the two dozen sponsors were Grubhub, Achievers, Care for Business, Talkspace, and Pepperdine University's Graziadio Business School. 
The event followed a dinner on Nov 1 convening over 30 of LA's top people leaders, including speakers and VIPs from the event; including brands such as Ticketmaster, Comerica Bank, Walt Disney, Novartis, and more; and sponsored by Achievers, Northstar, Activate 180 and Emtrain. 
Check out 
this video
 to see more! And please contact 
missy@fromdayone.co
 to discuss sponsorship opportunities and speaking roles for future events. 
Our mailing address: From Day One, Inc. 18 Bridge St Ste 2F Brooklyn, NY 11201-1107 USA

You know what, now that I’m looking at my Teams notifications list, I do see that starting this past Monday, I’m getting notifications that begin with “An incoming email was logged on records you're following”.  And it’s odd because I’ve been checking both “Track” and “Log” on my Outlook plug-in every time I send an email to a client since I started in this role. I’ll look at my settings in HubSpot too.

 Pedro Seminario <
P.seminario@lcwmail.com
>; Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 FW: An email was logged on records you're following
 
Hi Rebecca & Pedro!
 
Looking at this email (see below) – I don’t think it is a change with the notification settings, but rather, Rebecca’s Outlook is set to log all emails. How this is set up is your preference; however, if you want to keep some emails private, you must remember to remove the check on the log and track settings in Outlook.   If this isn’t a preferred setting, Pedro knows how to change these settings.
 
You might want to consider reassigning the contacts in HubSpot to either of you.
 The workflows are set up because if one of my contacts fills out the website form, I will get alerted, but the two of you won’t. I don’t want to be a hiccup in the process.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

subject: Canceled: Quarterly Forum: “What are Clients Talking About?”
body:
Quarterly Forum: “What are Clients Talking About?”
Focused meeting where Consultants, BizDev, and fulltime Facilitators come 
prepared to share what clients have been talking about and asking for lately
 (pain points, needs, societal/cultural topics)
A successful meeting = valuable insights to shape and drive product, marketing, and business strategy
 
Agenda – please come prepared to answer the following questions: 
In first touches, what are your clients and prospects entering LCW needing or wanting? 
Over the past 6 months, what would you say are the top 2 or 3 requests, challenges, needs of your clients?
Over the past 6 months, what would you say are the top sales/requests? (EL/ML? Facilitation? Audits? CCLP? Learning Paths?)
What’s been a question you’ve asked clients that got to an a-ha or breakthrough moment? 
 
 
A Miro/whiteboard/parking lot will be available for topics that we don’t have time to get to or don’t adhere to the agenda questions

subject: Reminder: Create Financial Opportunities for You and Your Family — November 14
body:
Join us to learn insights on the current tax and investment landscape and explore strategies to help with year-end planning opportunities.
View in browser
 
 
 
Private Client Services: Create Financial Opportunities for You and Your Family
 
WEBINAR
  |  November 14  |  11 a.m. – noon CT
Register Now
 
Attend our complimentary webinar to learn insights on the current tax and investment landscape, as well as explore strategies to help with year-end planning opportunities.  We will share how you may benefit from a seamless, holistic client experience of integrated income tax, estate tax, risk management, and wealth management services. 
 
Year-end planning opportunities: 
Tax loss harvesting  
Qualified opportunity zones  
Rebalancing with eye towards asset location 
Required minimum distributions and qualified charitable distributions 
Charitable planning, including donor advised funds 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for individuals interested in market, economic, and tax updates.

You know what, now that I’m looking at my Teams notifications list, I do see that starting this past Monday, I’m getting notifications that begin with “An incoming email was logged on records you're following”.  And it’s odd because I’ve been checking both “Track” and “Log” on my Outlook plug-in every time I send an email to a client since I started in this role. I’ll look at my settings in HubSpot too.
 
Finally, I’m not clear on what you mean by the highlighted item below? 
 
Thank you!

 Pedro Seminario <
P.seminario@lcwmail.com
>; Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 FW: An email was logged on records you're following
 
Hi Rebecca & Pedro!
 
Looking at this email (see below) – I don’t think it is a change with the notification settings, but rather, Rebecca’s Outlook is set to log all emails. How this is set up is your preference; however, if you want to keep some emails private, you must remember to remove the check on the log and track settings in Outlook.   If this isn’t a preferred setting, Pedro knows how to change these settings.
 
You might want to consider reassigning the contacts in HubSpot to either of you.
 The workflows are set up because if one of my contacts fills out the website form, I will get alerted, but the two of you won’t. I don’t want to be a hiccup in the process.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
 
C. Melissa Neu
